description: Fake Description.
refuni: resh hiriq meteg yod qof sof-pasuq
changeuni: resh hiriq meteg yod qof sof-pasuq

description: Swap meteg=siluq (סֽ) and etnachta (ס֑).
refuni: lamed sheva shin sin-dot holam nun sheva alef qamats etnachta meteg yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: lamed sheva shin sin-dot holam nun sheva alef qamats meteg etnachta yod sof-pasuq
notes: This verse matches Deut 5:9.

The meteg (05bd) is the Lower accent; the etnachta (0591) is the Upper accent. In the LC the Lower accent, meteg, is placed before (right-to-left) the Upper accent, etnachta. The reference Unicode text places the Upper accent, etnachta, first.
The LC and text results appear to agree. Changing the mark order in the Unicode text reflects actual LC mark ordering and has no effect on the displayed text.
Recommended.

description: Swap meteg=siluq (סֽ) and etnachta (ס֑).
refuni: lamed sheva shin sin-dot holam nun sheva alef qamats etnachta meteg yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: lamed sheva shin sin-dot holam nun sheva alef qamats meteg etnachta yod sof-pasuq
notes: This verse matches Ex 20.5.

The meteg (05bd) is the Lower accent; the etnachta (0591) is the Upper accent. In the LC the Lower accent, meteg, is placed before (right-to-left) the Upper accent, etnachta. The reference Unicode text places the Upper accent, etnachta, first.
The LC and text results appear to agree. Changing the mark order in the Unicode text reflects actual LC mark ordering and has no effect on the displayed text.
Recommended.

description: Swap revia (ס֗) and gereshayim (ס֞).
refuni: vav sheva zayin qamats kaf patah resh sheva tav dagesh qamats gereshayim revia
changeuni: vav sheva zayin qamats kaf patah resh sheva tav dagesh qamats revia gereshayim
notes: The revia (0597) is the lower accent; the gereshayim (059e) is the upper accent. In the LC the lower accent, revia, is placed before (right-to-left) the upper accent, gereshshayim. The reference text places the upper accent, gereshayim, first.
The revia and gereshayim have the same combining group (11) and can be placed in any order without "breaking" the mark ordering of the text.
Recommended.

description: Swap merkha (ס֥) and mahapakh (ס֤).
refuni: bet dagesh sheva yod qamats mahapakh merkha dalet
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva yod qamats merkha mahapakh dalet
notes: The merkha (05a5) is the Lower accent; the mahapakh (05a4) is the Upper accent. In the LC the only the mahapakh is clear snd it appears after something. In changes 1-3, 5-8, the first accent in the LC is the lower accent, which in this case is the merkha. The reference text places the upper accent, mahapakh, first.

The merka and the mahapakh have the same combining group (7) and can be placed in any order without "breaking" the mark ordering of the text. The SBL Hebrew font doesn't display the changed ordering correctly. The reference ordering appears in Deut 5:10.1;whereas the changed ordering appears in Ex 20:6.1.
Recommended.

description: Swap munah (ס֣) and tipeha (ס֖).
refuni: vav sheva lamed holam tipeha munah alef
changeuni: vav sheva lamed holam munah tipeha alef
notes: The munah (05a3) is the lower accent; the tipeha (0596) is the upper accent. In the LC the munah appears to be first. The reference text places the upper accent, tipeha, first.
The munah and the tipeha have the same combining group (7) and can be placed in any order without "breaking" the mark ordering of the text. The proposed changes appear in Ex 20:14.1 and Ex 20:15.1.
Recommended.

description: Swap munah (ס֣) and tipeha (ס֖).
refuni: vav sheva lamed holam tipeha munah alef
changeuni: vav sheva lamed holam munah tipeha alef
notes: The munah (05a3) is the lower accent; the tipeha (0596) is the upper accent. In the LC the munah appears to be first. The reference text places the upper accent, tipeha, first.
The munah and the tipeha have the same combining group (7) and can be placed in any order without "breaking" the mark ordering of the text. The proposed changes appear in Ex 20:14.1 and Ex 20:15.1.
Recommended.

description: Swap zaqef-qaton (ס֔) and geresh (ס֜).
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh sheva bet hiriq yod ayin hiriq geresh zaqef-qatan yod
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh sheva bet hiriq yod ayin hiriq zaqef-qatan geresh yod
notes: The zaqef-qatan (0594) is the lower accent; the geresh (059c) is the upper accent. In the LC the zaqef-qatan appears to be first. The reference text places the upper accent, geresh, first.

The zaqef-qatan and the geresh have the same combining group (11) and can be placed in any order without "breaking" the mark ordering of the text. In Ex 20:10.2, the changed marks appear in the reference text correctly and match the LC.
Recommended.

description: Swap merkha (ס֥) and mahapakh (ס֤).
refuni: vav sheva ayin holam mahapakh merkha shin sin-dot segol he
changeuni: vav sheva ayin holam merkha mahapakh shin sin-dot segol he
notes: The merkha (05a5) is the lower accent; the mahapakh (05a4) is the upper accent. In the LC the merkha, the lower accent, is first. The reference text places the upper accent, mahapakh, first.

The merka and the mahapakh have the same combining group (7) and can be placed in any order without "breaking" the mark ordering of the text. The SBL Hebrew font doesn't display the changed ordering correctly. The reference ordering appears in Deut 5:10.1; whereas the changed ordering appears in the matching Ex 20:6.1.
Recommended.

The LC and text results appear to agree. Changing the mark order in the Unicode text reflects actual LC mark ordering and has no effect on the displayed text.
Recommended.

changeuni: tav dagesh rafe hiriq nun sheva alef qamats meteg etnachta final-pe sof-pasuq
notes: This is parallel to Deut 5:18.

The meteg (05bd) is the lower accent; the etnachta (0591) is the upper accent. In the LC the lower accent, meteg, is placed before (right-to-left) the upper accent, etnachta. The reference Unicode text places the Upper accent, etnachta, first.
The LC and text results appear to agree. Changing the mark order in the Unicode text reflects actual LC mark ordering and has no effect on the displayed text.
Recommended.

notes: This is parallel to Ex 20:14.

The meteg (05bd) is the lower accent; the etnachta (0591) is the upper accent. In the LC the lower accent, meteg, is placed before (right-to-left) the upper accent, etnachta. The reference Unicode text places the Upper accent, etnachta, first.
The LC and text results appear to agree. Changing the mark order in the Unicode text reflects actual LC mark ordering and has no effect on the displayed text.

changeuni: lamed tsere alef mem holam revia resh

description: Change merkha (ס֥) to tevir (ס֛).

changeuni: dalet sheva bet qamats resh segol tevir yod final-kaf qamats

description: Change merkha (ס֥) to tipeha (ס֖).
refuni: bet dagesh sheva bet tsere merkha yod tav
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva bet tsere tipeha yod tav

description: Change tipeha (ס֖) to merkha (ס֥).
refuni: alef hataf-patah dalet holam nun qamats tipeha yod vav
changeuni: alef hataf-patah dalet holam nun qamats merkha yod vav

description: Move patah to preceding nun.
refuni: pe dagesh qamats nun qamats meteg revia yod patah
changeuni: pe dagesh qamats nun qamats zero-width-joiner meteg patah revia yod
notes: This verse matches Deut 5:7.7.
The qamats is the Lower vowel for the nun, the patah is the Upper vowel for the nun.

The ordering of the marks under the nun is the same as in the LC. The zero-width-joiner before the meteg conforms to the SBL Hebrew recommendations for a central meteg. Nevertheless, font problems jumble the markings under the nun for the SBL Hebrew font and cause the patah to disappear for the Ezra SIL font.

description: Change pashta (ס֙) to qadma (ס֨) on yod.
refuni: vav sheva yod pashta vav holam final-mem pashta
changeuni: vav sheva yod qadma vav holam final-mem pashta
notes: This verse matches Deut 5:14.1.
The pashta (on the mem) is the Lower accent, the qadma (on the yod) is the Upper accent.
A small difference is discernible between qadma and pashta.

description: Move patah to preceding nun.
refuni: pe dagesh qamats nun qamats meteg revia yod patah sof-pasuq
changeuni: pe dagesh qamats nun qamats zero-width-joiner meteg patah revia yod
notes: This verse matches Ex 20:3.7.
The qamats is the Lower vowel for the nun, the patah is the Upper vowel for the nun.

The ordering of the marks under the nun is the same as in the LC. The zero-width-joiner before the meteg conforms to the SBL Hebrew recommendations for a central meteg. Nevertheless, font problems jumble the markings under the nun for the SBL Hebrew font and cause the patah to disappear for the Ezra SIL font.

description: Change pashta (ס֙) to qadma (ס֨) on yod.
refuni: vav sheva yod pashta vav holam final-mem pashta
changeuni: vav sheva yod qadma vav holam final-mem pashta
notes: This verse matches Ex 20:10.1.
The pashta (on the mem) is the Lower accent, the qadma (on the yod) is the Upper accent.
A small difference is discernible between qadma and pashta.

description: Add rafe to final he (הֿ), add note 'c'.
refuni: lamed sheva he patah munah ayin hataf-patah tsadi hiriq bet qamats zaqef-qatan he dagesh
changeuni: lamed sheva he patah munah ayin hataf-patah tsadi hiriq bet qamats zaqef-qatan he dagesh rafe
notes: Both the mappiq and the rafe are clearly present in the LC.

description: Remove dagesh (לּ)
refuni: mem hiriq lamed dagesh hiriq bet dagesh zaqef-qatan vav holam
changeuni: mem hiriq lamed hiriq bet dagesh zaqef-qatan vav holam
notes: No dagesh is present in the lamed in the LC.

description: Note a possible dagesh in bet ( בּ) but do not add dagesh, add transcription note t.
refuni: bet sheva nun tsere yod maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva nun tsere yod maqaf
notes: The dagesh is very light in the black and white facsimile at the Tanach.us site. When viewed with a high-resolution, color image from the Inscriptifact Digital Library, shown here, the dagesh nearly disappears.
Adding a note t, but leaving the dagesh out, 14 Dec 2020.

description: Move holam to qof.
refuni: qof vav holam qamats meteg yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: qof holam vav qamats meteg yod sof-pasuq
notes: This misplaced holam occurred in the translation from Michigan-Claremont coding to Unicode performed by the program WLC2XML. See the Coding page for more details. The two cases of this date, 2020.08.31, cover all instances of this problem in WLC 4.20.

description: Move holam to qof.
refuni: lamed sheva qof vav holam qamats zaqef-qatan vav
changeuni: lamed sheva qof holam vav qamats zaqef-qatan vav
notes: This misplaced holam is due to a coding error in the translation from Michigan-Claremont coding to Unicode performed by the program WLC2XML. The problem is that the MC-encoded vav, 'W', is followed by a morphological divider, '/' rather than a Hebrew character. Because the '/' is not a MC Hebrew vowel, the holam is placed, incorrectly, on the vav by the algorithm.

description: Change geresh muqdam to geresh.

changeuni: pe dagesh segol geresh tav patah het
notes: Plenty of space is available at the top of the pe to locate the geresh in more central position.

description: Change geresh muqdam to geresh.
refuni: shin shin-dot qubuts geresh-muqdam telisha-gedola bet vav dagesh
changeuni: shin shin-dot qubuts geresh telisha-gedola bet vav dagesh
notes: The upper markings, including the shin dot are very garbled.

description: Change ordinary word to ketiv word.

changeuni: alef hiriq final-mem maqaf

description: Change ordinary word to ketiv word.

changeuni: alef hiriq final-mem maqaf

notes: In the LC the etnacha and the meteg are at the same level. Thus the etnacha precedes the meteg.

changeuni: vav dagesh bet hiriq nun sheva final-kaf qamats meteg munah maqaf

refuni: tav dagesh rafe hiriq nun sheva alef qamats meteg etnachta final-pe sof-pasuq
changeuni: tav dagesh rafe hiriq nun sheva alef qamats etnachta cgj meteg final-pe sof-pasuq
notes: The etnacha is out-of-line relative to the other accents on the aleph. Its position is correct in reading from right to left, however.

description: In the LC the marks on the aleph are out of order, add a note c.
refuni: tav dagesh rafe hiriq nun sheva alef qamats meteg etnachta final-pe sof-pasuq
changeuni: tav dagesh rafe hiriq nun sheva alef qamats meteg etnachta final-pe sof-pasuq
notes: The upper cantillation marks on the aleph should end in a siluq, not an etnachta.
No change in text, add a note c.

description: Change qamats to patah, change note 'n' to 't'.
refuni: kaf dagesh qamats resh sheva mem hiriq merkha yod
changeuni: kaf dagesh patah resh sheva mem hiriq merkha yod
notes: The qamats on the kaf is generally accepted as anomalous; hence the transcription note 'n'.

The reference text is based on a black/white facsimile of the LC. In the black/white facsimile Beck & Freedman, the dot in the qamats is dark and well-shaped. The color facsimile provided by the author (shown here) shows the dot is brown and possibly an artifact.
If the dot does not represent scribal intent, the qamats becomes a patah, and the word is no longer anomalous.
Note: The dot is to the left of the center of the patah bar.
The note will be changed to t, "Transcription uncertain".

description: Add note 'c' because of multiple accents on word.
refuni: zayin segol gereshayim telisha-gedola he
changeuni: zayin segol gereshayim telisha-gedola he
notes: The gereshayim and telisha-gedola is unusual, but not impossible.

description: Change note 'n' to note 'c' because of multiple accents on word.
refuni: nun dagesh holam alef kaf patah mahapakh tipeha lamed
changeuni: nun dagesh holam alef kaf patah mahapakh tipeha lamed
notes: Two markings on this word are a peculiarity of the Leningrad Codex.

The mahapakh doesn't make sense as an alternative to the tipeha. There is no tradition of what a combined mahapakh-tipeha would mean. There is no tradition of a specialized presentation of alternatives as in the Decalogues/Reuven Saga.
Adding a note c.

description: Add note 'c' because of multiple accents on word.
refuni: zayin holam gereshayim telisha-gedola alef tav
changeuni: zayin holam gereshayim telisha-gedola alef tav
notes: The gereshayim and telisha-gedola is unusual, but not impossible.

description: Remove dagesh from resh, add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva nun qamats he qamats resh dagesh pashta
changeuni: vav sheva nun qamats he qamats resh pashta
notes: The dagesh in the resh is unexpected.

The reference text is based on a black/white facsimile of the LC. In the black/white facsimile the dot in the resh is dark and slightly irregular. The color facsimile, above, the dot is brown with an attached, smaller, darker dash. The dagesh is probably an artifact.
Note: The color page has a scattering of similar brown dots, such as ones above the nun in the word.
Note: Masora Circle over the word refers to the number '4' in the left margin.

description: Remove mappiq/dagesh from he, add note 't'.
refuni: het hataf-patah mem holam resh tsere yod he dagesh segol etnachta final-mem
changeuni: het hataf-patah mem holam resh tsere yod he segol etnachta final-mem
notes: The mappiq/dagesh in the he is unexpected grammatically and dubious in the LC.

The reference text is based on a black/white facsimile of the LC. In the black/white facsimile the dot in the he is dark and regular. The color facsimile, above, the dot is brown and somewhat larger than normal. The mappiq/dagesh is probably an artifact.

The author credits this observation to Prof. Avraham Tal of Tel Aviv University. Ben Denckla notes that the correction is also in Viktor Golinets, "Dages, Mappiq, Specks on Vellum, and Editing of the Codex Leningradensis", KUSATU 15/2013, p. 250 (2013).

description: Add hiriq to het, add note 't'.

changeuni: het hiriq kaf dagesh tipeha vav holam
notes: The het lacks any vowel. A slight hint of a hireq is visible.
The JPS Tanakh (1999) has a hiriq on the het.

description: Change zaqef qatan on pe to revia, add note 't'.

changeuni: nun holam pe tsere revia lamed
notes: Two dots over the pe might be taken as revias. One is almost touching the top of the pe, the other is above thge gap between the pe and the lamed. The revia on top of the pe is small and faint. Compare with the revias in 7:7.10 immediately above it or in the same verse at 7:8.24. It's very difficult to decide the correct accent.
The upper dot of the zaqaf qatan might be considered hidden by the munah in 7:7.6 immediately above it. The JPS Tanakh has a zaqef qatan.
The sefaria.org "Miqra_according_to_the_Masora" shows a revia instead of a zaqef qatan.

description: Remove dagesh from final he, change note from 'c' to 't'.

The high resolution, color image of the page shows that the dagesh is light, redish, and likely to be an artifact.
The lack of a dagesh on the consonant with a rafe agrees with usual Masoretic practice.

description: Remove zero-width-joiner (ZWJ).

changeuni: pe dagesh qamats nun qamats meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah revia yod

The ZWJ is no longer needed for mark positioning. Change is invisible.

description: Move merkha from resh to zayin.
refuni: zayin qamats resh merkha vav dagesh
changeuni: zayin qamats merkha resh vav dagesh

description: Unusual order of accents on nun; add note 'c'.
refuni: nun patah revia geresh het sheva lamed qamats he
changeuni: nun patah revia geresh het sheva lamed qamats he
notes: Here the LC has a revia followed by a geresh-shaped mark. This is probably an unusual presentation of the two-mark accent revia mugrash. The usual encoding of a revia mugrash (241 instances) is a geresh muqdam (x059d), a prepositive mark, followed by revia (x0597).

The UXLC encodes this single-incidence text as a revia followed by (plain) geresh (x059c). (An alternative encoding would be a revia followed by a geresh muqdam; however, this would place a prepositive mark after the revia.)

description: Replace holam with revia, add note 't'.
refuni: alef hataf-patah zero-width-joiner meteg dalet holam nun qamats yod
changeuni: alef hataf-patah zero-width-joiner meteg dalet nun qamats revia yod
notes: The LC has a dot above the nun. The transcription problem is to determine whether the dot is a holam or a revia. If the dot represents a holam, then the word is without an accent; if it represents a revia it lacks an expected vowel.

Seth (Avi) Kadish points out: "Many masoretic manuscripts leave out the ḥolam dot in the divine name as a rule, and some do so even when it is spelled אדני. While the LC itself normally has the ḥolam dot in the spelling אדני, here it does not. This should be considered an anomaly rather than an error, and the dot that appears directly over the letter נ should be understood as a revia` rather than ḥolam. It is even possible that the single dot is intended to serve both purposes."

description: Change qadma to a revia.
refuni: het hataf-patah mem qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats qadma
changeuni: het hataf-patah mem qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats revia

description: Add sheva to second lamed, remove dagesh from vav, add note 'c'.
refuni: he patah meteg lamed sheva lamed vav dagesh yod qamats qadma he dagesh space paseq
changeuni: he patah meteg lamed sheva lamed sheva vav yod qamats qadma he dagesh space paseq
notes: The LC clearly has a sheva on the second lamed and lacks a dagesh on the vav.
The normal spelling would have no sheva on the second lamed and would have a dagesh on the vav. The LC is anomalous and the UXLC replicates it correctly.
A hint of a maqaf might be seen between the vav and the yod. The immediately preceding word in Ps 105:45.6 shows a very distinct maqaf, however.

description: Move patach to ayin, add note 't'.
refuni: he vav holam pe hiriq meteg yod patah ayin sof-pasuq
changeuni: he vav holam pe hiriq meteg yod ayin patah sof-pasuq
notes: In the LC, the patach appears to belong to the yod, not the ayin. The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) assigns the patach to the ayin, which is what would be expected grammatically: a furtive patach on ayin. The UXLC transcription does the same as MAM: it assigns the patach to the ayin. That is, the UXLC transcription assumes that the scribe's placement of this patach is just an extreme example of the normal "early" (right-biased) placement of a furtive patach.

description: Move patach to ayin.
refuni: he patah mem dagesh patah shin sin-dot sheva bet dagesh hiriq munah yod patah ayin
changeuni: he patah mem dagesh patah shin sin-dot sheva bet dagesh hiriq munah yod ayin patah
notes: In the LC the patach is located between the yod and the ayin. It's probably a furtive patach, and thus should be coded as belonging to the ayin not the yod. (It is normal for the scribe to give a furtive patach an "early" (right-biased) placement.)

description: Add maqaf, change tipeha to meteg, add note 't'.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats tipeha
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats meteg maqaf
notes: The maqaf is clear in the LC.

The accent under the qamats of the final kaf could be either a tipeha, a primary accent, or a meteg, a secondary accent. A tipeha is a diagonal line from northwest to southeast, a meteg is a vertical line. When a maqaf is added to this word it becomes a poetic word with the following word, Ps 31:2.2. Poetic words normally contain a single primary accent. Word Ps 31:2.2 has a clear primary munah accent, thus the accent in question is likely to be a meteg, a secondary accent.
Dotan (Biblia Hebraica Leningradensia, 2001) has a meteg for the accent in question.

description: Remove dagesh from tav.
refuni: tav dagesh hiriq dalet sheva resh holam meteg shin shin-dot sof-pasuq

description: The split into two words is correct; add note 'c'.
refuni: pe dagesh merkha vav holam tet hiriq yod
changeuni: pe dagesh merkha vav holam tet hiriq yod
notes: The two Egyptian names פוטיפר and פוטיפרע are similar, but have different word divisions based on their accents and Masorah Parva (Mp) notes in the margins.

The following translations are from The Contemporary Torah, JPS, 2006, available as the English translation at the "Sefaria: Miqra according to the Masorah" link. פוטיפר is written Potiphar, and described as "a courtier of Pharaoh and his prefect." Potiphar occurs twice: Gen 37:36.6 and 39:1.5. פוטיפרע is written Poti-phera and described as "priest of On". Poti-phera occurs 3 times: Gen 41:45.12, 41:50.14, and 46:20.10.

The LC text displays both פוטיפר and פוטיפרע without spacing indicating word divisions. However, both the accents and the Mp notes indicate that פוטיפרע, Poti-phera, should be considered as two words: פוטי פרע. When the LC text displays the 2 Potiphar cases פוטיפר has a single primary accent; when the LC text displays the three Poti-phera cases both פוטי and פרע have a single primary accent. Breuer suggests that the primary accents are the masorete's way to indicate separate words within the text (since it would have been very difficult for the masorete to insert a space between them after the consonants were written). Gen 41:45 and 41:50 are also accompanied by Mp notes תרתין מילין כתׄ ("Written as two words"). The Poti-phera case in Gen 46:20.10 does not have a similar Mp note, but has primary accents on both פוטי and פרע.
The UXLC follows the accents and Mp notes; it represents all 3 Poti-phera cases as word pairs.

changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats tipeha geresh tav

description: Remove dagesh from shin.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats tipeha tav
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats tipeha tav

description: Remove dagesh from he.
refuni: lamed dagesh qamats meteg he dagesh sof-pasuq
changeuni: lamed dagesh qamats meteg he sof-pasuq

description: Remove sof pasuq; add note 'c'.
refuni: yod sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed dagesh tsere meteg final-mem sof-pasuq
changeuni: yod sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed dagesh tsere meteg final-mem

description: Add dagesh to second yod; add note 't'.
refuni: tav dagesh hiriq meteg he sheva yod segol pashta yod final-nun qamats pashta
changeuni: tav dagesh hiriq meteg he sheva yod segol pashta yod dagesh final-nun qamats pashta
notes: The dagesh in the LC is well-positioned, well-sized, but reddish. The text has high quality in this region.

description: Add dagesh on bet; add note 't'.
refuni: kaf dagesh patah resh sheva kaf dagesh holam merkha bet
changeuni: kaf dagesh patah resh sheva kaf dagesh holam merkha bet dagesh
notes: The dagesh in the LC is well-positioned, well-sized, but slightly reddish.

description: Remove dagesh from first shin.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh qamats darga he
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh qamats darga he

description: Remove dagesh from shin.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats tipeha tav
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats tipeha tav

description: Add dagesh to yod.
refuni: vav patah yod sheva shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh tsere merkha resh
changeuni: vav patah yod sheva dagesh shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh tsere merkha resh

description: Change sin-dot to shin-dot on shin.
refuni: vav qamats shin sin-dot segol meteg he sof-pasuq
changeuni: vav qamats shin shin-dot segol meteg he sof-pasuq

description: Remove dagesh on shin.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq

description: Add dagesh to first vav.
refuni: tet qamats vav tipeha vav dagesh
changeuni: tet qamats vav dagesh tipeha vav dagesh
notes: The dagesh in the LC is well-positioned, dark, and nearly attached to the vav.

description: Remove maqaf; add note 'c'.
refuni: vav sheva meteg kaf qamats lamed maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva meteg kaf qamats lamed
notes: This word lacks an accent.

description: Add dagesh to vav.
refuni: he patah lamed sheva vav hiriq yod dagesh hiriq zaqef-qatan final-mem
changeuni: he patah lamed sheva vav dagesh hiriq yod dagesh hiriq zaqef-qatan final-mem

description: Change zaqef-qatan to revia on tav.
refuni: alef holam tav zaqef-qatan vav holam
changeuni: alef holam tav revia vav holam

description: Change mahapakh to yetiv on alef.
refuni: alef mahapakh vav holam
changeuni: alef yetiv vav holam

description: Remove dagesh from bet.
refuni: bet dagesh patah shin shin-dot dagesh qamats meteg mem segol final-nun sof-pasuq
changeuni: bet patah shin shin-dot dagesh qamats meteg mem segol final-nun sof-pasuq

description: Add meteg after patah on ayin; add note 't'.
refuni: ayin patah lamed maqaf
changeuni: ayin patah meteg lamed maqaf
notes: The meteg is light, but well shaped.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: vav sheva alef segol meteg tav maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva alef segol meteg tav

description: Remove dagesh from both yod and tav; add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq tav dagesh tsere qadma final-nun
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq tav tsere qadma final-nun
notes: No dagesh at all on the yod. There is a possible, very faint dagesh on the tav.

description: Remove dagesh on yod; add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof dagesh patah qadma het
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq qof dagesh patah qadma het
notes: A possible dagesh on the yod is very faint.

description: Remove dagesh on yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof dagesh patah mahapakh het
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq qof dagesh patah mahapakh het

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq tav dagesh sheva nun mahapakh vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq tav dagesh sheva nun mahapakh vav dagesh

description: Move merkha to bet; add note 'c'.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats lamed merkha vav dagesh lamed
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats merkha lamed vav dagesh lamed
notes: A merkha can not be on the bet for vocalization; it belongs on the lamed. The mark in the LC is ill-positioned.

description: Remove dagesh from tsadi.
refuni: he patah tsadi dagesh hiriq pe dagesh holam darga resh
changeuni: he patah tsadi hiriq pe dagesh holam darga resh

description: Change sin-dot to shin-dot.
refuni: he patah yod dagesh hiriq shin sin-dot sheva resh sheva alef tsere lamed hiriq zaqef-qatan yod tav
changeuni: he patah yod dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva resh sheva alef tsere lamed hiriq zaqef-qatan yod tav

description: Add dagesh to first he.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats he sheva shin shin-dot patah mem dagesh qamats he pashta
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats he dagesh sheva shin shin-dot patah mem dagesh qamats he pashta

description: Remove dagesh from shin.
refuni: het hataf-patah mem hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh qamats mahapakh he
changeuni: het hataf-patah mem hiriq shin shin-dot qamats mahapakh he

description: Move meteg to he, placing a Combining Grapheme Joiner (CGJ, x034f) after it to force mark order.
refuni: vav sheva meteg he patah ayin hataf-patah mem patah dalet sheva tav dagesh qamats munah
changeuni: vav sheva he meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah ayin hataf-patah mem patah dalet sheva tav dagesh qamats munah

description: Remove maqaf.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva yod patah dalet maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva yod patah dalet

description: Place etnachta before hireq on mem, placing a Combining Grapheme Joiner (CGJ, x034f) after it to force mark order.
refuni: bet hiriq nun sheva yod qamats mem hiriq etnahta final-nun
changeuni: bet hiriq nun sheva yod qamats mem etnahta combining-grapheme-joiner hiriq final-nun

description: Replace segol under bet with qamats; add note 'c'.
refuni: bet dagesh segol final-nun maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats final-nun maqaf
notes: A qamats is unexpected here.

description: Remove maqaf on yod; add 't' note.
refuni: vav sheva alef patah munah het hataf-patah resh tsere yod maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva alef patah munah het hataf-patah resh tsere yod
notes: Very, very slight evidence of a maqef between the yod and the bet.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh qamats alef hataf-patah resh munah vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh qamats alef hataf-patah resh munah vav dagesh

description: Possible dagesh in nun, add note 't'.
refuni: alef qamats bet qamats meteg dalet sheva nun vav dagesh sof-pasuq
changeuni: alef qamats bet qamats meteg dalet sheva nun vav dagesh sof-pasuq
notes: The dagesh is smaller than expected and slightly too high. Not expected grammatically.

description: Possible segol on aleph, no text change, add note 't'.
refuni: he qamats alef tsere tipeha lamed dagesh segol he
changeuni: he qamats alef tsere tipeha lamed dagesh segol he
notes: The lowest dot of the segol is reddish, but has good size and position. A segol is unexpected here, however.

description: Remove dagesh on yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq vav dagesh qamats lamed tsere munah dalet
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq vav dagesh qamats lamed tsere munah dalet

description: Move upper-dot from resh to second vav.
refuni: vav sheva ayin hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats resh upper-dot vav holam final-nun pashta
changeuni: vav sheva ayin hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats resh vav holam upper-dot final-nun pashta

description: Move move munah from first vav to yod.
refuni: vav patah munah yod dagesh holam alef mem sheva resh zaqef-qatan vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh munah holam alef mem sheva resh zaqef-qatan vav dagesh

description: Remove dagesh from yod, add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh patah het hataf-patah nun vav dagesh pashta
changeuni: vav patah meteg yod patah het hataf-patah nun vav dagesh pashta
notes: The yod appears on top of a splotch in the paper. A slight darkening in that splotch might be a yod. A dagesh on the yod is expected, however.

description: Possible dagesh in he, add note 't'.
refuni: pe dagesh sheva dalet patah he sheva alef tsere tipeha lamed
changeuni: pe dagesh sheva dalet patah he sheva alef tsere tipeha lamed
notes: A possible dagesh appears in the he. It is well-positioned, but light, with a darker portion to the northeast. A dagesh in the he (mapiq) is unlikely here.

description: Remove dagesh from yod; add 't' note.
refuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh hiriq qof sheva resh sheva bet gershayim vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah meteg yod hiriq qof sheva resh sheva bet gershayim vav dagesh
notes: No dagesh apparent although one is expected grammatically.

description: Change meteg to munah on nun.
refuni: tav dagesh hiriq nun dagesh qamats meteg gimel sheva pe zaqef-qatan vav dagesh
changeuni: tav dagesh hiriq nun dagesh qamats munah gimel sheva pe zaqef-qatan vav dagesh
notes: The munah is clear, however, the word already has a zaqef-qatan.

description: Change revia on tav to zaqef-qatan.
refuni: alef hiriq tav dagesh qamats revia nun vav dagesh
changeuni: alef hiriq tav dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan nun vav dagesh
notes: The lower dot of the zaqef-qatan is damaged, but dark and well-positioned.

description: Place munah before mahapakh on first shin; add note 'c'.
refuni: shin shin-dot tsere mahapakh munah shin shin-dot segol tav
changeuni: shin shin-dot tsere munah mahapakh shin shin-dot segol tav
notes: The LC mark order, munah-then-mahapakh, is likely to be out of the usual lower-then-upper trope mark order.

description: Change tipeha to merkha on vav, place munah before merkha; add note 'c'.
refuni: lamed patah yod he vav qamats tipeha munah he
changeuni: lamed patah yod he vav qamats munah merkha he
notes: The LC mark order, munah-then-tipeha, is likely to be out of the usual lower-then-upper trope mark order.

description: Change pashta on final-kaf to qadma.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed dagesh tsere meteg het hataf-patah final-kaf qamats pashta
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed dagesh tsere meteg het hataf-patah final-kaf qamats qadma
notes: A qadma better represents the mark on the final-kaf .

description: Add dagesh to mem.
refuni: mem hiriq qof dagesh hiriq resh sheva bet dagesh segol meteg final-kaf qamats sof-pasuq
changeuni: mem dagesh hiriq qof dagesh hiriq resh sheva bet dagesh segol meteg final-kaf qamats sof-pasuq

description: Change accent on nun to tipeha; add note 't'.
refuni: mem hiriq lamed dagesh hiriq pe sheva nun tsere merkha yod
changeuni: mem hiriq lamed dagesh hiriq pe sheva nun tsere tipeha yod
notes: The accent on the nun is probably a tipeha.
The next change, Deut 17:18.15, is compatible with this change.

description: Change accent on nun to merkha; add note 't'.
refuni: he patah kaf dagesh holam he hataf-patah nun hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
changeuni: he patah kaf dagesh holam he hataf-patah nun hiriq merkha yod final-mem
notes: The accent on the nun is probably a merkha.
The previous change, Deut 17:18.14, is compatible with this change.
This additional change was suggested by Benjamin Denckla.

description: Change accent on shin from geresh to revia; add note 't'.
refuni: tav dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot segol geresh he
changeuni: tav dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot segol revia he
notes: The text is of very poor quality.
The change of the geresh to a revia was suggested by Benjamin Denckla.

description: Remove dagesh from dalet.
refuni: dalet dagesh qamats resh holam qadma shin shin-dot
changeuni: dalet qamats resh holam qadma shin shin-dot

description: Change qamats on pe to patah.
refuni: tav sheva pe qamats alef tsere tipeha resh
changeuni: tav sheva pe patah alef tsere tipeha resh

description: Add dagesh to mem; add note 't'.
refuni: tav dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva mem patah ayin pashta
changeuni: tav dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva mem dagesh patah ayin pashta
notes: The mem is faint, but well-positioned.

description: Sheva on bet is uncertain; add note 't'.
refuni: bet sheva he patah mem sheva tav dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats tipeha
changeuni: bet sheva he patah mem sheva tav dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats tipeha
notes: The cluster of ink below the bet is lighter and shaped differently than shevas in the same word.

description: Change qamats on he to patah.
refuni: he qamats ayin hiriq vav dagesh tsere resh pashta
changeuni: he patah ayin hiriq vav dagesh tsere resh pashta

description: Remove qadma from kaf.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva kaf qamats qadma lamed maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva kaf qamats qadma lamed maqaf
changeuni_gen: bet dagesh sheva kaf qamats lamed maqaf

description: Add note 't'.
refuni: yod patah ayin sheva lamed tsere mahapakh final-mem
changeuni: yod patah ayin sheva lamed tsere mahapakh final-mem
notes: The dagesh in the lamed is well-positioned, but light and unexpected.

description: Add maqaf; add note 'c'.
refuni: vav sheva resh qamats mahapakh bet sheva tsadi qamats he
changeuni: vav sheva resh qamats mahapakh bet sheva tsadi qamats he maqaf
notes: The maqaf is unexpected as this word and the following word both have accents.
The presence of a maqaf here in the LC is disputed among scholars.

description: Remove segol from sin, add 'c' note. (#2)
refuni: he patah dalet dagesh segol revia shin shin-dot segol final-nun
changeuni: he patah dalet dagesh segol revia shin shin-dot final-nun

description: Confused markings on aleph, no text change, add 't' note. (#3)
refuni: alef hataf-segol lamed holam he hiriq revia yod final-mem
changeuni: alef hataf-segol lamed holam he hiriq revia yod final-mem
notes: Confused markings on aleph.

description: Remove meteg (and associated CGJ) from vav.
refuni: vav meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah yod sheva het hiriq munah yod
changeuni: vav patah yod sheva het hiriq munah yod
notes: An apparent erasure in front and below the vav may have been taken as a meteg.

description: Add note 'm' for possible merkha rather than meteg under the gimel.
refuni: gimel dagesh qamats meteg bet sheva resh tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: gimel dagesh qamats meteg bet sheva resh tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line under the gimel lacks a northeast-southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the gimel.

description: Add maqaf between first resh and lamed.
refuni: kaf dagesh sheva dalet qamats resh sheva lamed qamats ayin holam pashta mem segol resh pashta
changeuni: kaf dagesh sheva dalet qamats resh sheva lamed qamats ayin holam pashta mem segol resh pashta
notes: An erasure between the first resh and lamed exists, representing the intent of the writer(s), not textual decay.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) displays this as a single word.

description: Add maqaf between first resh and lamed.
refuni: kaf dagesh sheva dalet qamats resh sheva lamed qamats ayin holam etnahta mem segol resh
changeuni: kaf dagesh sheva dalet qamats resh sheva lamed qamats ayin holam etnahta mem segol resh
notes: An erasure between the first resh and lamed may exist, representing the intent of the writer(s), not textual decay.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) displays this as a single word.

description: Add maqaf between first resh and lamed.
refuni: kaf dagesh sheva dalet qamats resh sheva lamed qamats ayin holam geresh mem segol resh
changeuni: kaf dagesh sheva dalet qamats resh sheva lamed qamats ayin holam geresh mem segol resh
notes: An erasure between the first resh and lamed may exist, representing the intent of the writer(s), not textual decay.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) displays this as a single word.

description: Place maqaf between first resh and lamed (Change made previously in changes of 2021.04.01).
refuni: kaf dagesh sheva dalet qamats resh maqaf lamed qamats ayin holam zaqef-qatan mem segol resh
changeuni: kaf dagesh sheva dalet qamats resh maqaf lamed qamats ayin holam zaqef-qatan mem segol resh
notes: This change is already in the UXLC text from the 2021.04.01 changes, item 2021.02.22 - 3, by Stephen Salisbury.
Speculation: The distance between the first resh and the lamed was too narrow to permit erasure as in Gen 14:1.9, 14:4.6, and 14:9.2.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has no maqaf between the first resh and the lamed.

description: Change merkha on dalet to a meteg. Add 'm' note.
refuni: pe dagesh patah dalet dagesh segol merkha nun qamats meteg he
changeuni: pe dagesh patah dalet dagesh segol meteg nun qamats meteg he
notes: The near-vertical line associated with the dalet lacks a northeast-southwest inclination. The near-vertical line associated with the nun lacks a northeast-southwest inclination. The UXLC text will be changed to have a meteg under the dalet to correspond to its appearance in the Leningrad Codex.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the dalet and meteg under the nun.

description: Remove dagesh from first shin.
refuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats shin kaf qamats meteg resh sof-pasuq
changeuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot qamats shin kaf qamats meteg resh sof-pasuq

description: Change meteg under het to merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: het qamats meteg tet sheva alef tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: het qamats merkha tet sheva alef tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line under the het has a slight northeast-southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the het.

description: Add maqaf between the first he and the zayin.
refuni: lamed qamats merkha mem dagesh qamats he space zayin dagesh segol tipeha he
changeuni: lamed qamats merkha mem dagesh qamats he maqaf zayin dagesh segol tipeha he
notes: The putative maqaf is very faint. A maqaf at this point would place two accents on a single poetic word.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) does not have a maqaf between these words.

description: Change the merkha under the tav to a tevir.
refuni: vav sheva nun qamats tav patah tav dagesh hiriq merkha yod
changeuni: vav sheva nun qamats tav patah tav dagesh hiriq merkha yod
notes: The putative tevir dot is very faint. The text has other weak dots in the vicinity.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) does not have a tevir on this word.

description: Change meteg under nun to merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva nun qamats meteg tav sheva nun tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: vav sheva nun qamats merkha tav sheva nun tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line on the nun has a very slight northeast-southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the nun.

description: Move meteg from yod to first vav, add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot tipeha vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot tipeha vav dagesh
notes: The meteg is under the patah of the vav.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has the meteg under the yod as would be expected.

description: Add note 'm' for possible merkha rather than meteg under yod.
refuni: yod qamats meteg tsadi sheva alef tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: yod qamats meteg tsadi sheva alef tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line on the yod has the wrong inclination (northwest-southeast) for a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the yod.

description: Extraneous dot under he, add 't' note. (#8)
refuni: he patah het tsere pashta lamed segol bet pashta
changeuni: he patah het tsere pashta lamed segol bet pashta
notes: The dot before the patah might be considered part of a hataf mark before the patah. The dot in question is lighter than surrounding dots; the lower dot of the putative hataf mark is the shin mark on the word שׁ֣וֹק of the following line.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a patah under the he.

description: Dagesh on second mem is faint. Add note 't.
refuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh segol geresh nun dagesh qamats he
changeuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh segol geresh nun dagesh qamats he
notes: The dagesh in the second mem is faint and off-centered.

description: Add note 'm' for possible merkha rather than meteg under yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere meteg tsadi sheva alef tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere meteg tsadi sheva alef tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line on the yod lacks the northeast-southwest inclination for a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the yod.

description: Change qamats under the resh to a hataf qamats.
refuni: resh qamats het sheva bet dagesh geresh vav holam
changeuni: resh qamats het sheva bet dagesh geresh vav holam
notes: The putative hataf dots are noticeably lower than the qamats. The text has many dots floating around in this area.

description: Replace meteg under resh with merkha.
refuni: tsadi vav dagesh resh hiriq meteg yod
changeuni: tsadi vav dagesh resh hiriq meteg yod
notes: The next word is the last in the verse and necessarily contains a meteg in the role of a siluq. The putative merkha is parallel to this meteg and lacks the northeast to southwest inclination of a merkha. The space to the next word has an erasure may have contained a maqaf.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a meteg on the resh and doesn't split this word from the next with a maqaf.

description: Add note 't' as text is damaged.
refuni: lamed sheva pe qamats nun qamats yod vav pashta
changeuni: lamed sheva pe qamats nun qamats yod vav pashta
notes: The lower half of the word is damaged.
The current text agrees with that of the Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM).

description: Add sheva under resh. Merge with following word.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg het patah resh space alef patah darga final-pe
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg het patah resh sheva alef patah darga final-pe
notes: Merging this word with following word produces a properly-accented word and is accepted elsewhere.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a maqaf on this word connecting it to the next word which has an accent. It does not have a sheva on the resh.

description: Add note 'm' for possible merkha rather than meteg under first nun.
refuni: vav sheva nun qamats meteg tav sheva nun tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: vav sheva nun qamats meteg tav sheva nun tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line under the nun lacks a northeast-southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the nun.

description: Change patah on aleph to qamats.
refuni: he qamats alef hataf-patah tav qamats resh hiriq etnahta yod final-mem
changeuni: he qamats alef hataf-patah tav qamats resh hiriq etnahta yod final-mem
notes: The putative qamats dot is lighter than those on the sheva on the aleph or the qamats on the following letter.

description: Dagesh on dalet is light. Add 't' note.
refuni: he patah dalet dagesh segol zaqef-qatan resh segol final-kaf sheva
changeuni: he patah dalet dagesh segol zaqef-qatan resh segol final-kaf sheva
notes: The dagesh on the dalet is light, but well positioned.

description: Add note 'm' for possible merkha rather than meteg under het.
refuni: tav dagesh tsere het qamats meteg lamed sheva tsadi tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: tav dagesh tsere het qamats meteg lamed sheva tsadi tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line under the gimel lacks a northeast-southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the het.

description: Consider possible vav between aleph and tav.
refuni: he qamats meteg resh holam alef holam zaqef-qatan tav
changeuni: he qamats meteg resh holam alef holam zaqef-qatan tav
notes: The contents of the space between the aleph and the tav are faint and uncertain.

description: Replace meteg under nun with munah.
refuni: vav dagesh bet sheva nun tsere meteg yod
changeuni: vav dagesh bet sheva nun tsere munah yod

description: Place pashta above sin, replace merkha with meteg below. Add note 't'.
refuni: tav patah ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot segol merkha he maqaf
changeuni: tav patah ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot segol pashta meteg he maqaf
notes: This text is in a Decalogue and is expected to have dual accents.
The mark above the sin is small and light, starting on the rightmost leg of the sin. The near-vertical line below the shin is faint, short and broken, more likely to be a meteg than merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a pashta over the shin and a meteg below.

description: Interchange order of tevir and munah on mem so that the tevir comes first.
refuni: shin shin-dot qamats mem munah tevir vav holam resh
changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats mem tevir munah vav holam resh
notes: This text is in a Decalogue and is expected to have dual accents.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has tevir then the munah on the mem.

description: Change meteg under tsadi to tipeha.
refuni: tav dagesh rafe hiriq resh sheva tsadi qamats meteg het sof-pasuq
changeuni: tav dagesh rafe hiriq resh sheva tsadi qamats tipeha het sof-pasuq
notes: This text is in a Decalogue and is expected to have dual accents.
Only one accent is below the tsadi and it's curved like a tipeha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has tipeha then meteg under the tsadi.

description: Add dagesh to tav.
refuni: tav holam alef bet tsere dalet etnahta vav dagesh final-nun
changeuni: tav dagesh holam alef bet tsere dalet etnahta vav dagesh final-nun
notes: The dagesh is dark and well-positioned.

description: Add note 'm' for possible merkha rather than meteg under nun.
refuni: nun qamats meteg samekh sheva ayin tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: nun qamats meteg samekh sheva ayin tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line under the gimel lacks a northeast-southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the nun.

description: Change meteg to merkha under yod.
refuni: yod qamats meteg dalet sheva final-kaf qamats tevir
changeuni: yod qamats merkha dalet sheva final-kaf qamats tevir
notes: The near-vertical line under the yod moves distinctly from northeast to southwest. This is the best example of a merkha in these changes.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the yod.

description: Change meteg to merkha under yod. Add 't' note.
refuni: yod holam meteg shin shin-dot sheva bet tsere tevir yod
changeuni: yod holam merkha shin shin-dot sheva bet tsere tevir yod
notes: The near-vertical line under the yod moves slightly from northeast to southwest. Note that the line appears to be made two overwritten lines, one of which is vertical.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the yod.

description: Replace meteg under pe with merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav dagesh pe qamats meteg qof sheva dalet tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: vav dagesh pe qamats merkha qof sheva dalet tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line on the pe has a very slight northeast-southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the pe.

description: Add pashta over aleph.
refuni: vav sheva resh qamats alef hiriq yod tav qamats pashta
changeuni: vav sheva resh qamats alef hiriq yod tav qamats pashta
notes: The vertical line between the aleph and the yod is from the tevir on the previous verse, Deut 20:11.8. The smudge on the upper, right arm of the aleph doesn't have enough form to be considered a pashta.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a pashta over both the aleph and the tav.

description: Change meteg under bet to merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav dagesh bet qamats meteg kaf sheva tav qamats tevir he
changeuni: vav dagesh bet qamats merkha kaf sheva tav qamats tevir he
notes: The near-vertical line on the bet has a slight northeast-southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the bet.

description: Add note 'm' for possible merkha rather than meteg under lamed.
refuni: vav sheva lamed qamats meteg qof sheva het tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: vav sheva lamed qamats meteg qof sheva het tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line on the lamed doesn't incline from northeast to southwest. Its inclination is less than on the tipeha on the same word.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the lamed.

description: Change meteg under aleph to merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva alef qamats meteg mem sheva resh tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: vav sheva alef qamats merkha mem sheva resh tevir vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line on the aleph has a slight curvature, northeast to southwest. Its inclination is comparable to that of the tipeha on the same word.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha rather than a meteg under the aleph.

description: Remove dagesh from tsadi.
refuni: bet dagesh patah meteg tsadi dagesh qamats he hataf-qamats resh patah revia yod hiriq final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh patah meteg tsadi qamats he hataf-qamats resh patah revia yod hiriq final-mem

description: Markings under the second tsadi are smudged. Add note 't'.
refuni: he patah tsadi dagesh sheva lamed qamats tsadi patah meteg lamed sof-pasuq
changeuni: he patah tsadi dagesh sheva lamed qamats tsadi patah meteg lamed sof-pasuq
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a patah then meteg under the second tsadi.

description: Markings under the kaf are smudged. Add note 't'.
refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq meteg yod maqaf
changeuni: kaf dagesh hiriq meteg yod maqaf
notes: The text in this area is in bad shape. The markings under the kaf are smudged and the maqaf is very faint.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a hiriq then meteg under the kaf.

description: Change sheva under yod to hiriq; change munah on shin to meteg. Add note 't'.
refuni: yod sheva he vav holam shin shin-dot qubuts munah ayin patah maqaf
changeuni: yod hiriq he vav holam shin shin-dot qubuts meteg ayin patah maqaf
notes: The text of this word is of poor quality. Although the usual spelling of Joshua has a sheva under the yod, the LC has only one dot under the yod. The shuruq under the shin is unclear; the other mark under the shin is a meteg. The furtive patah for the ayin is too advanced.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a sheva under the yod and a meteg under the shin.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word. Add note 'c'.
refuni: bet dagesh hiriq final-nun maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh hiriq final-nun
notes: A maqaf is expected at end of word.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a maqaf at end of word.

description: Place telisha gedola over tsadi.
refuni: he telisha-gedola vav holam tsadi hiriq yod alef hiriq yod
changeuni: he telisha-gedola vav holam tsadi hiriq telisha-gedola yod alef hiriq yod
notes: The circle over the aleph is a masora circle; it's too far above the aleph to be a telisha gedola.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a telisha gedola over the tsadi.

description: Move etnahta from under bet to under the kaf.
refuni: yod hiriq shin shin-dot sheva kaf dagesh qamats bet etnahta vav dagesh final-nun
changeuni: yod hiriq shin shin-dot sheva kaf dagesh qamats etnahta bet vav dagesh final-nun
notes: The etnahta clearly belongs to the kaf; space was available to place it under the bet if that was the intent.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has the etnahta under the bet.

description: The meteg belonging to the nun might be a merkha, but is not sufficiently inclined. Add note 'm'.
refuni: nun holam meteg shin sin-dot sheva alef tsere tevir yod
changeuni: nun holam meteg shin sin-dot sheva alef tsere tevir yod
notes: The possible merkha under the nun-gimel space is not as inclined northeast to southwest as the following tevir and appears perpendicular to the base of the nun.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the nun.

description: Change the patah under the ayin to hataf patah.
refuni: nun patah meteg ayin patah lamed sheva final-kaf qamats pashta
changeuni: nun patah meteg ayin hataf-patah lamed sheva final-kaf qamats pashta
notes: The text is severely damaged. Nevertheless, double dots forming a hataf sign are present.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a patah under the ayin.

description: The meteg belonging to the nun might be a merkha, but is not sufficiently inclined. Add note 'm'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq nun dagesh qamats meteg gimel sheva ayin tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq nun dagesh qamats meteg gimel sheva ayin tevir vav dagesh
notes: The possible merkha under the nun-gimel space is not as inclined northeast to southwest as the following tevir.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the nun.

description: Change patah under ayin to qamats. Add 'c' note.
refuni: yod sheva he vav holam shin shin-dot qubuts ayin patah pashta
changeuni: yod sheva he vav holam shin shin-dot qubuts ayin qamats pashta
notes: The LC's qamats on the ayin is effectively a "furtive" qamats.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a patah under the ayin.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah kaf dagesh munah vav dagesh he qamats
changeuni: vav patah yod patah kaf dagesh munah vav dagesh he qamats
notes: The LC text is very damaged in this word; however, the lack of a dagesh on the yod is certain.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the yod.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof dagesh patah qadma het
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq qof dagesh patah qadma het
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the yod.

description: Change qamats under kaf to sheva.
refuni: kaf dagesh qamats lamed maqaf
changeuni: kaf dagesh sheva lamed maqaf
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a qamats on the kaf.

description: Add dagesh to second qof.
refuni: he patah qof dagesh patah resh sheva qof qamats meteg ayin qamats he sof-pasuq
changeuni: he patah qof dagesh patah resh sheva qof qamats dagesh meteg ayin qamats he sof-pasuq
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has no dagesh on the second qof.
changeuni_gen: he patah qof dagesh patah resh sheva qof dagesh qamats meteg ayin qamats he sof-pasuq

description: Possible dagesh in he. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah lamed qamats merkha he
changeuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah lamed qamats merkha he
notes: The dagesh is well-shaped and well-positioned, but faint. It is not expected here.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has no dagesh on the he.

description: Possible dagesh in bet. Add note 't'.
refuni: lamed hiriq bet sheva nun tsere merkha yod
changeuni: lamed hiriq bet sheva nun tsere merkha yod
notes: The dagesh is well-shaped but a little low and faint.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has no dagesh on the bet.

description: Remove dagesh from first sin.
refuni: lamed sheva yod hiriq qadma shin sin-dot dagesh qamats shin kaf qamats zaqef-qatan resh
changeuni: lamed sheva yod hiriq qadma shin sin-dot qamats shin kaf qamats zaqef-qatan resh
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the first sin.

description: Remove dagesh from first sin.
refuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats shin kaf qamats tipeha resh
changeuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot qamats shin kaf qamats tipeha resh
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the first sin.

description: Remove dagesh from first sin.
refuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats shin kaf qamats tipeha resh
changeuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot qamats shin kaf qamats tipeha resh
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the first sin.

description: Accent on nun is a merkha. Add note 'c'
refuni: zayin hiriq qof sheva nun tsere merkha yod maqaf
changeuni: zayin hiriq qof sheva nun tsere merkha yod maqaf
notes: The accent under the nun has a distinct northeast to southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a meteg under the nun.

description: Accent on ayin might be a merkha. Add note 'm'
refuni: he qamats ayin hiriq meteg yod resh
changeuni: he qamats ayin hiriq meteg yod resh
notes: The accent on ayin lacks the northeast to southwest inclination to be a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the ayin.

description: Remove dagesh from first sin.
refuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats shin kaf qamats munah resh
changeuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot qamats shin kaf qamats munah resh
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the first sin.

description: Possible merkha under first nun rather than meteg. Add note 'm'.
refuni: nun qamats meteg tav sheva nun tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: nun qamats meteg tav sheva nun tevir vav dagesh
notes: The accent under the first nun lacks the northeast to southwest inclination of a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha on the first nun.

description: Remove dagesh from first sin.
refuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats shin kaf qamats zaqef-qatan resh
changeuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot qamats shin kaf qamats zaqef-qatan resh
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the first sin.

description: Remove dagesh from yod. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq tav dagesh tsere mahapakh final-nun
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq tav dagesh tsere mahapakh final-nun
notes: The putative dagesh on the yod is very faint and may have been erased. It is much weaker the dagesh on the following tav.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the yod.

description: Add qadma to kaf. Add note 'c'.
refuni: kaf dagesh qamats lamed maqaf
changeuni: kaf dagesh qamats qadma lamed maqaf
notes: The image shows a poetic word composed of 3 orthographic words connected by 2 maqafs. The orthographic word in question is the middle word, כָּל־.
The qadma is faint but well-formed. The aleph on the preceding orthographic word has no accent, the aleph on the following orthographic word has a zaqef qatan.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a qadma on the initial aleph and a zaqef qatan on the second aleph of this poetic word.

description: A dagesh appears to have been removed from bet.
refuni: gimel dagesh sheva bet vav dagesh lamed qamats meteg he dagesh sof-pasuq
changeuni: gimel dagesh sheva bet vav dagesh lamed qamats meteg he dagesh sof-pasuq
notes: A smudge is present within the bet. Adjacent dageshes are well-formed and well-positioned. Previous versions of this word in the same verse lack a dagesh on the bet.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has no dagesh on the bet.

description: Change sheva on first he to a hiriq.
refuni: vav sheva he sheva nun dagesh tsere tevir he
changeuni: vav sheva he hiriq nun dagesh tsere tevir he
notes: Underneath the first dot below the he is a smudge. The smudge is too light and too far below the dot to be a sheva. Compare with the sheva in the preceding vav.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a hiriq on the first he.

description: Remove maqaf at end of word. Add note 'c'.
refuni: vav sheva alef segol tav maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva alef segol tav
notes: The large black dot at the end of the word it is not shaped like a maqaf nor does it bridge to the next word.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a maqaf ending this word.

description: Possible merkha under sin. Add note 'm'.
refuni: ayin qamats shin sin-dot meteg vav dagesh
changeuni: ayin qamats shin sin-dot meteg vav dagesh
notes: The mark under the sin lacks a distinct northeast to southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the sin.

description: Remove dagesh from lamed. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem patah lamed dagesh sheva alef patah munah final-kaf sheva
changeuni: mem patah lamed sheva alef patah munah final-kaf sheva
notes: The mark under the dagesh on the lamed is weak and ill-positioned.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) lacks a dagesh on the lamed.

description: Move the holam from the vav to the aleph. Add note 'c'.
refuni: shin sin-dot sheva mem alef vav holam lamed qamats final-mem pashta
changeuni: shin sin-dot sheva mem alef holam vav lamed qamats final-mem pashta
notes: The holam in the LC is closer to the aleph than the vav.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has the holam between the mem and the aleph.

description: Remove dagesh from yod
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof dagesh patah munah het
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq qof dagesh patah munah het
notes: The mark above the nun is interpreted as a low-hanging masora circle. Neither MAM nor the UXLC show masora circles.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the yod.

description: Change meteg on pe to merkha.
refuni: pe dagesh qamats meteg shin shin-dot sheva tet tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: pe dagesh qamats merkha shin shin-dot sheva tet tevir vav dagesh
notes: The mark under the pe has a distinct northeast to southeast inclination and is thus a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha on the pe.

description: Move merkha from vav to yod.
refuni: vav patah merkha yod dagesh holam alef mem segol resh
changeuni: vav patah merkha yod dagesh holam alef mem segol resh
notes: The mark under the yod has a slight northeast to southeast inclination and is thus a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha on the vav.
changeuni_gen: vav patah yod dagesh holam merkha alef mem segol resh

description: Remove dagesh (as a shuruq dot) from second vav. Add 'c' note.
refuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh patah het hataf-patah nun tipeha vav dagesh final-nun
changeuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh patah het hataf-patah nun tipeha vav final-nun
notes: Removing the shuruq dot leaves the word incompletely vowelized; therefore a 'c' note is added.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh (as a shuruq dot) on the second vav.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq lamed dagesh qamats tipeha het segol final-mem
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq lamed dagesh qamats tipeha het segol final-mem
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the yod.

description: Examine dagesh on tav.
refuni: vav patah yod hiriq tav dagesh sheva nun tsere merkha final-mem
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq tav dagesh sheva nun tsere merkha final-mem
notes: The dagesh on the tav is dark, but touching the tav.
The merkha on the nun is questionable.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the tav.

description: Remove dagesh on mem.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq mem dagesh patah merkha samekh dagesh vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq mem patah merkha samekh dagesh vav dagesh
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh on the mem.

description: Remove maqaf at end of word. Add note 'c'.
refuni: alef patah het hataf-patah resh tsere yod maqaf
changeuni: alef patah het hataf-patah resh tsere yod
notes: No line is present between the yod of this word and the kaf of the next word.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a maqaf at the end of this word.

description: Add telisha qetana to yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam alef mem sheva resh vav dagesh telisha-qetana
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam telisha-qetana alef mem sheva resh vav dagesh telisha-qetana
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a telisha qetana on the yod.

description: Examine dagesh in mem.
refuni: he tsere pashta mem dagesh qamats he pashta
changeuni: he tsere pashta mem dagesh qamats he pashta
notes: The smudge touching the inside of rightmost part of the mem is a dagesh.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the mem.

description: Remove dagesh from tsadi.
refuni: mem patah tsadi dagesh hiriq geresh yod lamed
changeuni: mem patah tsadi hiriq geresh yod lamed
notes: The smudge at the base of the following yod looks to be continuous with the yod and is not a dagesh on the tsadi.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the tsadi.

description: Examine for possible maqaf at end of word.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere mahapakh shin shin-dot sheva bet vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere mahapakh shin shin-dot sheva bet vav dagesh
notes: The separation between characters is confused by the blurry image. If the vav of this word is connected to the shin of the following word, so also would be this word's vav, yod, and shin.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has no maqaf on this word.

description: Meteg on second mem may be a merkha. Add note 'm'. Remove maqaf at end of word. Add note 'c'.
refuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh patah meteg ayin hataf-patah resh tsere he maqaf
changeuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh patah meteg ayin hataf-patah resh tsere he
notes: The vertical mark under the second mem lacks the northeast-to-southwest inclination to be a merkha. No maqaf is apparent at the end of this word. The following word, which is on the next line, has no "leading" maqaf.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the second mem. The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has no maqaf on this word.

description: Remove dagesh in yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq bet dagesh qamats he tsere tipeha lamed
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq bet dagesh qamats he tsere tipeha lamed
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the yod, even the dagesh on the bet is weak.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the yod.
changeuni_gen: vav patah yod hiriq bet dagesh qamats he tsere tipeha lamed

description: Remove dagesh in yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah kaf dagesh munah vav dagesh final-mem
changeuni: vav patah yod patah kaf dagesh munah vav dagesh final-mem
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the yod.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the yod.

description: Replace holam on tav with hiriq. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem sheva tav holam final-mem pashta
changeuni: mem sheva tav hiriq final-mem pashta
notes: The darkest accent on the tav is a hiriq, the holam is much lighter.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a holam on the tav.

description: Add qadma to first lamed.
refuni: lamed hiriq mem sheva samekh hiriq lamed dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan he
changeuni: lamed hiriq qadma mem sheva samekh hiriq lamed dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan he
notes: A dark accent is visible on the first lamed. With change the word has two accents: a qadma on the first lamed (a conjunctive) and a zaqef qatan on the second lamed (level 2 disjunctive).
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a qadma on the first lamed.

description: Add paseq (and preceding space) to end of word.
refuni: alef qamats lamed qamats mahapakh he
changeuni: alef qamats lamed qamats mahapakh he space paseq

description: Remove dagesh from tav.
refuni: tav dagesh hiriq ole resh sheva alef segol merkha he
changeuni: tav hiriq ole resh sheva alef segol merkha he

description: Add geresh muqdam to initial vav. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva nun hiriq pe sheva lamed qamats alef revia vav holam tav
changeuni: vav sheva geresh-muqdam nun hiriq pe sheva lamed qamats alef revia vav holam tav
notes: The geresh muqdam is very faint at the top left of the initial vav. It appears to be doubled, possibly the outer edges of a single stroke.

description: Remove dagesh from initial tav.
refuni: tav dagesh sheva shin shin-dot vav dagesh ayin qamats tav hiriq etnahta yod
changeuni: tav sheva shin shin-dot vav dagesh ayin qamats tav hiriq etnahta yod

description: The merkha under second yod is ambiguous. Add 't' note.
refuni: yod hiriq meteg he sheva yod merkha vav dagesh
changeuni: yod hiriq meteg he sheva yod merkha vav dagesh
notes: The accent under the second yod has a slight brush mark at the bottom but has no northeast to southwest inclination.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the first yod and a meteg under the second. The accompanying MAM notes describe differences among texts on these markings.

description: Add mahapakh to pe, change merkha under qof to meteg. Add CGJ between meteg and patah on qof to preserve ordering.
refuni: pe dagesh qamats qof patah merkha dalet sheva tav dagesh qamats
changeuni: pe dagesh qamats mahapakh qof meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah dalet sheva tav dagesh qamats
notes: The mark below the qamats on the pe definitely belongs to the pe, not the line below. The accent under the qof has a slight brush mark at the top but has no northeast-to-southwest inclination. A combining grapheme joiner (CGJ) has been placed between the meteg and the patah to force the meteg-first ordering.
The UXLC transcription preserves the two-dimensional mark order of the meteg relative to the patah. Other texts may not choose to maintain this ordering as a matter of editorial policy.

description: Move mahapakh from ayin to dalet.
refuni: ayin tsere mahapakh dalet vav dagesh tav space paseq
changeuni: ayin tsere dalet mahapakh vav dagesh tav space paseq

description: Remove paseq (and preceding space).
refuni: alef holam yod sheva bet segol pazer yod final-kaf qamats space paseq
changeuni: alef holam yod sheva bet segol pazer yod final-kaf qamats
notes: This word is at the end of line 14, the following line starts with the divine name and has no intervening paseq.

description: Remove dagesh in first tav.
refuni: tav dagesh sheva het hiriq nun dagesh qamats tav hiriq munah yod
changeuni: tav sheva het hiriq nun dagesh qamats tav hiriq munah yod

description: Remove dagesh in dalet.
refuni: dalet dagesh holam geresh-muqdam revia mem segol final-nun
changeuni: dalet holam geresh-muqdam revia mem segol final-nun
notes: The text is of high quality in this region. The dalet has a dot over the rafe which could be a revia. This revia, in addition to the geresh muqdam, produces a revia mugrash accent, an accent pair common in the Sifrei Emet.

description: Remove geresh-muqdam from over ayin.
refuni: ayin holam geresh-muqdam lamed qamats lamed patah revia yod hiriq final-kaf sheva
changeuni: ayin holam lamed qamats lamed patah revia yod hiriq final-kaf sheva
notes: The preceding word, on the previous line, has a maqaf.
The final kaf has an incomplete masorah circle and rafe above it. The UXLC transcribes neither masorah circles nor rafe marks

description: Unexpected dot above the final-mem, add note 't'.
refuni: alef qamats dalet qamats munah final-mem
changeuni: alef qamats dalet qamats munah final-mem
notes: The dot above the final-mem is dark, well-formed, and difficult to explain.

description: Add geresh-muqdam to nun.
refuni: nun sheva dalet qamats resh patah revia yod
changeuni: nun sheva geresh-muqdam dalet qamats resh patah revia yod
notes: The geresh-muqdam above the nun is dark and well-formed. This geresh muqdam, in addition to the revia accent, produces a revia mugrash accent, an accent pair common in the Sifrei Emet.

description: Remove dagesh from vav. Add note 't'.
refuni: he segol ayin sheva dalet dagesh hiriq merkha yod vav dagesh
changeuni: he segol ayin sheva dalet dagesh hiriq merkha yod vav
notes: Though well-positioned, the dagesh on the vav is very faint compared to other dots on the word.
The vocalization with the dagesh didn't make sense here.

description: Add geresh muqdam to aleph.
refuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot qubuts resh tsere revia yod nun vav dagesh
changeuni: alef hataf-patah geresh-muqdam shin shin-dot qubuts resh tsere revia yod nun vav dagesh

description: Siluq is missing from last word in verse, add note 'c'.
refuni: he patah meteg mem dagesh patah het hataf-patah nun segol he sof-pasuq
changeuni: he patah meteg mem dagesh patah het hataf-patah nun segol he sof-pasuq
notes: Every verse should end with a siluq accent. No siluq is present in this word (a meteg occurs on the initial he).
The most likely position for a siluq on this word is under the nun.

Ben Denckla: BHL has a vertical bar (equivalent to Unicode meteg) under both the he and the nun; BHL Appendix A has a vertical bar (equivalent to Unicode meteg) only under he. That is, the BHL text adds a siluq under the nun while aware it is missing in the LC text.

description: Change zaqef-qatan over ayin to revia, add note 'c'.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh sheva mem qubuts ayin qamats zaqef-qatan he
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh sheva mem qubuts ayin qamats revia he
notes: A single dot appears above the ayin with no sign of a second dot above it. The zaqef-qatan will be replaced by a revia to represent the single dot.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a revia over the ayin; BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Add meteg to ayin.
refuni: ayin patah lamed maqaf
changeuni: ayin patah meteg lamed maqaf
notes: The maqaf is well-formed and well positioned, but lighter than the surrounding characters. The change produces the chanted word עַֽל־אֲשֶׁר־הֵמִ֖ית.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a meteg under the ayin; BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Remove maqaf from word, add note 'm'.
refuni: mem holam meteg qof sheva shin shin-dot tsere yod maqaf
changeuni: mem holam meteg qof sheva shin shin-dot tsere yod
notes: No maqaf between this word and the next is evident and the meteg, as a secondary accent, is missing a primary accent.
The meteg should probably be a taken as a merkha; however, it lacks the necessary northeast-to-southwest inclination.
Ben Denckla: The BHL has a merkha on the mem and no maqaf on this word. BHL Appendix A does not comment on this word.

description: Add maqaf to end of word.
refuni: shin shin-dot segol meteg bet patah ayin
changeuni: shin shin-dot segol meteg bet patah ayin maqaf
notes: The maqaf is distinct.
Ben Denckla: The BHL has a maqaf on this word. BHL Appendix A does not comment on this word.

description: Remove dagesh from dalet.
refuni: dalet dagesh qamats bet qamats resh pashta
changeuni: dalet qamats bet qamats resh pashta
notes: The rafeh above the dalet (indicating no dagesh) is clear.
Ben Denckla: BHL agrees that there is no dagesh in the dalet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
This case is similar, but not identical, to that of Jer 32:6.4 (2022.08.14 - 11).

description: Change revia over mem to zaqef-qatan.
refuni: lamed tsere alef mem holam revia resh
changeuni: lamed tsere alef mem holam zaqef-qatan resh
notes: The lower dot of the zaqef-qatan is broken, but well-positioned.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a zaqef-qatan on the mem. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Remove mahapakh from under yod. Place qadma on yod. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam mahapakh alef mem segol resh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam alef mem segol resh
notes: Although LC text has a smudge extending partly under the yod, it is unlikely that there is an accent under the yod. A diagonal, southeast-to-northwest blurr occurs at the top tip of the yod. This could be a qadma, providing a primary accent on the word.
The Hebrew Wikisource Miqra According to the Masorah (23 Sep 2022) has a qadma on the yod.
changeuni_gen: vav patah yod dagesh holam qadma alef mem segol resh

description: Add dagesh to bet.
refuni: bet patah meteg nun sheva het qubuts shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah zaqef-qatan yod hiriq final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh patah meteg nun sheva het qubuts shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah zaqef-qatan yod hiriq final-mem
notes: Although the quality of the LC text is poor the dagesh in the bet is clear.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a dagesh in this bet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Add dagesh to tav.
refuni: tav tsere meteg dalet qamats ayin etnahta vav dagesh he qamats
