changeuni: tav dagesh tsere meteg dalet qamats ayin etnahta vav dagesh he qamats
notes: The dagesh is dark and well-positioned, but smaller than many dots near the tav.
The interior of the tav contains an inexplicable, very thin, V-shaped line.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a NO dagesh in the tav. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Remove dagesh from dalet.
refuni: dalet dagesh sheva bet patah resh maqaf
changeuni: dalet dagesh sheva bet patah resh maqaf
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has a no dagesh in the tav. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
This case is similar, but not identical, to that of 1 Kings 10:3.9 (2022.08.14 - 6).
changeuni_gen: dalet sheva bet patah resh maqaf

description: Move revia from dalet to tav.
refuni: vav sheva geresh-muqdam yod qamats dalet patah revia ayin sheva tav dagesh qamats
changeuni: vav sheva geresh-muqdam yod qamats dalet patah ayin sheva tav dagesh qamats revia
notes: The revia over the tav is merged with an accent from the preceding line.
Ben Denckla: BHL agrees that this tav has a revia (and BHL implicitly agrees that no other letter in this word has revia!). BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Add maqaf to end of word.
refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq meteg yod
changeuni: kaf dagesh hiriq meteg yod maqaf
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL agrees that a maqaf is present, forming the maqaf compound כי־הביאו. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Possible dagesh in shin. Add 't' note.
refuni: shin shin-dot holam meteg het patah dalet
changeuni: shin shin-dot holam meteg het patah dalet
notes: The text is not in good condition near this word.
The mark inside the shin is thin and linear; it is not a dot.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a dagesh in the shin of שחד (part of maqaf compound תרבה־שחד). BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Meteg below the yod might have been intended to be a merkha, add note 'm'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere meteg tsadi sheva alef tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere meteg tsadi sheva alef tevir vav dagesh
notes: Accent below the yod lacks the northeast-to-southwest inclination required for a merkha and will be transcribed as a meteg. The accent might be a merkha.
Ben Denckla: The BHL has a merkha on the yod based on its algorithm (p. xi) for distinguishing meteg/merkha differences. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Yod is poorly written, add note 't'.
refuni: tav dagesh sheva tsadi hiriq lamed dagesh segol tipeha yod nun qamats he
changeuni: tav dagesh sheva tsadi hiriq lamed dagesh segol tipeha yod nun qamats he
notes: This word is poorly written and the yod appears to have been inserted as an afterthought.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a yod after the lamed; BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Add dagesh to shin. Add 'c' note.
refuni: vav patah yod sheva shin shin-dot hiriq mem dagesh tsere etnahta final-mem
changeuni: vav patah yod sheva shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq mem dagesh tsere etnahta final-mem
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has no dagesh in the shin; BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the shin in the LC.

description: Remove maqaf from mem. Add note 'c'.
refuni: vav sheva alef hiriq final-mem maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva alef hiriq final-mem
notes: Without the maqaf, the word lacks an accent.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a maqaf at the end of the word. BHL Appendix A has no maqaf on this word for the LC.

description: Change qamatz below mem to patah. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod sheva mem qamats alef hataf-patah nun munah vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod sheva mem patah alef hataf-patah nun munah vav dagesh
notes: The horizonal line below the mem has a small, central notch. The qamatz dot is usually further below the qamatz horizontal line.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a qamats on the mem; BHL Appendix A has a patah under the mem in the LC but notes the difficulty reading the LC.

description: Remove maqaf from yod. Change meteg to merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq meteg yod maqaf
changeuni: kaf dagesh hiriq merkha yod
notes: The text is of poor quality for this word. The near-vertical line under the kaf has a northeast-to-southeast inclination and is transcribed as a merkha.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a meteg under the kaf and a maqaf at the end of this word; BHL Appendix A has no comment on this word.

description: Move pashta from aleph to nun.
refuni: alef qamats pashta nun holam kaf hiriq yod pashta
changeuni: alef qamats pashta nun holam kaf hiriq yod pashta
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has the pashta on the aleph; BHL Appendix A has no comment on this word.
changeuni_gen: alef qamats nun holam pashta kaf hiriq yod pashta

description: Change merkha under het to tipeha. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva alef segol het qamats merkha dalet
changeuni: vav sheva alef segol het qamats tipeha dalet
notes: The tipeha is under the dalet; however, it's probably intended to be associated with the het. The tipeha's position is almost certainly due to the top of a lamed on the following line.
Ben Denckla: BHL has the tipeha under the het; BHL Appendix A has no comment on this word.

description: Change tipeha under sin to meteg. Add note 'm'.
refuni: nun holam shin sin-dot tsere tipeha alef
changeuni: nun holam shin sin-dot tsere meteg alef
notes: The vertical line under the sin in very slightly inclined northeast-to-southwest and might be transcribed as a merkha. This inclination is similar to that of the accent under the nun in the following word. The mark will be transcribed as a meteg.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a merkha under the sin; BHL Appendix A has no comment on this word.

description: Replace zaqef-gadol on yod with revia.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam zaqef-gadol alef mem segol resh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam revia alef mem segol resh
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has a revia over the yod; BHL Appendix A has no comment on this word.

description: Accent over the mem is unclear. Add note 't'
refuni: yod qamats mem hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
changeuni: yod qamats mem hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
notes: The mark over the mem is blurred vertically, suggesting a zaqef-qatan as transcribed. It could be a revia, however.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a zaqef-qatan over the mem; BHL Appendix A has no comment on this word.

description: Remove patah from ayin.
refuni: mem vav holam shin shin-dot hiriq tevir yod ayin patah
changeuni: mem vav holam shin shin-dot hiriq tevir yod ayin
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has a patah under the ayin; BHL Appendix A has no comment on this word.

description: Possible dagesh in resh. Add note 't'.
refuni: nun tsere resh sheva dalet qamats munah he
changeuni: nun tsere resh sheva dalet qamats munah he
notes: The putative dagesh in the resh is slightly less dark than adjacent markings and not well placed.
Ben Denckla: BHL has no dagesh in the resh; BHL Appendix A finds a dagesh in the LC but notes the difficulty reading the LC.

description: Possible merkha under initial he. Add note 'm'.
refuni: he qamats meteg yod sheva tav qamats tevir he
changeuni: he qamats meteg yod sheva tav qamats tevir he
notes: The vertical line under the he lacks the required northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a merkha under the initial he; BHL Appendix A has no comment on this word.

description: Remove dagesh in yod, remove dagesh from lamed. Add note 'c'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq lamed dagesh qamats munah het segol final-mem
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq lamed qamats munah het segol final-mem
notes: This change is in alignment with Dotan (Biblia Hebraica Leningradensia, 2001).
Ben Denckla: BHL has dageshes on both the yod and the lamed; BHL Appendix A finds no dageshes under either the yod or the lamed in the LC.

description: Meteg under bet might be a merkha, add note 'm'. Remove maqaf.
refuni: bet dagesh tsere meteg yod tav maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh tsere meteg yod tav maqaf
notes: The vertical line under the bet has insufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha. The former maqaf is likely a remnant of the top bar of the tav arising from a crack in the ink. Notice the missing ink in the following lamed's knee.
Ben Denckla: BHL has meteg under the bet and ends in a maqaf; BHL Appendix A does not comment on this word.
changeuni_gen: bet dagesh tsere meteg yod tav

description: Unclear mark under the yod. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh sheva shin shin-dot dagesh qamats meteg mem sheva ayin vav dagesh pashta
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh sheva shin shin-dot dagesh qamats meteg mem sheva ayin vav dagesh pashta
notes: The lower dot of the sheva under the yod is weak, but well-positioned.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a hiriq under the yod; BHL Appendix A finds a sheva under the yod for the LC.

description: Change patah on het to hataf-patah. Add note 'c'.
refuni: het patah lamed dagesh qubuts qof tsere meteg yod maqaf
changeuni: het hataf-patah lamed dagesh qubuts qof tsere meteg yod maqaf
notes: An apparent hataf mark precedes the patah at a larger distance than expected for an hataf-patah.
Dotan (Biblia Hebraica Leningradensia, 2001) notes this as a particularity of the LC.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a patah under the het; BHL Appendix A finds a hataf-patah under the het in the LC.

description: Remove sof-pasuq. Add note 'c'.
refuni: ayin segol qof sheva resh meteg vav holam final-nun sof-pasuq
changeuni: ayin segol qof sheva resh meteg vav holam final-nun
notes: This verse lacks an ending sof-pasuq.
Ben Denckla: BHL ends the word with a sof-pasuq; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Unclear accent under the ayin. Add note 't'.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva ayin tsere merkha tav
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva ayin tsere merkha tav
notes: The text quality in the region around this word is good. The tsere under the ayin is clear; the three dots to the left of the tsere are confusing. None of the these dots can be associated with the lamed on the next line. Identify the 3 dots as North, South, and West. North is lighter and blurry; but has a slight vertical component. The space between North and South appears empty. The West dot might be ignored with North and South joined to make a near-vertical meteg/merkha. Alternatively, a tevir could be formed from all three dots again by joining North and South; unfortunately, this gives the odd arrangement of two successive tevirs in the verse.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a merkha under the ayin; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Change hataf-patah under aleph to patah.
refuni: alef hataf-patah he tsere bet patah meteg tav sheva he vav dagesh sof-pasuq
changeuni: alef patah he tsere bet patah meteg tav sheva he vav dagesh sof-pasuq
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has a hataf-patah under the aleph; BHL Appendix A finds a patah under the ayin in the LC but notes the difficulty reading the LC.

description: Consider final yod instead of vav.
refuni: bet resh bet bet tav vav
changeuni: bet resh bet bet tav vav
notes: The word in question is the ketiv part of a ketiv/qere pair. In the LC the body text contains the ketiv consonants with the qere vowel and accent markings. The consonants for the qere are written in the margin.

The existing ketiv body text has a vav as the final character; a "his ten thousand" ending. The referent for the "his" is David in word 20. The change author suggests that the final letter might instead be a yod; a "my ten thousand" ending. No referent for "my" is apparent in the verse.

The qere consonants in the margin clearly end in yod then vav; a grammatical "his ten thousands" ending shown in the following qere word 21, so that proposed difference between the ketiv/qere forms is "my ten thousand" and "his ten thousands". That is, the proposal changes the person from "my" to "his" while changing the number "ten thousand" to "ten thousands". This in contrast to preceding ketiv/qere pair in words 18 and 19 which has a ketiv meaning "his thousand" and a qere reading "his thousands". That is, in words 18, 19, the ketiv/qere forms are thousand/thousands and both have third person singular endings referring to Saul, word 17. The parallelism common in the Hebrew text (words 17, 18, 19 parallel to words 20, 21, 22) would suggest that the following ketiv/qere pair in words 21, 22 would be "his ten thousand"/"his ten thousands".
Placing a yod as the final ketiv constant in word 21 adds an unknown referent (who is "my"?) and breaks an obviously intended parallelism with words 18, 19.

Ben Denckla: The distinguished Israeli biblical scholar Mordecai Breuer (1921-2007) as well as the change author, Daniel Holman, noted that the final letter is somewhat ambiguous and might be construed as yod. BHL ends the word with a vav; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Change merkha under the yod to meteg. Add note 'm' .
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh merkha vav holam resh segol dalet
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh meteg vav holam resh segol dalet
notes: The vertical line under the yod lacks sufficient the northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a merkha under the yod; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: The meteg under the ayin might be a merkha. Add note 'm' .
refuni: ayin holam meteg tet sheva resh hiriq tevir yod final-mem
changeuni: ayin holam meteg tet sheva resh hiriq tevir yod final-mem
notes: The vertical line under the ayin lacks sufficient the northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a merkha under the ayin; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Remove pashta from final kaf.
refuni: he patah dalet dagesh segol pashta resh segol final-kaf sheva pashta
changeuni: he patah dalet dagesh segol pashta resh segol final-kaf sheva
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has a pashta on the final kaf; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof dagesh holam qadma dalet
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq qof dagesh holam qadma dalet
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has a dagesh on the yod; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Remove maqaf.
refuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh maqaf
changeuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL ends this word with a maqaf; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Note sheva of hataf-patah is very early. Add note 't'
refuni: lamed patah he hataf-patah resh qamats gimel hataf-patah final-kaf qamats tipeha
changeuni: lamed patah he hataf-patah resh qamats gimel hataf-patah final-kaf qamats tipeha
notes: Hataf vowels are composed of a sheva-then-vowel sequence. They are never written vowel-then-sheva. The sheva belongs to a hataf-patah on the he; however, it is positioned very early under the lamed because of the top of a lamed on the following verse.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a hataf-patah on the he; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Consider removing dagesh from bet.
refuni: bet dagesh patah meteg alef dalet holam nun hiriq zaqef-qatan yod
changeuni: bet dagesh patah meteg alef dalet holam nun hiriq zaqef-qatan yod
notes: The bump in the base of the bet is probably a dagesh.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a dagesh in the bet; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Possible merkha under ayin. Add note 'm'.
refuni: ayin holam meteg bet sheva resh hiriq tevir yod final-mem
changeuni: ayin holam meteg bet sheva resh hiriq tevir yod final-mem
notes: The vertical line under the ayin has insufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a merkha under the ayin; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Add telisha-qetana above the shin.
refuni: he hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh qamats bet sheva ayin qamats he telisha-qetana
changeuni: he hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh qamats telisha-qetana bet sheva ayin qamats he telisha-qetana
notes: The circle on the upper left of the shin is light, but attached to the shin.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a telisha-qetana above the shin; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Consider removing dagesh from bet.
refuni: bet dagesh patah shin shin-dot dagesh qamats meteg mem segol final-nun sof-pasuq
changeuni: bet dagesh patah shin shin-dot dagesh qamats meteg mem segol final-nun sof-pasuq
notes: The dagesh in the lower right of the bet is small and poorly positioned, but present.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the bet.

description: Note possible erasure with a 't' note.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva resh qubuts kaf hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva resh qubuts kaf hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem
notes: A consonant, possibly a vav or yod, appears to have been erased between the resh and the kaf. The erasure appears to have been hidden by extending the top of the resh.
The Sefaria MAM has no consonant between the resh and the kaf.

Ben Denckla: BHL agrees with the UXLC word. The BHL Appendix A agrees with the change author that an erasure may have taken place and suggests that the original contents of the manuscript was a malei spelling of the word, בְּרוּכִ֤ים. While this is an interesting speculation, this is irrelevant to UXLC's main text since it tries to transcribe the final state of the manuscript.

description: Possible maqaf between the he and the aleph. Add 't' note.
refuni: ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot qamats he alef tsere etnahta lamed
changeuni: ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot qamats he alef tsere etnahta lamed
notes: The putative maqaf between the he and the aleph is not very dark. The LC has a maqaf in 5 of 12 occurrences of Asahel in 2 Samuel.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) never has a maqaf in the 12 occurrences of Asahel in 2 Samuel.

description: Possible maqaf between the he and the aleph. Add 't' note.
refuni: ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot qamats he alef tsere tevir lamed
changeuni: ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot qamats he alef tsere tevir lamed
notes: The putative maqaf between the he and the aleph is not very dark. The LC has a maqaf in 5 of 12 occurrences of Asahel in 2 Samuel.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) never has a maqaf in the 12 occurrences of Asahel in 2 Samuel.

description: Remove dagesh from mem.
refuni: vav sheva he tsere revia mem dagesh qamats he
changeuni: vav sheva he tsere revia mem qamats he
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the mem.

description: Remove dagesh from first shin, remove munah from under second shin. Add note 'c'.
refuni: vav sheva he patah shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq munah yod
changeuni: vav sheva he patah shin shin-dot hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq yod
notes: The word lacks an accent. The dagesh in the second shin is very faint.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the first shin and a munah under the second shin.

description: Change hataf-segol under ayin to segol.
refuni: alef segol meteg ayin hataf-segol shin sin-dot segol he maqaf
changeuni: alef segol meteg ayin segol shin sin-dot segol he maqaf
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a hataf-segol under the ayin.

description: Split the word by adding a maqaf between the he and the aleph.
refuni: ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot qamats he alef tsere darga lamed
changeuni: ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot qamats he alef tsere darga lamed
notes: The LC has a distinct maqaf between the he and the aleph. The maqaf has equal darkness to the that on the preceding word. The LC has a maqaf in 5 of 12 occurrences of Asahel in 2 Samuel.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) never has a maqaf in the 12 occurrences of Asahel in 2 Samuel.
changeuni_gen: ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot qamats he maqaf alef tsere darga lamed

description: Change qamats under gimel to patah.
refuni: he qubuts gimel dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan shin shin-dot vav dagesh
changeuni: he qubuts gimel dagesh patah zaqef-qatan shin shin-dot vav dagesh
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a qamats under the gimel.

description: Change segol under aleph to tsere. Add note 't'.
refuni: he patah bet dagesh sheva alef segol meteg resh holam tav hiriq tipeha yod
changeuni: he patah bet dagesh sheva alef tsere meteg resh holam tav hiriq tipeha yod
notes: The two horizontal dots under the aleph have a much fainter dot below them that would make the vowel a segol.
Ben Denckla: BHL has tsere under the aleph. BHL Appendix A has segol with a question mark.

description: Possible merkha instead of meteg under the yod. Add note 'm'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere meteg lamed sheva kaf tevir vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere meteg lamed sheva kaf tevir vav dagesh
notes: The vertical line under the yod lacks the required northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the yod.

description: Move etnahta from under bet to under kaf.
refuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot sheva kaf dagesh qamats bet etnahta vav holam
changeuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot sheva kaf dagesh qamats etnahta bet vav holam
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has an etnahta under the bet.

description: Remove dageshes from yod and dalet. Add rafe to dalet.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq vav dagesh qamats merkha lamed sheva dalet dagesh vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq vav dagesh qamats merkha lamed sheva dalet rafe vav dagesh
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the yod and no dagesh in the dalet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Partially erased text starts after this word. Add note 't'.
refuni: het hataf-patah dalet qamats shin shin-dot qamats meteg he sof-pasuq
changeuni: het hataf-patah dalet qamats shin shin-dot qamats meteg he sof-pasuq
notes: This note and the note on the following verse delimit an anomaly in the LC caused by scribal error. The error has been partially erased in the LC, but enough remains to understand what may have happened. The error has no effect on the transcription because the surrounding verses are legibly written.

The text following this word at column 1, line 25, of Folio_171B is partially erased in the LC. The erasure leaves only the top part of the text at the bottom of column 1 (as shown in the image) and at the top of column 2. Then 2 Samuel 6:4 appears legibly at column 2, line 3 of Folio_171B.

Both verse 6:3 and 6:4 contain the 5 word consonantal sequence "וישאהו מבית אבינדב אשר בגבעה". In verse 6:3 this sequence begins after the 7-th word and has a zaqef qatan on the aleph of the first word, "וישאהו"; the word following the sequence is "ווְעֻזָּ֣א". In verse 6:4 this sequence starts the verse and has a revia on the aleph of the first word, "וישאהו" ; the word following the sequence is "עִ֖ם".

Careful examination by Ben Denckla of the erasure suggests that the erased consonantal text is a repetition of consonants of 2 Samuel 6:3.8-20. This consonantal text was then pointed with the points from 6:4.1-5. This can be seen by the revia on the "‬‏וַיִּשָּׂאֻ֗הוּ" in the erasure. The accents in the erasure stop after the 5-th word as the accent writer realized that the 6-th word didn't belong to 6:4.

The hypothesis is that the consonant writer repeated 6:3.8-20 thinking he was writing 6:4. When he realized his mistake, he then wrote the consonants for 6:4 and the remainder of the page. The accent writer applied 6:4 accents to the accidental repetition of 6:3.8-20, stopping when he reached the 6-th word which was incorrect for verse 6:4. A decision was then made to partially erase the repetition.

description: Partially erased text ends with this word. Add note 't'
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats alef qubuts revia he vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh qamats alef qubuts revia he vav dagesh
notes: This note and the note on the previous verse delimit an anomaly in the LC caused by scribal error. The error has been partially erased in the LC, but enough remains to understand what may have happened. The error has no effect on the transcription because the surrounding verses are legibly written.

The text preceding this word at column 2, line 3, of Folio_171B is partially erased in the LC. The erasure leaves only the top part of the text at the bottom of column 1 (as shown in the image) and at the top of column 2. Then 2 Samuel 6:4 appears legibly at column 2, line 3 of Folio_171B.

Both verse 6:3 and 6:4 contain the 5 word consonantal sequence "וישאהו מבית אבינדב אשר בגבעה". In verse 6:3 this sequence begins after the 7-th word and has a zaqef qatan on the aleph of the first word, "וישאהו"; the word following the sequence is "ווְעֻזָּ֣א". In verse 6:4 this sequence starts the verse and has a revia on the aleph of the first word, "וישאהו" ; the word following the sequence is "עִ֖ם".

Careful examination by Ben Denckla of the erasure suggests that the erased consonantal text is a repetition of consonants of 2 Samuel 6:3.8-20. This consonantal text was then pointed with the points from 6:4.1-5. This can be seen by the revia on the "‬‏וַיִּשָּׂאֻ֗הוּ" in the erasure. The accents in the erasure stop after the 5-th word as the accent writer realized that the 6-th word didn't belong to 6:4.

The hypothesis is that the consonant writer repeated 6:3.8-20 thinking he was writing 6:4. When he realized his mistake, he then wrote the consonants for 6:4 and the remainder of the page. The accent writer applied 6:4 accents to the accidental repetition of 6:3.8-20, stopping when he reached the 6-th word which was incorrect for verse 6:4. A decision was then made to partially erase the repetition.

description: Remove maqaf, merging 2 words to 1.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg het patah resh maqaf space alef patah mahapakh final-pe
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg het patah resh alef patah mahapakh final-pe
notes: UXLC word differs from the other texts. The UXLC does not split the 6 consonants between the resh and the aleph, lacks a maqaf after the resh, and has no sheva on the resh because neither is visible in the photo.

Ben Denckla: The BHL splits the 6 consonants between the resh and the aleph and adds a maqaf after the resh. It has no sheva on the resh. BHL Appendix A contains a p.m. (prima manus) note: "version by the first hand, changed subsequently (p. xxv)". It does NOT split the 6 consonants and has no maqaf. It does have a sheva on the resh, however. Perhaps the p.m. note refers only to the suggestion that the resh originally had a sheva under it.

description: Change qadma on nun to pashta on yod.
refuni: lamed sheva ayin tsere yod nun tsere qadma yod
changeuni: lamed sheva ayin tsere yod nun tsere yod pashta
notes: BHL has a pashta on yod. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Change munah to meteg under the aleph.
refuni: alef tsere munah yod final-nun
changeuni: alef tsere meteg yod final-nun
notes: The BHL has munah under the aleph. Surprisingly, BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM agrees with this change proposal and notes that L has meteg here.

description: Remove maqaf, merging 2 words to 1. Add note 'c'.
refuni: alef patah meteg het hataf-patah resh tsere yod maqaf space kaf tsere zaqef-qatan final-nun
changeuni: alef patah meteg het hataf-patah resh tsere yod kaf tsere zaqef-qatan final-nun
notes: UXLC word differs from the other texts. The UXLC does not split the 6 consonants between the resh and the yod also lacks a maqaf after the resh because no maqaf is visible in the photo.
The Sefaria MAM has a maqaf between the resh and the yod.
Ben Denckla: The BHL splits the 6 consonants between the resh and the yod and adds a maqaf after the resh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Add dagesh to zayin.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats zayin segol tevir he
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats zayin dagesh segol tevir he
notes: The dagesh on the zayin is dark and shaped like the dagesh in the bet.
The BHL has no dagesh in zayin. Surprisingly, BHL Appendix A does not have an entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM notes that L has a dagesh in the zayin of this word.

description: Move zaqef-qatan from het to dalet. Add 'c' note.
refuni: he patah het segol zaqef-qatan dalet segol resh
changeuni: he patah het segol dalet segol zaqef-qatan resh
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has zaqef-qatan on ḥet. BHL Appendix A agrees that L has zaqef-qatan on dalet.

description: Remove sheva from final kaf.
refuni: he patah mem dagesh segol zaqef-qatan lamed segol final-kaf sheva
changeuni: he patah mem dagesh segol zaqef-qatan lamed segol final-kaf
notes: Ben Denckla: BHL has kaf with sheva. BHL Appendix A has kaf without sheva.

description: Change resh to dalet. Add note 't' on second-to-last consonant.
refuni: ayin mem yod het vav resh
changeuni: ayin mem yod het vav dalet
notes: This is a ketiv word. Its consonants appear in the body of the LC text; the qere consonants appear in the margin. This word is a proper name of a king.

The next-to-last consonant (yod or vav) is ambiguous in the ketiv in the body text, but is clearly a vav in the qere in the margin. BHL Appendix A lists both possibilities (yod or vav). Ben Denckla: The LC is unique among sources studied by Breuer that has the possibility of a yod in the second-to-last position of this word.
The final letter is clearly a dalet in both ketiv and qere forms in the LC from the image. The BHL ends the ketiv with a resh; in BHL Appendix A both possibilities end in a dalet.

Ben Denckla: BHL ends the ketiv in a resh, עמיחור (last two letters vav-resh). BHL Appendix A lists two possible readings of the L ketiv, both ending in ד (dalet) and both question-marked: Reading 1: עמיחיד (?) (yod-dalet), Reading 2: עמיחוד (?) (vav-dalet).

description: Add yod between mem and tav.
refuni: vav dagesh nun sheva mem hiriq tav tsere pashta he vav dagesh pashta
changeuni: vav dagesh nun sheva mem hiriq yod tav tsere pashta he vav dagesh pashta
notes: The yod is well-formed, with the lower portion lighter probably due to flaking.

Ben Denckla: BHL has no yod (a חסר (ḥaser) (deficient) spelling). BHL Appendix A suggests the possibility of a yod (a מלא (malei) (full) spelling). That is, it lists the word spelled with a yod, but adds a question mark in parenthesis.

description: Consider moving the patah on the dalet to create a hataf-patah under the mem.
refuni: he patah meteg mem sheva dalet patah bet dagesh tsere mahapakh resh
changeuni: he patah meteg mem sheva dalet patah bet dagesh tsere mahapakh resh
notes: The top of the lamed of the following line interferes with the positioning of the patah. The space between the patah and the sheva is greater than expected for a hataf-patah.
The BHL agrees with the reference UXLC word. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM reads the LC and other manuscripts including Aleppo Codex as having ḥataf-pataḥ on mem here.

description: Consider adding note 't' for possible patah rather than hiriq under the mem.
refuni: mem hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah resh patah merkha tav
changeuni: mem hiriq shin sin-dot dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah resh patah merkha tav
notes: The dot of the hireq is significantly darker than the continuation which would make a patah.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a hiriq under the mem.

description: Change merkha to tevir under bet.
refuni: yod qamats bet merkha vav holam alef
changeuni: yod qamats bet tevir vav holam alef
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a tevir under the bet.

description: Change merkha under shin to tipeha.
refuni: kaf dagesh patah alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol merkha resh
changeuni: kaf dagesh patah alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol tipeha resh
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the shin.

description: Change tipeha under tet to meteg. Add note 'm'.
refuni: tet tipeha vav holam bet
changeuni: tet meteg vav holam bet
notes: The vertical line under the tet lacks the northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a tipeha under the tet.

description: Consider dagesh in nun for possible 't' note.
refuni: nun dagesh qamats revia alef
changeuni: nun dagesh qamats revia alef
notes: The text is in good condition near this word. The dot in the nun is well-positioned, but light.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a dagesh in the nun.

description: Add zaqef-qatan above shin. Add note 'c'.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh holam ayin tsere zaqef-qatan resh
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh holam ayin tsere zaqef-qatan resh
notes: The shin has a dark and well-positioned zaqef-qatan over it. This accent is unexpected here.
The BHL has no zaqef-qatan on the shin. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM appears to support the zaqef-qatan over the shin.
changeuni_gen: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh holam zaqef-qatan ayin tsere zaqef-qatan resh

description: Consider a possible accent segol above the aleph. Add note 't'.
refuni: shin shin-dot qamats alef zaqef-qatan vav dagesh lamed
changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats alef zaqef-qatan vav dagesh lamed
notes: The two dark dots above the aleph are significantly inclined from the vertical and the third, lighter, dot forms a putative segol. However, the writer of this page has a tendency to incline the dots of the zaqef-qatan as done in at least three other instances on this page.
The BHL has a zaqef-qatan on the aleph. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Remove sheva from final kaf.
refuni: he patah mem dagesh segol etnahta lamed segol final-kaf sheva
changeuni: he patah mem dagesh segol etnahta lamed segol final-kaf
notes: This is the first instance of three instances of the poetic word ending in ־הַמֶּלֶך in this verse. It's the only one without a sheva.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a sheva in the final kaf. BHL Appendix A agrees with this UXLC change proposal: it has a final kaf lacking a sheva.

description: Consider possible tevir rather than merkha under the nun.
refuni: he hiriq nun dagesh tsere merkha he
changeuni: he hiriq nun dagesh tsere merkha he
notes: The dot of the putative tevir is of a different color than other dots and slightly larger.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the nun.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq lamed dagesh qamats het hataf-patah mem merkha vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq lamed dagesh qamats het hataf-patah mem merkha vav dagesh
notes: Although other dots in this region of text are light, no dagesh is in the yod.
Ben Denckla: BHL has this yod with a dagesh. BHL Appendix A agrees that L has this yod without a dagesh.

description: Replace tipeha under nun with merkha.
refuni: vav sheva ayin tsere yod nun segol tipeha yod final-kaf qamats
changeuni: vav sheva ayin tsere yod nun segol merkha yod final-kaf qamats
notes: The vertical line under the nun has sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a merkha under the nun.

description: Replace merkha under first mem with tipeha.
refuni: resh qamats mem hiriq merkha yod final-mem
changeuni: resh qamats mem hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
notes: The Miqra According to the Masorah (MAM) has a tipeha under the first mem.

description: Remove hiriq from under kaf. Add note 'c'.
refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq yod telisha-qetana
changeuni: kaf dagesh yod telisha-qetana
notes: The word lacks a vowel, hence the 'c' note. The dot far below the kaf is from a holam on the following line.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a ḥiriq on this kaf. BHL Appendix A agrees that in L, this kaf lacks any vowel marking, and thus lacks the expected ḥiriq.

description: Change patah under ayin to hataf-patah. Add note 'c'.
refuni: he qamats meteg ayin patah nun dagesh sheva tav holam tav hiriq zaqef-qatan yod
changeuni: he qamats meteg ayin hataf-patah nun dagesh sheva tav holam tav hiriq zaqef-qatan yod
notes: The sheva-like part of the hataf-patah is widely separated from the patah part.
Ben Denckla: BHL has this ayin with a normal (full) pataḥ under the ayin. BHL Appendix A agrees that L has this ayin with a ḥataf pataḥ.

description: Remove hiriq from lamed. Add note 'c'.
refuni: yod sheva resh meteg vav dagesh shin shin-dot qamats lamed patah hiriq final-mem zinor
changeuni: yod sheva resh meteg vav dagesh shin shin-dot qamats lamed patah final-mem zinor
notes: Jerusalem normally has a hiriq as well as a patah on the lamed.
Ben Denckla: BHL has a pataḥ and then a ḥiriq on this lamed. BHL Appendix A agrees that in L, this lamed has only a pataḥ, i.e. this lamed lacks the expected ḥiriq.

description: Add dagesh to bet, add paseq at end of word.
refuni: he patah nun dagesh qamats bet hiriq qadma yod alef
changeuni: he patah nun dagesh qamats bet dagesh hiriq qadma yod alef space paseq
notes: The dagesh in the bet is reddish and larger than others. It is better than the dagesh in the nun. The paseq is the vertical line touching the knee of the following lamed.
The BHL has no dagesh in the bet and the word is followed by a paseq. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the bet; the paseq is not shown in the Appendix.
Ben Denckla pointed out the missing paseq which was not part of the original change.

description: Damaged text. Add note 't'.
refuni: het patah gimel dagesh tsere revia yod tav
changeuni: het patah gimel dagesh tsere revia yod tav
notes: The text is damaged, particularly on the gimel and yod.
The BHL has a dagesh, hireq, and revia on the gimel. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word, word 4; it does have an entry for words 6, 7, however.

description: Change patah under bet to segol.
refuni: shin shin-dot segol pashta bet patah ayin pashta
changeuni: shin shin-dot segol pashta bet patah ayin pashta
notes: The dots under the bet are dark and form a poorly-shaped segol.
The BHL has a patah under the bet. BHL Appendix A has a segol under the bet.
changeuni_gen: shin shin-dot segol pashta bet segol ayin pashta

description: Move dagesh in shin to nun.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qubuts nun patah mem dagesh hiriq yod tav pashta
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot qubuts nun dagesh patah mem dagesh hiriq yod tav pashta
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the shin; it has no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the nun and no dagesh in the shin.

description: Add dagesh to gimel.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva gimel hiriq bet sheva ayin revia vav holam final-nun
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva gimelt dagesh hiriq bet sheva ayin revia vav holam final-nun
notes: The dagesh is well-positioned, but light and reddish.
The BHL has a no dagesh in the gimel. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
changeuni_gen: bet dagesh sheva gimel dagesh hiriq bet sheva ayin revia vav holam final-nun

description: Change pashta to qadma to final kaf.
refuni: ayin patah bet sheva dalet dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats pashta
changeuni: ayin patah bet sheva dalet dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats qadma
notes: The BHL has a qadma on the final kaf. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Add qadma to kaf.
refuni: kaf dagesh qamats lamed maqaf
changeuni: kaf dagesh qamats qadma lamed maqaf
notes: The accent could also be a pashta depending on how its horizontal position is interpreted.
The BHL has a qadma on the kaf. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM positions this mark as a qadma in its transcription of the LC.

description: Remove dagesh from nun.
refuni: he patah nun dagesh hiriq tsadi dagesh qamats bet hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem
changeuni: he patah nun hiriq tsadi dagesh qamats bet hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem
notes: This change is analogous to that on 1 Kings 9:23.3.
The BHL has a dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the nun.

description: Change mahapakh under resh to munah.
refuni: vav sheva ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem
changeuni: vav sheva ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq munah yod final-mem
notes: This change is the reverse of the change for 1 Kings 6:3.6. Here under the resh the mahapakh becomes a munah; in 1 Kings 6:3.6 a munah becomes a mahapakh.
The BHL has hiriq, munah on the resh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Change munah under resh to mahapakh.
refuni: ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq munah yod final-mem
changeuni: ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq mahapakh yod final-mem
notes: This change is the reverse of the change for 1 Kings 6:2.10. Here under the resh the munah becomes a mahapakh; in 1 Kings 6:2.10 a mahapakh becomes a munah.
The BHL has a mahapakh, not a munah, on the resh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Remove maqaf.
refuni: alef segol tav maqaf
changeuni: alef segol tav
notes: The BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM reads LC as having no maqaf between את and הכרובים.

description: Remove dagesh from nun.
refuni: he patah nun dagesh hiriq tsadi dagesh qamats bet hiriq revia yod final-mem
changeuni: he patah nun hiriq tsadi dagesh qamats bet hiriq revia yod final-mem
notes: This change is analogous to that on 1 Kings 5:30.3.
The BHL has a dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the nun.

description: Change pashta on aleph to qadma on tsadi.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq mem sheva tsadi qamats alef pashta
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq mem sheva tsadi qamats qadma alef
notes: Although the position of the accent on the tsadi is late, the accent must be a qadma as it has no matching final pashta.
The BHL has a qadma on the tsadi. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Change segol under vav to patah. Add note 't'.
refuni: alef hataf-patah tsadi patah vav dagesh segol final-kaf qamats segol
changeuni: alef hataf-patah tsadi patah vav dagesh patah final-kaf qamats segol
notes: The marking under the vav is poorly written, but is clearly not a segol.
The BHL has a segol, not a patah, under the vav. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM supports replacing segol with pataḥ under vav of אצוך.
refuni_gen: alef hataf-patah tsadi patah vav dagesh segol final-kaf qamats segol-accent
changeuni_gen: alef hataf-patah tsadi patah vav dagesh patah final-kaf qamats segol-accent

description: Remove sheva from final kaf.
refuni: he patah mem dagesh segol munah lamed segol final-kaf sheva
changeuni: he patah mem dagesh segol munah lamed segol final-kaf
notes: This is the second "המלך" in the verse.
The BHL has a sheva on the final kaf. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Replace tipeha and patah from under resh with qamats. Poor text condition, add note 't'.
refuni: alef segol pe sheva resh patah tipeha yod hiriq final-mem
changeuni: alef segol pe sheva resh qamats yod hiriq final-mem
notes: The text is in poor condition; no tipeha is visible under the resh. This leaves the word without an accent. The blob in the second consonant could be mistaken for a dagesh; however, BHL and UXLC view it as part of a pe that was disconnected from the rest of the pe.
The BHL has a qamats (not a patah) and tipeha under the resh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM supports the replacement of the pataḥ with qamats; however, it asserts that there is a tipeḥa under the resh.

description: Add meteg under tav.
refuni: ayin qamats meteg tav dagesh qamats he sof-pasuq
changeuni: ayin qamats meteg tav dagesh qamats meteg he sof-pasuq
notes: The BHL has a meteg only on the ayin; it has no meteg on the tav. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM reads the L as in the proposed change with an unexpected second meteg.
Above, we use meteg without distinguishing it from siluq.

description: Move qadma on vav to the bet.
refuni: vav dagesh qadma bet sheva het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav zaqef-qatan vav holam
changeuni: vav dagesh bet sheva qadma het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav zaqef-qatan vav holam
notes: This change is analogous to that on 1 Kings 15:34.8.
The BHL has a qadma on the initial vav. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having qadma on bet.

description: Remove sheva from under qof.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof sheva shin shin-dot holam qadma resh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof shin shin-dot holam qadma resh
notes: The slash on the upper right before of the vav is the sof-pasuq of the preceding verse.
The BHL has a sheva under the qof. BHL Appendix A has no sheva under the qof.

description: Add dagesh to yod.
refuni: vav patah yod sheva mem hiriq tav tsere munah he vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh sheva mem hiriq tav tsere munah he vav dagesh
notes: The BHL has no dagesh on the yod. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having a dagesh in the yod of וימתהו.

description: Move qadma above initial vav to following bet.
refuni: vav dagesh qadma bet sheva het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav zaqef-qatan vav holam
changeuni: vav dagesh bet sheva qadma het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav zaqef-qatan vav holam
notes: This change is analogous to that on 1 Kings 15:26.8.
On the initial vav, BHL has a qadma in addition to the central dot (Unicode: dagesh) that makes the vav a shuruq. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having qadma on bet.

description: Change hataf-segol below the aleph to a hataf-patah. Remove munah below he. Add note 't'.
refuni: alef hataf-segol lamed holam he tsere munah yod
changeuni: alef hataf-patah lamed holam he tsere yod
notes: This section of text is of poor quality. No segol-like accent appears below the aleph. No munah is apparent below the he.
The BHL has a hataf-segol on the aleph and a tsere followed by munah on the he. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Remove qadma above the kaf. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem hiriq kaf dagesh holam qadma lamed
changeuni: mem hiriq kaf dagesh holam lamed
notes: This section of text is of poor quality. Two words are shown in the image; the first word is word 13, the subject of this change. The dagesh and the holam on the kaf are very faint. Comparing the lameds in both words shows no evidence of an accent on the final lamed of word 13.
The BHL has a holam and a dagesh on the kaf. It also has a pashta on the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Replace munah under lamed with meteg. Add maqaf to end of word. Add note 't'.
refuni: lamed hiriq munah yod
changeuni: lamed hiriq meteg yod maqaf
notes: This section of text is of poor quality. Note the verse has two words of lamed followed by yod; this word is the first lamed followed by yod. No munah is apparent on the lamed, the hiriq and meteg are very faint.
The BHL has a hiriq followed by munah under the lamed. It has no maqaf at the end of the word. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word; it does have an entry for word 16 in this verse, however.

description: Change munah under the bet to a mahapakh.
refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq dalet sheva bet patah munah resh
changeuni: kaf dagesh hiriq dalet sheva bet patah mahapakh resh
notes: The BHL has a patah then munah under the bet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having a mahapakh under the bet.

description: Remove tipeha under aleph. Add note 't'
refuni: resh sheva alef hiriq tipeha yod
changeuni: resh sheva alef hiriq yod
notes: The text quality is very poor here. The top, left side of the lamed on the following line might be taken as an accent on the aleph or yod. No tipeha under the aleph is apparent.
The BHL has a sheva under the resh and a hiriq and tipeha under the aleph. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Replace merkha under het with tipeha.
refuni: het patah merkha yod
changeuni: het patah tipeha yod
notes: The BHL has a patah and merkha under the het. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Replace hataf-patah under ayin with patah.
refuni: bet dagesh meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah ayin hataf-patah zayin qamats bet sheva kaf segol final-mem pashta
changeuni: bet dagesh meteg combining-grapheme-joiner patah ayin patah zayin qamats bet sheva kaf segol final-mem pashta
notes: The BHL has a hataf-patah under the ayin. BHL Appendix A has a patah under the ayin.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having a pataḥ under the ayin.

description: Remove dagesh on nun.
refuni: qof hiriq nun dagesh tsere geresh alef tav hiriq yod
changeuni: qof hiriq nun tsere geresh alef tav hiriq yod
notes: The BHL has a dagesh, tsere, and geresh on the nun. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having no dagesh in the nun.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq lamed dagesh qamats tipeha het segol final-mem
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq lamed dagesh qamats tipeha het segol final-mem
notes: The BHL has a hiriq and a dagesh on the yod. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the yod.

description: Move mahapakh under gimel to dalet.
refuni: he patah gimel dagesh qamats mahapakh dalet vav holam lamed
changeuni: he patah gimel dagesh qamats dalet mahapakh vav holam lamed
notes: The BHL has a mahapakh under the dalet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Change merkha under nun to meteg. Add maqaf to end of word.
refuni: nun holam merkha kaf patah het
changeuni: nun holam meteg kaf patah het maqaf
notes: The vertical line under the nun has a insufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha. The BHL has a meteg under the nun; thus no 'm' note has been added.
The BHL has a meteg under the nun and a maqaf at the end of the word. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.
Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM transcribes the LC as having meteg-maqaf (נֹֽכַח־) on this word.

description: Remove holam from lamed, add meteg to lamed.
refuni: lamed holam alef maqaf
changeuni: lamed meteg alef maqaf
notes: The BHL has a holam on the lamed and a meteg under lamed. BHL Appendix A has a meteg but no holam on the lamed.

description: Move tevir from tav to yod.
refuni: bet dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah lamed hiriq yod dagesh qamats tav tevir vav holam
changeuni: bet dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah lamed hiriq yod dagesh qamats tevir tav vav holam
notes: The sheva mark under the bet must belong to the patah under the ayin in the usual form of hataf-patah.
The BHL has a tevir on the tav. BHL Appendix A has the tevir on the yod. Both BHL and BHL Appendix A have a patah under the bet and a hataf-patah under the ayin.

description: Change accent over kaf from zaqef-qatan to revia.
refuni: mem patah lamed sheva alef qamats kaf hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
changeuni: mem patah lamed sheva alef qamats kaf hiriq revia yod final-mem
notes: The BHL has a revia on the kaf. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word, but has an entry for word 5.

description: Remove dagesh from nun.
refuni: vav qamats he tsere etnahta nun dagesh qamats he
changeuni: vav qamats he tsere etnahta nun qamats he
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Remove dagesh from shin, add dagesh to nun.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh vav dagesh nun patah mem dagesh hiriq merkha yod tav
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot vav dagesh nun dagesh patah mem dagesh hiriq merkha yod tav
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the shin and no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Add dagesh to nun.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qubuts nun patah mem dagesh hiriq munah yod tav
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qubuts nun dagesh patah mem dagesh hiriq munah yod tav
notes: The BHL has no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the nun. Both BHL and BHL Appendix A have a dagesh in the shin.

description: Remove dagesh from lamed.
refuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh segol lamed dagesh qamats tipeha nun vav dagesh
changeuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh segol lamed qamats tipeha nun vav dagesh
notes: The BHL has dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the lamed.

description: Change sheva under resh to patah.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah revia resh sheva alef
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah revia resh patah alef
notes: The BHL has sheva on the resh. BHL Appendix A has a patah on the resh.

description: Consider first letter as possible bet.
refuni: kaf dagesh patah alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh maqaf
changeuni: kaf dagesh patah alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh maqaf
notes: The bump on the leading edge of the putative bet is higher than expected and is slightly off-color with the bet itself.
The BHL has kaf as the initial consonant. BHL Appendix A has a bet as the initial letter and a question mark (?).

description: Change hataf-patah under het to sheva.
refuni: het hataf-patah zayin qamats he alef tsere zaqef-qatan lamed
changeuni: het sheva zayin qamats he alef tsere zaqef-qatan lamed
notes: The BHL has a hataf-patah under the het. BHL Appendix A has sheva on the het.

description: Change merkha under nun to tipeha.
refuni: mem hiriq pe dagesh sheva nun tsere merkha yod
changeuni: mem hiriq pe dagesh sheva nun tsere tipeha yod
notes: The BHL has a tipeha under the nun. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Change tipeha under aleph to meteg. Add note 'm'.
refuni: het hataf-patah zayin qamats alef tsere tipeha lamed
changeuni: het hataf-patah zayin qamats alef tsere meteg lamed
notes: The vertical line under the aleph lacks sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
The BHL has a merkha under the aleph, not a tipeha. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Replace sheva on shin with patah. Add 't' note. Replace merkha on lamed with meteg. Add 'm' note.
refuni: vav dagesh meteg shin shin-dot sheva lamed patah merkha het
changeuni: vav dagesh meteg shin shin-dot patah lamed patah meteg het
notes: The vowel under the shin is hard to determine. A patah is a better fit than a sheva.

A blob emerges from the top of the lamed of a word on the following line; word 22 of this verse. The blob might be considered in determining the markings on the shin of this word, word 19. There is a similar blob emerging from the lamed of the 5-th word of this verse. Consequently, the blob is considered to be an odd part of the lamed of word 22 and not part of the markings on the shin of word 19.
The BHL has a hataf patah under the shin and a merkha under the lamed. BHL Appendix A has a patah under the shin.

description: Replace merkha under pe with tipeha.
refuni: vav sheva kaf patah pe dagesh merkha vav holam tav
changeuni: vav sheva kaf patah pe dagesh merkha vav holam tav
notes: The BHL has merkha under the pe. BHL Appendix A has a tipeha under the pe.
changeuni_gen: vav sheva kaf patah pe dagesh tipeha vav holam tav

description: Remove munah from under shin.
refuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol munah resh
changeuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh
notes: This word does not have a maqaf in the LC and is therefore lacking an accent.
The BHL has no accent under the shin and a final maqaf. BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word; it has an entry for word 10.

description: Change hataf-patah under ayin to patah. Change merkha under shin to meteg. Add note 'm'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah meteg ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot segol merkha he
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah meteg ayin patah shin sin-dot segol meteg he
notes: The vertical line under the shin lacks sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
The BHL has a patah then meteg under yod, a hataf-patah under the ayin, and a segol then merkha under the shin (as shown in the Reference text above); BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Replace revia on samekh with telisha-gedola.
refuni: samekh qamats revia resh
changeuni: samekh qamats telisha-gedola resh
notes: Although the "tail" of the telisha isn't visible, the circle in the image is prepositive. Hence it is transcribed as a telisha-gedola.
The BHL has a telisha-gedola above the samekh; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Replace munah under samekh with meteg. Add note 't'.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva samekh tsere munah pe segol resh
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva samekh tsere meteg pe segol resh
notes: The vertical line under the samekh has a slight northwest-to-southeast inclination and might be transcribed as a tipeha. A tipeha is unexpected here, however.

An erasure appears to have occurred at the lower, left corner of the line under the samekh. This erasure might have been of the horizontal line of a munah. The vertical line of a munah has a slight northwest-to-southeast inclination and if the horizontal line of a munah is erased, the result would have the shape shown in the image; a slightly inclined meteg. The immediately preceding word, on the preceding line, has a munah. The accent under the samekh is transcribed here as a meteg reflecting this possibility and marked with a 't' note.
The BHL has meteg under the samekh; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

Ben Denckla: Breuer-DM reveals that there is a tradition, attested in the Cairo Codex of the Prophets and other sources, of having munaḥ-space on this word (בְּסֵ֣פֶר) instead of meteg-maqaf (בְּסֵֽפֶר־).

description: Markings on aleph are unclear. Add note 't'.
refuni: alef qamats munah zayin
changeuni: alef qamats munah zayin
notes: The ink on this word is flaking off.
The BHL has a qamats then munah under the aleph; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Consider changing the geresh then telisha-gedola on shin to geresh-muqdam then telisha-qetana.
refuni: shin shin-dot qubuts geresh telisha-gedola bet vav dagesh
changeuni: shin shin-dot qubuts geresh telisha-gedola bet vav dagesh
notes: The geresh-muqdam accent only occurs in the Sifrei Emet; 2 Kings is not in the Sifrei Emet; hence the first accent is a geresh.

The position of the circle and angle of the "tail" determine the difference between a telisha-gedola (prepositive, tail northeast-to-southwest) and a telisha qetana (postpositive, tail northwest-to-southeast). The tail of the telisha is not visible in the image. Since the telisha is on the first consonant of the word, the telisha is prepositive; hence the telisha is a telisha-gedola.
The BHL has a geresh followed by a telisha-gedola above the shin; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Remove geresh from kaf.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere qadma lamed sheva kaf geresh vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh tsere qadma lamed sheva kaf vav dagesh
notes: The BHL has a geresh above the kaf; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Replace revia on mem with zaqef-qatan.
refuni: shin shin-dot qamats mem patah revia ayin sheva tav dagesh qamats
changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats mem patah zaqef-qatan ayin sheva tav dagesh qamats
notes: The BHL has a zaqef-qatan above the mem; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Replace zaqef-qatan above shin with revia. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem sheva nun patah shin shin-dot dagesh segol zaqef-qatan he
changeuni: mem sheva nun patah shin shin-dot dagesh segol revia he
notes: A faint blurr above the left-most dot above the shin may have made the accent a zaqef-qatan. The accent will be transcribed as a revia.
The BHL has a revia above the shin; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Replace revia above kaf with telisha-gedola.
refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq revia yod
changeuni: kaf dagesh hiriq telisha-gedola yod
notes: The BHL has a telisha-gedola above the kaf; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Remove qadma above nun, add pashta to he.
refuni: shin shin-dot qamats nun qamats qadma he
changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats nun qamats he pashta
notes: The BHL has a pashta above the he; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Replace tipeha under the lamed with tevir.
refuni: ayin qamats lamed segol tipeha yod he qamats
changeuni: ayin qamats lamed segol tevir yod he qamats
notes: The BHL has a segol then tevir on the lamed; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Replace merkha under the yod with tipeha.
refuni: dalet dagesh qamats yod tsere merkha qof
changeuni: dalet dagesh qamats yod tsere tipeha qof
notes: The BHL has a tipeha on the yod; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Move munah under resh to under the bet.
refuni: shin shin-dot hiriq bet dagesh sheva resh munah vav dagesh
changeuni: shin shin-dot hiriq bet dagesh sheva munah resh vav dagesh
notes: The BHL has a munah under the resh; BHL Appendix A has no entries for this word.

description: Remove holam from vav.
refuni: he patah mem dagesh hiriq zayin sheva resh qamats qof revia vav holam tav
changeuni: he patah mem dagesh hiriq zayin sheva resh qamats qof revia vav tav
notes: The BHL has a holam on the vav; BHL Appendix A shows no holam on the vav.

description: Change patah on qof to qamats.
refuni: bet dagesh hiriq tav sheva qof patah merkha final-pe
changeuni: bet dagesh hiriq tav sheva qof qamats merkha final-pe
notes: The dot between the horizontal bar and the merkha under the qof is dark and well-positioned.
BHL has qamats on this qof; BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Add Unicode paseq at end of word, making a legarmeh after the bet.
refuni: vav qamats alef tsere shin shin-dot tsere munah bet
changeuni: vav qamats alef tsere shin shin-dot tsere munah bet space paseq

description: Change merkha on bet to tipeha.
refuni: tet vav holam bet qamats merkha he
changeuni: tet vav holam bet qamats tipeha he

description: Add dagesh to lamed.
refuni: lamed hiriq meteg yod resh hiriq yod het vav holam pashta
changeuni: lamed dagesh hiriq meteg yod resh hiriq yod het vav holam pashta
notes: Ben Denckla: The BHL agrees that L has this dagesh. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Remove dagesh from bet and add rafe.
refuni: bet dagesh segol final-nun maqaf
changeuni: bet rafe segol final-nun maqaf
notes: The bet in the LC has a dark rafe and a faint, but well-positioned, potential dagesh. The potential dagesh might also be an erasure or spot on the vellum. By Masoretic practice the rafe indicates the absence of a dagesh. The UXLC conforms to this practice and eliminates the dagesh. Although the UXLC doesn't normally show rafe marks, one is added here as its presence is key to the transcription.
Ben Denckla: The BHL has no dagesh on the bet. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this word.

description: Change revia on tsadi to zaqef qatan.
refuni: vav dagesh mem patah tsadi dagesh hiriq revia lamed
changeuni: vav dagesh mem patah tsadi dagesh hiriq zaqef-qatan lamed
notes: BHL has a zaqef qatan over the tsadi. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Possible dagesh in alef. Add note 't'.
refuni: lamed sheva alef patah etnahta tet
changeuni: lamed sheva alef patah etnahta tet
notes: The putative dagesh is well-sized and well-positioned, but reddish. Alefs normally do not have dageshes.
BHL has no dagesh in the alef. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the alef.

description: Possible sheva on yod. Add note 't'
refuni: alef segol pe sheva resh patah pashta yod hiriq final-mem pashta
changeuni: alef segol pe sheva resh patah pashta yod hiriq final-mem pashta
notes: The putative upper sheva dot on the yod is well-sized, reddish and positioned to the right of the lower dot.
BHL has hireq on the yod. BHL Appendix A has a sheva on the yod.

description: Possible dagesh in samekh. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem hiriq kaf dagesh hiriq samekh sheva alef vav holam tav qamats zaqef-qatan final-mem
changeuni: mem hiriq kaf dagesh hiriq samekh sheva alef vav holam tav qamats zaqef-qatan final-mem
notes: The dageshes in both the kaf and the samekh are of poor quality. The dagesh in the samekh is reddish and slightly larger.
BHL has no dagesh in the samekh. BHL Appendix A has no note on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from bet.
refuni: nun hiriq kaf sheva bet dagesh patah dalet dagesh tsere yod maqaf
changeuni: nun hiriq kaf sheva bet patah dalet dagesh tsere yod maqaf
notes: An unusual, short, northeast-to-southwest inclined line occurs at the top of the yod.
BHL has a dagesh in the bet. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the bet. Both the BHL and BHL Appendix A end this word with a maqaf.

description: Move mahapakh from nun to dalet.
refuni: vav sheva nun qamats mahapakh dalet vav holam shin shin-dot
changeuni: vav sheva nun qamats dalet mahapakh vav holam shin shin-dot
notes: The mahapakh is well-removed from the nun.
BHL has the mahapakh on the dalet. BHL Appendix A has no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from nun.
refuni: vav sheva he patah nun dagesh hiriq dalet dagesh qamats het hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
changeuni: vav sheva he patah nun hiriq dalet dagesh qamats het hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
notes: BHL has a dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the nun.

description: Remove dagesh from mem.
refuni: vav sheva he patah mem dagesh patah samekh dagesh tsere kaf qamats merkha he
changeuni: vav sheva he patah mem patah samekh dagesh tsere kaf qamats merkha he
notes: BHL has a dagesh in the mem. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the mem.

description: Add patah under yod.
refuni: vav hiriq meteg yod shin sin-dot patah dalet dagesh tsere tipeha dalet
changeuni: vav hiriq meteg yod patah shin sin-dot patah dalet dagesh tsere tipeha dalet
notes: BHL has no patah under the yod. BHL Appendix A has a patah under the yod.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: resh patah bet maqaf
changeuni: resh patah bet
notes: The gap between the bet and the shin is a good word space as recognized in BHL Appendix A. This leaves this word without an accent, however.
BHL has a maqaf after the bet. BHL Appendix A has a space rather than a maqaf after the bet.

description: Remove dagesh from tet.
refuni: he patah bet dagesh hiriq tet dagesh qamats het tevir vav holam final-nun
changeuni: he patah bet dagesh hiriq tet qamats het tevir vav holam final-nun
notes: BHL has a dagesh in the tet. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the tet.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: resh patah bet maqaf
changeuni: resh patah bet
notes: The maqaf of the preceding word is clear; this word has no maqaf.
BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no maqaf after the bet.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: resh patah bet maqaf
changeuni: resh patah bet
notes: BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no maqaf after the bet.

description: Examine maqaf at end of word. Add note 't'.
refuni: resh patah bet maqaf
changeuni: resh patah bet maqaf
notes: The image shows a slight horizontal shape on the leading fork of the shin. Other local shins do not have similar shapes on the leading fork.
BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no comment on this word.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav sheva het patah yod dagesh qamats tav zaqef-qatan vav holam
changeuni: vav sheva het patah yod qamats tav zaqef-qatan vav holam
notes: The yod appears to have been redrawn, but has no dagesh.
BHL has a dagesh in the yod. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the yod.

description: Consider replacing qadma with pashta.
refuni: he hataf-patah yod holam alef mem patah qadma resh
changeuni: he hataf-patah yod holam alef mem patah qadma resh
notes: Pashtas are postfix accents; if a word has a single pashta it must be written at the end of the word. If a word has two pashtas at one of them must occur on the last consonant of the word; the non-postfix pashta is sometimes called an accent helper pashta. A pashta is normally written on the left side of its consonant; however, with hand written text this positioning on the consonant is NOT determinant. A qadma is normally written over the center of the consonant. Positioning of a pashta or qadma is difficult only when the accent occurs on the last letter. Since the accent in question does not appear on the last letter and the last consonant does not have a pashta this accent is a qadma.
BHL has a qadma over the mem. BHL Appendix A has no comment on this verse.

description: Remove sheva from samekh.
refuni: mem vav holam samekh sheva resh tsere munah yod
changeuni: mem vav holam samekh resh tsere munah yod
notes: BHL has a sheva under the samekh. BHL Appendix A has no sheva under the samekh.

description: Add dagesh to the alef.
refuni: mem hiriq nun dagesh holam alef qamats meteg final-tsadi sof-pasuq
changeuni: mem hiriq nun dagesh holam alef dagesh qamats meteg final-tsadi sof-pasuq
notes: The dagesh in the alef is unusual, but dark, well-sized, and well-positioned.
BHL has no dagesh in the alef. BHL Appendix A has dagesh in the alef.

description: Possible erased yod between tsadi and resh.
refuni: tsadi hiriq resh patah pashta yod hiriq final-kaf sheva pashta
changeuni: tsadi hiriq resh patah pashta yod hiriq final-kaf sheva pashta
notes: The quality of the text in this region is poor. Although sufficient space exists between the tsadi and the resh for a yod, the evidence is insufficient to insert a yod.
BHL has no consonant between the tsadi and the resh. BHL Appendix A has a yod between the tsadi and the resh and adds a (p.m.) note indicating the yod may have been originally present, then erased.

description: Move tipeha from final kaf to tav.
refuni: vav segol he hataf-segol mem hiriq yod tav sheva final-kaf qamats tipeha
changeuni: vav segol he hataf-segol mem hiriq yod tav sheva tipeha final-kaf qamats
notes: BHL has the tipeha on the final kaf. BHL Appendix A has the tipeha on the tav.

description: Move pashta from first yod to second yod.
refuni: he qamats yod hiriq pashta yod tav hiriq yod pashta
changeuni: he qamats yod hiriq yod pashta tav hiriq yod pashta
notes: BHL has a pashta over the first yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from dalet.
refuni: dalet dagesh patah resh sheva kaf dagesh tsere tipeha final-kaf sheva
changeuni: dalet patah resh sheva kaf dagesh tsere tipeha final-kaf sheva
notes: The dalet has a rafe over it, confirming that it doesn't have a dagesh. The UXLC shows rafe accents in special situations; this is not a special situation.
BHL has no dagesh in the dalet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change patah to hataf patah under alef.
refuni: vav dagesh mem tsere alef patah het hataf-patah resh patah tipeha yod
changeuni: vav dagesh mem tsere alef hataf-patah het hataf-patah resh patah tipeha yod
notes: The space between the elements of the hataf patah (sheva, patah) is larger than expected. Both elements are distinct and dark.
BHL has a patah under the alef. BHL Appendix A has a hataf patah under the alef.

description: Change hiriq under mem to sheva.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva mem hiriq shin shin-dot sheva pe dagesh qamats munah tet
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva mem sheva shin shin-dot sheva pe dagesh qamats munah tet
notes: BHL has a sheva under the bet and a hireq under the mem. BHL Appendix A has a sheva under both the bet and the mem.

description: Remove dagesh from samekh.
refuni: mem hiriq meteg samekh dagesh qubuts bet dagesh sheva kaf zaqef-qatan vav holam
changeuni: mem hiriq meteg samekh qubuts bet dagesh sheva kaf zaqef-qatan vav holam
notes: The putative dagesh in the samekh is diffuse and not as dark as the dagesh in the bet.
BHL has a dagesh in the samekh. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the samekh and adds a '?'.

description: Remove maqaf at end of word.
refuni: ayin patah lamed maqaf
changeuni: ayin patah lamed
notes: BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no maqaf at the end of this word.

description: Move qamats from yod to nun.
refuni: bet hiriq nun yod qamats mem hiriq revia final-nun
changeuni: bet hiriq nun qamats yod mem hiriq revia final-nun
notes: The usual marking for this word, Benjamin, is with a sheva under the nun and a qamats under the yod.
BHL has a sheva under the nun and qamats under the yod. BHL Appendix A has a qamats under the nun and nothing under the yod.

description: Remove sheva on the ayin.
refuni: shin shin-dot qamats mem patah merkha ayin sheva nun vav dagesh
changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats mem patah merkha ayin nun vav dagesh
notes: BHL has a sheva on the ayin. BHL Appendix A has no sheva on the ayin.

description: Change merkha under qof to tipeha.
refuni: bet dagesh patah mem dagesh qamats qof merkha vav holam final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh patah mem dagesh qamats qof tipeha vav holam final-mem
notes: BHL has a tipeha on the qof. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Replace zaqef qatan with revia. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva meteg nun qamats alef holam zaqef-qatan final-pe
changeuni: vav sheva meteg nun qamats alef holam revia final-pe
notes: The text is in bad condition for this word. The markings above the alef are hard to recognize. The image more nearly supports a revia rather than a zaqef qatan.
BHL has a zaqef-qatan on the alef. BHL Appendix A has a revia on the alef and a '?' note.

description: Examine for possible dagesh belonging to the first vav.
refuni: he hiriq meteg shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav tipeha vav dagesh
changeuni: he hiriq meteg shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav tipeha vav dagesh
notes: The quality of the text in this region is poor. In question is the bump on the leading edge of the second vav; it might possibly be a dagesh on the first vav. Note a similar bump occurs on the inner, left leg of the preceding tav.
BHL has no dagesh on the first vav; it has a dagesh on the second vav. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh on the first and second vavs.

description: Examine for possible revia on gimel. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva ayin qamats gimel zaqef-qatan vav dagesh resh
changeuni: vav sheva ayin qamats gimel zaqef-qatan vav dagesh resh
notes: The quality of the text in this region is poor. The mark above the gimel has a slight vertical orientation and is likely to have been a zaqef qatan.
BHL has zaqef qatan on the gimel. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change revia on the second samekh to zaqef qatan.
refuni: samekh vav dagesh samekh qamats revia yod vav
changeuni: samekh vav dagesh samekh qamats revia yod vav
notes: The accent on the second samekh has two dots. Compare with the zaqef qatan of the following line shown below the first samekh.
BHL has zaqef qatan on the samekh. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.
changeuni_gen: samekh vav dagesh samekh qamats zaqef-qatan yod vav

description: Add a dagesh to the tsadi.
refuni: he patah tsadi hataf-qamats resh hiriq yod pashta
changeuni: he patah tsadi dagesh hataf-qamats resh hiriq yod pashta
notes: BHL has dagesh in the tsadi. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change tipeha under the lamed to a merkha.
refuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh sheva lamed hiriq tipeha yod
changeuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh sheva lamed hiriq merkha yod
notes: The line under the lamed has the distinct northeast-to-southwest inclination of a merkha.
BHL has merkha under the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change tipeha under lamed to meteg. Add transcription note 'm'.
refuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh sheva lamed hiriq tipeha yod
changeuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh sheva lamed hiriq meteg yod
notes: The accent under the lamed is a vertical line. It is probably a merkha but will be replaced by a meteg and transcription note 'm'.
BHL has a merkha under the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove maqaf at end of word.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva ayin tsere merkha tav maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva ayin tsere merkha tav
notes: BHL has no maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove maqaf at end of word.
refuni: he qamats ayin qamats mahapakh final-mem maqaf
changeuni: he qamats ayin qamats mahapakh final-mem
notes: The text in this region has light smudges in many places. The ink of the text is dark and shows no maqaf at the end of the word.
BHL has no maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move munah from bet to yod.
refuni: yod qamats bet munah vav holam alef
changeuni: yod qamats munah bet munah vav holam alef
notes: The accents are crowded under the yod. Plenty of space is available under the bet if that was the scribe's intention. This change is similar to that on Jer 17:8.14 below.
BHL has a qamats and munah under the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.
changeuni_gen: yod qamats munah bet vav holam alef

description: Remove dagesh from lamed.
refuni: yod sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed dagesh patah munah het
changeuni: yod sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed patah munah het
notes: BHL has a dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move munah from bet to yod.
refuni: yod qamats bet holam munah alef
changeuni: yod qamats munah bet holam alef
notes: This change is similar to that on Jer 17:6.7 above.
BHL has a qamats and munah under the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Replace munah under the bet with merkha.
refuni: vav sheva nun patah het sheva shin shin-dot sheva bet qamats munah he
changeuni: vav sheva nun patah het sheva shin shin-dot sheva bet qamats merkha he
notes: The markings under the bet are influenced by the top of a lamed on the following line. The qamats under the bet is advanced and the merkha is retarded to avoid the top of the lamed. The line under the bet has sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be a merkha. The merkha line is unusually thin.
BHL has a qamats and merkha under the bet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.
Aside: The lower dot of the sheva under the shin has been overwritten by a masorah circle on the following line. BHL has a sheva under the shin.

description: Possible dagesh in lamed. Add note 't'
refuni: lamed sheva final-kaf qamats tipeha
changeuni: lamed sheva final-kaf qamats tipeha
notes: A well-positioned, well-sized, but very faint dot is apparent in the lamed. The text here is of good quality.
BHL has no dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: kaf dagesh patah yod dagesh holam lamed tsere dalet qamats meteg he sof-pasuq
changeuni: kaf dagesh patah yod holam lamed tsere dalet qamats meteg he sof-pasuq
notes: BHL has a dagesh in the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.
Aside: The first dot of the tsere under the lamed is very light. BHL has a sheva under the lamed.

description: Change zaqef qatan on kaf to revia. Add note 't.
refuni: shin shin-dot hiriq kaf dagesh zaqef-qatan vav holam resh
changeuni: shin shin-dot hiriq kaf dagesh revia vav holam resh
notes: The marking on the kaf lacks a sufficiently dark upper dot to be transcribed as a zaqef qatan. It will be transcribed as a revia with a 't' note.
BHL has a zaqef qatan on the kaf. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.
