description: Change hataf-patah on alef to patah.
refuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol darga resh
changeuni: alef patah shin shin-dot segol darga resh
notes: The spot on the lower right of the alef might have been an erasure.
BHL has a hataf-patah on the alef. BHL Appendix A has a patah on the alef.

description: Remove dagesh from second mem.
refuni: vav dagesh mem hiriq mem dagesh sheva ayin mahapakh vav holam final-nun
changeuni: vav dagesh mem hiriq mem sheva ayin mahapakh vav holam final-nun
notes: The second mem has a well-centered, but very faint spot that might have been a dagesh.
BHL has a no dagesh on the first mem, it has a dagesh on the second mem. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the second mem.

description: Change qadma on resh to pashta on yod. Add note 't'.
refuni: dalet dagesh hiriq bet sheva resh tsere qadma yod
changeuni: dalet dagesh hiriq bet sheva resh tsere yod pashta
notes: The accent starts at the top of the yod, rather than the sloping later part of the yod. Distinguishing between a qadma or pashta is difficult on such a thin letter. Pashtas occur more frequently on the final letter of a word than qadmas. Ben Denckla offers a cantillation rule: "When a qadma/pashta appears on a letter that closes a syllable and ends a word ... it should be interpreted as a pashta". Given the uncertainty and need to transcribe the accent, the accent is transcribed here as a pashta with a 't' added.

BHL has a qadma/pashta on the yod, not the resh. The difference between these two accents is hard to determine on such a thin consonant, even on a printed page. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh on bet.
refuni: nun hiriq bet dagesh tsere qadma yod tav qamats
changeuni: nun hiriq bet tsere qadma yod tav qamats
notes: BHL has a dagesh on the bet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Examine whether first consonant is bet or kaf. Add note 't'.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva shin shin-dot tsere munah final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva shin shin-dot tsere munah final-mem
notes: The scribe doesn't distinguish very well on this page between a bet and a kaf. A kaf is extremely unlikely in this context.
BHL has a bet as the first consonant. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Severely damaged text. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah meteg ayin hataf-patah bet qamats dalet etnahta vav holam
changeuni: vav patah meteg ayin hataf-patah bet qamats dalet etnahta vav holam
notes: This word and the following 3 words are severely damaged, effectively unreadable. The 4 damaged words are the first 4 words on line 18 of the LC. The limitation of the damage to these 4 words is suspicious. Ben Denckla: The under marks are quite clear, however.
The UXLC text agrees with the BHL although the BHL doesn't indicate any problem with the LC text. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Severely damaged text. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva he hiriq nun dagesh patah het sheva tav dagesh hiriq mahapakh yod
changeuni: vav sheva he hiriq nun dagesh patah het sheva tav dagesh hiriq mahapakh yod
notes: This word, the preceding word, and the following 2 words are severely damaged, effectively unreadable. The 4 damaged words are the first 4 words on line 18 of the LC. The limitation of the damage to these 4 words is suspicious. Ben Denckla: The under marks are quite clear, however.
The UXLC text agrees with the BHL although the BHL doesn't indicate any problem with the LC text. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Severely damaged text. Add note 't'.
refuni: ayin patah lamed maqaf
changeuni: ayin patah lamed maqaf
notes: This word, the 2 preceding words, and the following word are severely damaged, effectively unreadable. The 4 damaged words are the first 4 words on line 18 of the LC. The limitation of the damage to these 4 words is suspicious. Ben Denckla: The under marks are quite clear, however.
The UXLC text agrees with the BHL although the BHL doesn't indicate any problem with the LC text. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Severely damaged text. Add note 't'.
refuni: alef patah dalet sheva mem qamats tav vav holam pashta
changeuni: alef patah dalet sheva mem qamats tav vav holam pashta
notes: This word and the 3 preceding words are severely damaged, effectively unreadable. The 4 damaged words are the first 4 words on line 18 of the LC. The limitation of the damage to these 4 words is suspicious. Ben Denckla: The under marks are quite clear, however.
The UXLC text agrees with the BHL although the BHL doesn't indicate any problem with the LC text. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change gershayim above the bet to a zaqef gadol.
refuni: shin shin-dot qamats bet patah gershayim resh sheva tav dagesh hiriq yod
changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats bet patah zaqef-gadol resh sheva tav dagesh hiriq yod
notes: The BHL has a zaqef gadol over the bet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Severely damaged text. Add note 't'.
refuni: yod hiriq vav dagesh qamats dalet patah ayin pashta
changeuni: yod hiriq vav dagesh qamats dalet patah ayin pashta
notes: The UXLC text agrees with the BHL although the BHL doesn't indicate any problem with the LC text. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Examine zaqef qatan over the bet.
refuni: he patah nun dagesh qamats bet hiriq zaqef-qatan yod alef
changeuni: he patah nun dagesh qamats bet hiriq zaqef-qatan yod alef
notes: The text is severely damaged in this area. A zaqef qatan is a reasonable choice for the accent over the bet.
The UXLC text agrees with the BHL although the BHL doesn't indicate any problem with the LC text. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change merkha under kaf to tevir. Add 'c' note.
refuni: nun sheva bet hiriq meteg yod alef tsere yod kaf segol merkha final-mem
changeuni: nun sheva bet hiriq meteg yod alef tsere yod kaf segol tevir final-mem
notes: The dot on the tevir is well-sized, well-positioned, and dark; however, it is slightly brownish.
The BHL has a tevir under the kaf. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

Because the preceding word, לָכֶ֛ם, has a tevir accent, this change produces two consecutive words with tevir accents. Although these markings occur in BHL without comment, they're unexpected according to current cantillation rules. Hence, a 'c' note is added.

description: Remove dagesh from nun.
refuni: he patah meteg nun dagesh hiriq bet dagesh sheva alef hiriq merkha yod final-mem
changeuni: he patah meteg nun hiriq bet dagesh sheva alef hiriq merkha yod final-mem
notes: The BHL has no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move zaqef qatan from over the nun to over the yod.
refuni: vav sheva meteg nun hiriq bet sheva nun tsere zaqef-qatan yod tav
changeuni: vav sheva meteg nun hiriq bet sheva nun tsere yod zaqef-qatan tav
notes: The lower dot of the zaqef qatan contacts the top of the yod.

The BHL and UXLC have different versification of Jeremiah chapters 30 and 31. In the BHL chapter 30 has 25 verses; the UXLC has 24 verses. BHL verse 30:25 is UXLC verse 31:1; hence this UXLC verse, 31.4, is BHL verse 31.3. The BHL has a zaqef qatan on the nun. BHL Appendix A has the zaqef qatan on the yod.

description: Change tipeha under alef to munah.
refuni: mem tsere alef segol tipeha resh segol final-tsadi
changeuni: mem tsere alef segol munah resh segol final-tsadi
notes: This is BHL Jeremiah 31:31. The BHL has a munah under the alef. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove maqaf at end of word.
refuni: vav sheva ayin holam merkha shin sin-dot segol he maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva ayin holam merkha shin sin-dot segol he
notes: The text is in good condition around this word. The space between this word and the next is slightly darker than the spaces before the current word and following the subsequent word. This may be an erased maqaf.
The BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change yetiv on lamed to mahapakh.
refuni: lamed holam yetiv alef
changeuni: lamed holam mahapakh alef
notes: A yetiv is prepositive, that is, a yetiv appears on the leading edge of a consonant. This accent is not prepositive and is therefore a mahapakh.
The BHL has a mahapakh on the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Add revia above the yod.
refuni: vav dagesh bet sheva yod patah dalet
changeuni: vav dagesh bet sheva yod patah revia dalet
notes: A previous change in Changes file 2021.10.19 - Changes, change 2021.08.07 - 7, had an incorrect image for this word. The image was of word 10. The error has been corrected in the Changes file 2021.10.19 - Changes on 15 Jan 2023.
This word, 13, has a revia above the yod. The transcription note 'c' from the previous change, which was based on an incorrect image, will be removed.
The BHL has a revia above the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Consider merging this word with following word. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva nun hiriq qadma shin shin-dot sheva alef hataf-patah resh vav dagesh
changeuni: vav sheva nun hiriq qadma shin shin-dot sheva alef hataf-patah resh vav dagesh
notes: No maqaf occurs at the end of this word, ונשארו. The spacing between the final vav of this word and the bet of the next word, בם, is very small. The UXLC interprets words 9, 10 as two distinct words and adds a 't' note.

The BHL has qadma on the nun and a maqaf at the end of this word. The following BHL word, בם, has a zaqef qatan over the bet which would indicate the BHL poetic word (words 9, 10) has two accents; together, these two accents would represent a metigah-zaqef accent. A metigah exists only as part of a two-accent-on-a-poetic-word combination called a metigah-zaqef. The zaqef in a metigah-zaqef is always a zaqef qatan. BHL Appendix A has words (9, 10) without a space or a maqaf and a '?' mark; together, these two accents would represent a metigah-zaqef accent on the compound word.

description: Add dagesh to lamed. Add note 't'
refuni: lamed tsere alef mem holam etnahta resh
changeuni: lamed dagesh tsere alef mem holam etnahta resh
notes: The dagesh is well-positioned, reasonably dark, but oddly shaped. The region around the horizontal bar of the lamed is very dirty.
The BHL has no dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Consider removing dagesh from lamed. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed dagesh sheva het tsere darga final-mem
changeuni: vav patah yod sheva shin shin-dot patah lamed dagesh sheva het tsere darga final-mem
notes: The dagesh in the lamed is well-positioned, but small and faint.
The BHL has a dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the lamed and a '?' mark.

description: Change patah on tsadi to qamats.
refuni: bet dagesh patah het hataf-patah tsadi patah tipeha resh
changeuni: bet dagesh patah het hataf-patah tsadi qamats tipeha resh
notes: The dot below the horizontal line of the qamats is well-positioned, well-sized, but brownish.
The BHL has a patah under tsadi. BHL Appendix A has a qamats under the tsadi.

description: Change merkha to tipeha under tet.
refuni: lamed sheva mem hiriq qof dagesh qamats tet holam merkha final-nun
changeuni: lamed sheva mem hiriq qof dagesh qamats tet holam tipeha final-nun
notes: The BHL has a tipeha under the tet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change tsere under he to segol.
refuni: alef hataf-segol lamed holam he tsere munah yod
changeuni: alef hataf-segol lamed holam he segol munah yod
notes: The BHL has tsere under the he. BHL Appendix A has segol under the he.

description: Change merkha under het to tipeha.
refuni: bet dagesh patah het segol merkha resh segol bet
changeuni: bet dagesh patah het segol tipeha resh segol bet
notes: The next word Jer 44:13.11 changes a tipeha to a merkha. That is, the accents on Jer 44:13.10 and Jer 44:13.11 are interchanged.
The BHL has merkha under the het. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change tipeha under ayin to merkha.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats resh qamats ayin qamats tipeha bet
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats resh qamats ayin qamats merkha bet
notes: The vertical line under the ayin has a very slight northeast-to-southwest inclination.
The previous word Jer 44:13.10 was changed from a merkha to tipeha. That is, the accents on Jer 44:13.10 and Jer 44:13.11 are interchanged.
The BHL has tipeha under the ayin. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move telisha qetana on kaf to yod.
refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq telisha-qetana yod
changeuni: kaf dagesh hiriq yod telisha-qetana
notes: The BHL has a telisha-qetana on the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change patah under mem to qamats.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qamats mem patah yod hiriq final-mem zinor
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qamats mem qamats yod hiriq final-mem zinor
notes: The BHL has patah under the mem. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove maqaf at end of word. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva alef patah het hataf-patah resh tsere yod maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva alef patah het hataf-patah resh tsere yod
notes: No maqaf is visible after the yod in this word. Without a maqaf, this word lacks an accent.
The BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no maqaf at the end of this word.

description: Consider possible dagesh in yod. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva yod hiriq shin shin-dot sheva tet sheva pe vav dagesh pashta
changeuni: vav sheva yod hiriq shin shin-dot sheva tet sheva pe vav dagesh pashta
notes: The yod has a tail-like shape on its trailing edge. It doesn't look as though it was a dot, however.
The BHL has no dagesh on the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change zaqef gadol over first yod to zaqef qatan.
refuni: vav sheva tav hiriq meteg he sheva yod segol zaqef-gadol yod nun qamats he
changeuni: vav sheva tav hiriq meteg he sheva yod segol zaqef-qatan yod nun qamats he
notes: The vertical bar on the trailing edge of the zaqef qatan dots might have been part of an erased zaqef gadol.
The BHL has a zaqef qatan over the first yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from bet.
refuni: bet dagesh patah samekh dagesh segol zaqef-qatan lamed patah ayin
changeuni: bet patah samekh dagesh segol zaqef-qatan lamed patah ayin
notes: The bet has a rafe mark indicating the absence of a dagesh.
The BHL has no dagesh in the bet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Consider possible qadma over shin.
refuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh maqaf
changeuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol resh maqaf
notes: A brownish, southeast-to-northwest line appears above the shin. It is not as close to the shin as the qadma on the alef of the next word nor is it as dark.
The BHL has no qadma over the shin; it had a qadma on the alef of the following, maqaf-connected word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Add pashta over final vav.
refuni: alef hataf-patah resh hiriq yod tsadi segol qadma nun dagesh vav dagesh
changeuni: alef hataf-patah resh hiriq yod tsadi segol qadma nun dagesh vav dagesh pashta
notes: This word is in a dark spot on the page. With care, a trailing pashta can be seen on the vav.
The BHL has an accent-helper pashta over the tsadi and a pashta on the vav. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Add dagesh to nun.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva samekh hiriq resh sheva yod holam nun etnahta vav holam
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva samekh hiriq resh sheva yod holam nun dagesh etnahta vav holam
notes: The dot in the nun is well-placed, well-sized, but brownish.
The BHL has no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the nun.

description: Change revia on pe to zaqef qatan.
refuni: he patah kaf dagesh patah pe dagesh revia vav holam tav
changeuni: he patah kaf dagesh patah pe dagesh zaqef-qatan vav holam tav
notes: The lower dot of the zaqef touches the top of the pe.
The BHL has revia over the pe. BHL Appendix A has a zaqef qatan over the pe.

description: Add dagesh and rafe to dalet. Add note 'c'.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva ayin qamats mem sheva dalet qamats tipeha final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva ayin qamats mem sheva dalet dagesh qamats rafe tipeha final-mem
notes: The dalet has both a dagesh and a rafe; a contradiction.
BHL has no dagesh in the dalet. BHL Appendix A has both a dagesh and a rafe on the dalet.

description: Add hiriq under yod.
refuni: bet dagesh tsere merkha yod tav
changeuni: bet dagesh tsere merkha yod hiriq tav
notes: The dot is well-sized, well-positioned, but brownish.
BHL has no hiriq under the yod. BHL Appendix A has a hiriq under the yod.

description: Remove dagesh from zayin.
refuni: tav hiriq zayin dagesh qamats kaf patah revia resh sheva final-nun qamats
changeuni: tav hiriq zayin qamats kaf patah revia resh sheva final-nun qamats
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the zayin. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the zayin.

description: Add telisha qetana over shin.
refuni: bet dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot vav holam tav hiriq yod telisha-qetana
changeuni: bet dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah shin sin-dot telisha-qetana vav holam tav hiriq yod telisha-qetana
notes: This mark serves as a "stress helper" for the postpositive telisha qetana.
The BHL has a telisha qetana over the shin. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from lamed.
refuni: mem tsere alef tsere meteg lamed dagesh segol he sof-pasuq
changeuni: mem tsere alef tsere meteg lamed segol he sof-pasuq
notes: The blotch in the lamed is too faint to be transcribed as a dagesh.
The BHL has a dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq mem dagesh qamats lamed tsere mahapakh alef
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq mem dagesh qamats lamed tsere mahapakh alef
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the yod. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the yod.

description: Examine the accent under the resh.
refuni: shin sin-dot qamats resh tsere tipeha yod
changeuni: shin sin-dot qamats resh tsere tipeha yod
notes: The line under the resh is very, very slightly inclined southeast-to-northwest.
The BHL has a tipeha under the resh. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from lamed.
refuni: mem hiriq meteg lamed dagesh hiriq bet dagesh sheva he segol etnahta final-nun
changeuni: mem hiriq meteg lamed hiriq bet dagesh sheva he segol etnahta final-nun
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the lamed and a '?' mark.

description: Remove patah from under ayin.
refuni: lamed sheva telisha-gedola mem patah ayin patah final-nun
changeuni: lamed sheva telisha-gedola mem patah ayin final-nun
notes: The BHL has a patah under the ayin. BHL Appendix A has no patah under the ayin.

description: Change first consonant from bet to kaf. Add note 'c'.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva tav patah zayin sheva nun vav dagesh tav patah tipeha yod hiriq final-kaf sheva
changeuni: kaf dagesh sheva tav patah zayin sheva nun vav dagesh tav patah tipeha yod hiriq final-kaf sheva
notes: The text is in poor condition. The scribe doesn't always distinguish the bet and kaf carefully.
The BHL has a bet as the first letter. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.
Breuer has a kaf as the first letter.

description: Add maqaf to end of word.
refuni: ayin patah tipeha lamed
changeuni: ayin patah tipeha lamed maqaf
notes: The BHL has no maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has a maqaf at the end of the word.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh hiriq tav dagesh sheva nun tsere tipeha he vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah meteg yod hiriq tav dagesh sheva nun tsere tipeha he vav dagesh
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from pe.
refuni: pe dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva ayin tsere yod kaf segol final-mem pashta
changeuni: pe hiriq shin shin-dot sheva ayin tsere yod kaf segol final-mem pashta
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the pe. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the pe.

description: Change zaqef qatan on he to revia.
refuni: alef hataf-patah lamed tsere he segol zaqef-qatan final-mem
changeuni: alef hataf-patah lamed tsere he segol revia final-mem
notes: The text is of poor quality. A dot above the revia (making it a zaqef qatan) may have been erased.
The BHL has a revia over the he. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from lamed.
refuni: lamed dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva mem holam munah ayin patah
changeuni: lamed hiriq shin shin-dot sheva mem holam munah ayin patah
notes: The BHL has no dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Add dagesh to qof.
refuni: yod hiriq tav sheva qof patah lamed dagesh sheva samekh vav dagesh maqaf
changeuni: yod hiriq tav sheva qof dagesh patah lamed dagesh sheva samekh vav dagesh maqaf
notes: The maqaf ends with a strange mark. This is the last word on the line and the mark may be intended to fill the line.
The BHL has no dagesh in the qof, it has a dagesh in the lamed, however. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove qadma from above ayin.
refuni: vav sheva ayin patah qadma lamed maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva ayin patah lamed maqaf
notes: The images shows two maqaf-connected words: ועל דמך. This change applies to the first word of these words, ועל. The following word, דמך, has a zaqef qatan on the mem.

Ben Denckla: The Unicode qadma removed here would have functioned as an accent called a "metigah". A metigah exists only as part of a two-accent-on-a-poetic-word combination called a metigah-zaqef. The zaqef in a metigah-zaqef is always a zaqef qatan. This change removes a metigah-zaqef from these two words; the poetic word formed from these two maqaf-connected words continues to have an accent, a zaqef qatan.

The BHL has no qadma on the ayin. It does have a zaqef qatan on the mem of the following word. That is, the BHL does not have a metigah-zaqef on this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Add dagesh to first tav.
refuni: tav vav holam ayin hataf-patah bet vav holam tav tsere yod he segol meteg final-nun sof-pasuq
changeuni: tav dagesh vav holam ayin hataf-patah bet vav holam tav tsere yod he segol meteg final-nun sof-pasuq
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the first tav. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move zaqef qatan above bet to shin.
refuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan shin shin-dot qamats final-nun
changeuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh qamats shin shin-dot qamats zaqef-qatan final-nun
notes: The BHL has a zaqef qatan above the shin, not the bet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change munah below bet to meteg.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats munah ayin patah mem dagesh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats meteg ayin patah mem dagesh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
notes: The current munah is a meteg with an errant dot; it does not have munah proportions.
The BHL has a meteg under the bet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change tsere under lamed to segol.
refuni: lamed tsere alef mem holam meteg resh sof-pasuq
changeuni: lamed segol alef mem holam meteg resh sof-pasuq
notes: The BHL has a tsere under the lamed. BHL Appendix A has a segol under the lamed.

description: Add dagesh to kaf. Add note 't'.
refuni: resh sheva kaf qubuts lamed dagesh qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats revia
changeuni: resh sheva kaf dagesh qubuts lamed dagesh qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats revia
notes: The putative dagesh is well-sized, a little out of position, and brown. Note the rafe above the kaf, however.
The BHL has no dagesh in the kaf. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the kaf.

description: Changes tsere to segol.
refuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh tsere tipeha final-kaf sheva
changeuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh segol tipeha final-kaf sheva
notes: The lower dot of the segol is slightly displaced to the right. The size and color of the lower dot match the upper two dots.
The BHL has a tsere under the second mem. BHL Appendix A has a segol under the second mem and a '?' mark.

description: Change merkha under yod to tipeha.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva yod merkha vav holam final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva yod tipeha vav holam final-mem
notes: The BHL has a tipeha under the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Possible merkha under nun, add note 't'.
refuni: ayin qamats nun qamats tipeha final-nun
changeuni: ayin qamats nun qamats tipeha final-nun
notes: The near-vertical line under the first nun has a slight northeast-to-southeast inclination. This inclination isn't as great as that in the preceding word where the accent is clearly a tipeha. It's probably a meteg or merkha, but must be transcribed as a tipeha.
The BHL has a merkha under the first nun. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from nun.
refuni: he patah meteg nun dagesh hiriq bet dagesh sheva alef hiriq tevir yod final-mem
changeuni: he patah meteg nun hiriq bet dagesh sheva alef hiriq tevir yod final-mem
notes: The BHL has no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Add qadma over the he.
refuni: vav sheva he hiriq tav sheva qof patah dalet dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod
changeuni: vav sheva he hiriq tav sheva qof patah dalet dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod
notes: Ben Denckla: The Unicode qadma added here functions as an accent called a "metigah". A metigah exists only as part of a two-accent-on-a-poetic-word combination called a metigah-zaqef. The zaqef in a metigah-zaqef is always a zaqef qatan.
The BHL has qadma over the he. It also has a zaqef qatan over the second tav; that is, BHL has a metigah-zaqef on this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.
changeuni_gen: vav sheva he hiriq qadma tav sheva qof patah dalet dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod

description: Remove maqaf at end of word.
refuni: resh holam darga het patah bet maqaf
changeuni: resh holam darga het patah bet
notes: The BHL has no maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change patah under vav to qamats.
refuni: vav patah yod sheva bet hiriq alef tsere munah nun hiriq yod
changeuni: vav qamats yod sheva bet hiriq alef tsere munah nun hiriq yod
notes: The BHL has patah under the vav. BHL Appendix A has a qamats under the vav.

description: Add telisha qetana to lamed. Remove note 'c'.
refuni: vav sheva he patah gimel dagesh sheva bet vav dagesh lamed
changeuni: vav sheva he patah gimel dagesh sheva bet vav dagesh lamed telisha-qetana
notes: The telisha qetana is very high on the lamed.
The BHL has telisha qetana on the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from bet.
refuni: he patah mem dagesh hiriq zayin sheva bet dagesh tsere zaqef-qatan het patah
changeuni: he patah mem dagesh hiriq zayin sheva bet dagesh tsere zaqef-qatan het patah
notes: The BHL has dagesh in the bet. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the bet.
changeuni_gen: he patah mem dagesh hiriq zayin sheva bet tsere zaqef-qatan het patah

description: Examine possible yod between shin and final mem.
refuni: kaf dagesh sheva bet qamats shin sin-dot hiriq tevir final-mem
changeuni: kaf dagesh sheva bet qamats shin sin-dot hiriq tevir final-mem
notes: Nothing seen between the shin and the final mem. The leading edge of the mem is thicker than expected, however.
The BHL has no yod between the shin and the final mem. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from first yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah bet hiriq resh tsere merkha nun hiriq yod
changeuni: vav patah yod patah ayin hataf-patah bet hiriq resh tsere merkha nun hiriq yod
notes: The BHL has a dagesh in the first yod. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the first yod.

description: Remove qadma from nun, add pashta to yod. Add note 't'.
refuni: pe dagesh sheva nun tsere qadma yod
changeuni: pe dagesh sheva nun tsere yod pashta
notes: The pashta/qadma accent is clearly on the yod. Pashtas occur more frequently on the final letter of a word than qadmas. Ben Denckla offers a cantillation rule: "When a qadma/pashta appears on a letter that closes a syllable and ends a word ... it should be interpreted as a pashta". Given the uncertainty and need to transcribe the accent, the accent is transcribed here as a pashta with a 't' added.
The BHL has a pashta/qadma over the nun; it's hard to tell the difference even in this modern, printed document. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change qamats under vav to patah.
refuni: vav qamats yod dagesh qamats mahapakh shin sin-dot patah resh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh qamats mahapakh shin sin-dot patah resh
notes: BHL has a patah under the vav. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Note possible meteg on bet. Add note 't'.
refuni: bet qamats alef hataf-qamats he qamats lamed hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
changeuni: bet qamats alef hataf-qamats he qamats lamed hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
notes: At question is the dark vertical line on the leading edge of the bet. It is not expected that a meteg would be written in this position. It is too low to be a paseq.
BHL agrees with the reference UXLC text. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove vav, placing holam on kaf.
refuni: lamed segol meteg alef hataf-segol kaf vav holam lamed pashta
changeuni: lamed segol meteg alef hataf-segol kaf vav holam lamed pashta
notes: BHL has no vav between the kaf and the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.
changeuni_gen: lamed segol meteg alef hataf-segol kaf holam lamed pashta

description: Remove dagesh from samekh.
refuni: samekh dagesh segol tipeha lamed patah ayin
changeuni: samekh segol tipeha lamed patah ayin
notes: The samekh contains a nearly-vertical, dark line on its inner left edge. It is not dot-like and unlikely to be a dagesh.
BHL has no dagesh in the samekh. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this book.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: nun sheva alef qubuts final-mem maqaf
changeuni: nun sheva alef qubuts final-mem
notes: BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this book.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: lamed hiriq bet sheva nun tsere meteg yod maqaf
changeuni: lamed hiriq bet sheva nun tsere meteg yod
notes: BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this book.

description: Move meteg from yod to he.
refuni: he qamats yod meteg vav dagesh sof-pasuq
changeuni: he qamats meteg yod vav dagesh sof-pasuq
notes: BHL has a meteg under the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this book.

description: Change segol under vav to tsere. Add note 't'.
refuni: nun hiriq meteg yod nun sheva vav segol tipeha he
changeuni: nun hiriq meteg yod nun sheva vav tsere tipeha he
notes: The lowest of the three dots of the reference segol is well-positioned, but lighter and smaller than the upper two dots.
BHL has a tsere under the vav. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Add merkha to kaf.
refuni: lamed sheva mem patah lamed sheva kaf tsere tipeha yod
changeuni: lamed sheva mem patah lamed sheva kaf tsere merkha yod
notes: BHL has a tipeha under the kaf. BHL Appendix A has a merkha under the kaf.

description: Remove qadma on the resh, add pashta to yod.
refuni: dalet sheva bet qamats resh patah qadma yod
changeuni: dalet sheva bet qamats resh patah yod pashta
notes: The accent on the yod in the image is clearly postpositive and, therefore, a pashta.
BHL has a pashta/qadma on the yod. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: lamed sheva bet patah merkha tav maqaf
changeuni: lamed sheva bet patah merkha tav
notes: BHL has no maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change tsere under ayin to segol.
refuni: vav dagesh bet qamats ayin tsere tipeha tav
changeuni: vav dagesh bet qamats ayin segol tipeha tav
notes: The lowest dot of the segol is misplaced slightly to the right of center, but has about the same size and color as the upper dots.
BHL has a tsere under the ayin. BHL Appendix A has a segol under the ayin and a '?'.

description: The mark under the initial mem might be a merkha. Add note 't'
refuni: mem sheva shin shin-dot vav holam tet sheva tet hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
changeuni: mem sheva shin shin-dot vav holam tet sheva tet hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
notes: The putative merkha is oddly shaped and thinner than most marks.
BHL has only a sheva under the initial mem. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move qadma over nun to he.
refuni: he patah nun dagesh hiriq qadma shin shin-dot sheva bet dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan ayin
changeuni: he patah qadma nun dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva bet dagesh qamats zaqef-qatan ayin
notes: The qadma being moved is part of a metigah-zaqef accent pair.
BHL has a qadma over the he. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move tipeha under tav to under resh. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah alef hataf-patah mem patah resh sheva tav dagesh segol tipeha final-mem
changeuni: vav patah alef hataf-patah mem patah resh sheva tipeha tav dagesh segol final-mem
notes: Normally, accents are written after a vowel. The tipeha in the image could be considered under either the resh or the tav. Space is available after the segol to write the tipeha had the scribe intended to do so.
BHL has the tipeha under the tav positioned after the segol. BHL Appendix A has the tipeha under the tav but positioned before the segol.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: ayin patah dalet maqaf
changeuni: ayin patah dalet
notes: The image shows 3 words: עד בלי די, words 27, 28, 29 of Mal 3:10. This change is on word 27, עד. In conjunction with the subsequent change to Mal 3:10.28, this change produces three space-separated words, rather than three maqaf-separated words.
BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word; that is, words 27, 28, 29 are separated by maqafs. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva lamed hiriq yod maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva lamed hiriq yod
notes: The image shows 3 words: עד בלי די, words 27, 28, 29 of Mal 3:10. This change is on word 28, בלי. In conjunction with the previous change to Mal 3:10.27, this change produces three space-separated words, rather than three maqaf-separated words.
BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word; that is, words 27, 28, 29 are separated by maqafs. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Replace mahapakh on kaf with yetiv.
refuni: kaf dagesh holam mahapakh lamed
changeuni: kaf dagesh holam yetiv lamed
notes: A yetiv is prepositive, a mahapakh is centered on the consonant.
BHL has a yetiv on the kaf. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Add dagesh to lamed.
refuni: alef hataf-segol lamed qamats he qamats alef pashta
changeuni: alef hataf-segol lamed qamats he qamats alef pashta
notes: BHL has no dagesh in the lamed. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the lamed.
changeuni_gen: alef hataf-segol lamed dagesh qamats he qamats alef pashta

description: Remove maqaf at end of word.
refuni: vav sheva ayin patah munah dalet maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva ayin patah munah dalet
notes: BHL has no maqaf at end of this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this word.

description: Remove dagesh from dalet.
refuni: dalet dagesh hiriq kaf dagesh tsere merkha final-nun
changeuni: dalet hiriq kaf dagesh tsere merkha final-nun
notes: The dalet has a rafe above it confirming that no dagesh is present in the dalet.
BHL has a dagesh in the dalet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove pashta from final mem. Add note 't'.
refuni: yod qamats mem hiriq munah yod final-mem pashta
changeuni: yod qamats mem hiriq munah yod final-mem
notes: This change does not refer to the dark, clearly-defined tipeha above the right edge of the final mem; the tipeha belongs to the word on the previous line, Deut 5:12.7. An ill-defined diagonal stub occurs on the upper, left top of the final mem. It has a possible other remnant to the left of the sheva on the previous line. It could be a remnant of an erased pashta.
UXLC verse Deut 5:13 corresponds to BHL verse Deut 5:12. BHL has a pashta on the final mem. BHL Appendix A has no pashta on the final mem.

description: Change dehi on tet to tipeha (= tarḥa).
refuni: tet dehi vav holam bet
changeuni: tet tipeha vav holam bet
notes: The mark in the LC is not sufficiently prepositive (advanced relative to the consonant) to be transcribed as a dehi.
BHL has a tipeha (=tarḥa) on the tet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move revia back from second vav to nun.
refuni: vav patah geresh-muqdam yod dagesh hiriq zayin sheva nun vav dagesh revia
changeuni: vav patah geresh-muqdam yod dagesh hiriq zayin sheva nun revia vav dagesh
notes: BHL has the revia over the nun. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move mahapakh from dalet to vav. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva nun qamats mahapakh dalet vav holam shin shin-dot
changeuni: vav sheva nun qamats dalet vav holam mahapakh shin shin-dot
notes: The mahapakh most likely belongs to the dalet rather than the vav. The lack of space under the dalet likely caused the shift from the dalet to vav. The mahapakh will be transcribed under the vav to represent the text image. Although the changed text places the mahapakh under the vav, fonts may place the mahapakh slightly to the left of the vav. This is the case with the Taamey D Web font here.
BHL has the mahapakh on the dalet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Note uncertain mark on pe. Add note 't'.
refuni: pe segol tevir lamed hiriq alef yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: pe segol tevir lamed hiriq alef yod sof-pasuq
notes: Accent below the pe should be a meteg serving as a siluq as all verses must end in a siluq.

At issue is the dot to the left of the vertical bar under the pe. The dot is well-sized and well-positioned relative to the vertical bar; the color of the dot is brownish, however. If this dot was written by the scribe, the accent would be a tevir as in the current UXLC text. The LC is in very good condition on this page and has very few scattered dots of this size and color. The UXLC continues to represent the LC image and adds a 't' note.
BHL has a meteg serving as a siluq under the pe. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove iluy from bet.
refuni: bet dagesh holam meteg iluy alef maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh holam meteg alef maqaf
notes: An iluy has two sides and is more rectangular than the image's half circle above the bet. It is almost certainly a broken masorah circle referring to the masoretic note in the left text margin. The note, according to Ben Denckla, says “4× haser in the Neviʾim.” .
BHL has a no iluy on the bet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove meteg from tav.
refuni: tav dagesh hiriq meteg he sheva yod segol merkha he
changeuni: tav dagesh hiriq he sheva yod segol merkha he
notes: The image shows very little evidence of a meteg on the tav.
BHL has no meteg on the tav. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Replace patah under ayin with sheva. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh patah ayin patah tsadi sheva resh tsere pashta he vav dagesh pashta
changeuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh patah ayin sheva tsadi sheva resh tsere pashta he vav dagesh pashta
notes: The text quality is poor. Neither a patah or sheva marking is clear; though a sheva is more evident. The size of this sheva is significantly smaller than that on the following tsadi.
BHL has a sheva under the ayin. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Replace sheva under qof with hataf-patah. Add 'c' note.
refuni: alef segol meteg qof sheva resh qamats munah alef
changeuni: alef segol meteg qof hataf-patah resh qamats munah alef
notes: The patah component of the hataf-patah under the qof is vertically offset from its normal position and slightly brownish. Many texts have only a sheva on the qof; thus a 'c' note will be added.
BHL has a hataf-patah under the qof. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.
Breuer-DM notes that the LC has a hataf-patah under the qof.

description: Add paseq to end of word.
refuni: shin shin-dot sheva mem qadma vav holam
changeuni: shin shin-dot sheva mem qadma vav holam space paseq
notes: BHL has a paseq mark ( ׀ ) at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Add meteg under initial alef.
refuni: alef qamats nun dagesh qamats munah alef
changeuni: alef qamats meteg nun dagesh qamats munah alef
notes: The meteg leads the head of the lamed of the following line and is distinct.
BHL has a meteg following the qamats under the alef. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change mahapakh on kaf to yetiv.
refuni: kaf dagesh holam mahapakh lamed
changeuni: kaf dagesh holam yetiv lamed
notes: The mahapakh/yetiv mark is displaced to the right of the consonant and therefore a yetiv.
BHL has a distinct yetiv under the kaf. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move darga from under gimel to under dalet.
refuni: lamed sheva mem hiriq gimel dagesh qamats darga dalet vav holam lamed
changeuni: lamed sheva mem hiriq gimel dagesh qamats dalet darga vav holam lamed
notes: BHL has the darga under the dalet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Interchange qere/ketiv order (Part 1 of 2).
refuni: alef hataf-patah resh patah munah ayin space alef resh ayin alef
changeuni: alef hataf-patah resh patah munah ayin alef resh ayin alef
notes: The normal order qere/ketiv pairs in the UXLC is ketiv-then-qere. The order of this pair, qere-then ketiv, was incorrectly entered in change 2021.02.22 - 28 of Changes file 2021.04.01 - Changes. This change swaps the order of the two variants by merging them in change 2023.03.06 - 1 (this change) and then splitting them in change 2023.03.06 - 2 (the next change).
The combined actions of these 2 changes have the side effect of adding 2 consonant changes to the consonant changes in the Supplements/Differences result in UXLC 1.7 - UXLC 1.8.xml.

description: Interchange qere/ketiv order (Part 2 of 2).
refuni: alef hataf-patah resh patah munah ayin
changeuni: alef resh ayin alef alef hataf-patah resh patah munah ayin
notes: The normal order qere/ketiv pairs in the UXLC is ketiv-then-qere. The order of this pair, qere-then ketiv, was incorrectly entered in change 2021.02.22 - 28 of Changes file 2021.04.01 - Changes. This change swaps the order of the two variants by merging them in change 2023.03.06 - 1 (the previous change) and then splitting them in change 2023.03.06 - 2 (this change).
The combined actions of these 2 changes have the side effect of adding 2 consonant changes to the consonant changes in the Supplements/Differences result in UXLC 1.7 - UXLC 1.8.xml.

description: Consider replacing meteg on resh with merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: resh hiriq meteg yod qof sof-pasuq
changeuni: resh hiriq meteg yod qof sof-pasuq
notes: The line under the resh has sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be a merkha, a conjunctive. However, the word ends with a sof pasuq making a meteg acting as a siluq far more probable as the intent of the scribe.
BHL has a meteg under the resh. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Consider replacing meteg on het with merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem sheva shin shin-dot hiriq yod het meteg vav holam sof-pasuq
changeuni: mem sheva shin shin-dot hiriq yod het meteg vav holam sof-pasuq
notes: The line under the het has sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be a merkha, a conjunctive. However, the word ends with a sof pasuq making a meteg acting as a siluq far more probable as the intent of the scribe.
BHL has a meteg under the het. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Consider replacing meteg on shin with merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: resh holam alef shin shin-dot hiriq meteg yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: resh holam alef shin shin-dot hiriq meteg yod sof-pasuq
notes: The line under the shin has sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be a merkha, a conjunctive. However, the word ends with a sof pasuq making a meteg acting as a siluq far more probable as the intent of the scribe.
BHL has a meteg under the shin. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Change dehi on qof to tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: qof dehi vav holam lamed hiriq yod
changeuni: qof tipeha vav holam lamed hiriq yod
notes: The curved mark under the qof is not very prepositive as required for a dehi.
BHL has a clearly prepositive dehi under the qof. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Consider replacing meteg under the lamed with merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: ayin qamats lamed qamats meteg yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: ayin qamats lamed qamats meteg yod sof-pasuq
notes: The line under the lamed has sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be a merkha, a conjunctive. However, the word ends with a sof pasuq making a meteg acting as a siluq far more probable as the intent of the scribe.
BHL has a meteg under the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move meteg from below the mem to below the tsadi. Remove CGJ. Add note 't'
refuni: ayin hataf-patah tsadi qamats mem meteg combining-grapheme-joiner qamats yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: ayin hataf-patah tsadi qamats meteg mem qamats yod sof-pasuq
notes: The meteg is centered between the tsadi and the mem.
BHL has the meteg under the mem. BHL Appendix A has the meteg under the tsadi. The meteg follows the qamats.
The CGJ is no longer needed for positioning the meteg and has been removed.

description: Consider replacing meteg under the qof with merkha. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav dagesh mem hiriq tav sheva nun patah qof dagesh tsere meteg final-mem sof-pasuq
changeuni: vav dagesh mem hiriq tav sheva nun patah qof dagesh tsere meteg final-mem sof-pasuq
notes: The line under the qof has sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be a merkha, a conjunctive. However, the word ends with a sof pasuq making a meteg acting as a siluq far more probable as the intent of the scribe.
BHL has a meteg under the qof. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Replace merkha below the het with a meteg. Add transcription note 'm'.
refuni: alef qamats resh sheva het merkha vav holam tav
changeuni: alef qamats resh sheva het meteg vav holam tav
notes: The line under the het lacks the northeast-to-southwest inclination required for transcription as a merkha. The accent was probably intended to be a merkha. The spacing between this word and the next is very close.
BHL has a merkha under the het. The BHL has a meteg under the mem of the next word. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move the meteg from under the resh to under the shin. Add note 't'.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva mem tsere yod shin shin-dot qamats resh meteg combining-grapheme-joiner hiriq yod final-mem sof-pasuq
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva mem tsere yod shin shin-dot qamats meteg resh hiriq yod final-mem sof-pasuq
notes: The meteg is centered between the shin and the resh.
BHL has the meteg under the resh. BHL Appendix A has the meteg under the shin. The meteg follows the qamats.

description: Add dagesh to mem.
refuni: bet dagesh patah geresh-muqdam ayin hataf-patah tsadi vav dagesh mem qamats revia yod vav
changeuni: bet dagesh patah geresh-muqdam ayin hataf-patah tsadi vav dagesh mem dagesh qamats revia yod vav
notes: The dagesh is small and faint.
BHL has no dagesh in the mem. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the mem.

description: Remove dagesh in nun; remove sof pasuq. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh segol meteg nun dagesh hiriq yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh segol meteg nun hiriq yod
notes: The nun has no dagesh. This verse ends without a sof pasuq.
BHL has a dagesh in the nun and a sof pasuq at the end of the word. BHL Appendix A has no comment on this verse.

description: Remove sheva under the yod.
refuni: yod sheva dehi he holam vav qamats he
changeuni: yod dehi he holam vav qamats he
notes: The sheva may have been erased.
BHL has a sheva on the yod. The sheva follows the dehi. BHL Appendix A has no sheva under the yod.

description: Move meteg from third bet to second bet.
refuni: bet dagesh hiriq lamed sheva bet qamats bet meteg vav holam sof-pasuq
changeuni: bet dagesh hiriq lamed sheva bet qamats meteg bet vav holam sof-pasuq
notes: BHL has the meteg under the third bet. BHL Appendix A has the meteg under the second bet.

description: Remove sheva under the bet; move merkha under the ayin to under the bet.
refuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot sheva bet dagesh sheva ayin merkha vav dagesh
changeuni: yod hiriq shin sin-dot sheva bet dagesh merkha ayin vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line under the bet has a very slight northeast-to-southwest inclination and will be transcribed as a merkha.
BHL has a sheva under the bet and a merkha under the ayin. BHL Appendix A has only a merkha under the bet; no sheva under the bet. BHL Appendix A has no marking under the ayin.

description: Move meteg from he to third lamed.
refuni: lamed sheva ayin vav holam lamed sheva lamed tsere yod he meteg combining-grapheme-joiner segol final-mem sof-pasuq
changeuni: lamed sheva ayin vav holam lamed sheva lamed tsere meteg yod he segol final-mem sof-pasuq
notes: The Meteg is under the third Lamed.
BHL has a meteg under the he; the meteg follows a segol. BHL Appendix A has the meteg under the third lamed; the meteg follows the tsere.

description: Insert rafe above bet.
refuni: bet sheva geresh-muqdam he qamats qof hiriq revia yod final-tsadi
changeuni: bet sheva geresh-muqdam he qamats qof hiriq revia yod final-tsadi
notes: The UXLC sometimes shows "important" rafes; usually it omits rafes. This rafe doesn't appear to be important.
BHL doesn't show rafe marks. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this verse.

description: Change accent under ayin to meteg. Add note 'm'
refuni: samekh patah meteg lamed sheva ayin hiriq merkha yod
changeuni: samekh patah meteg lamed sheva ayin hiriq meteg yod
notes: The accents on the samekh and ayin are nearly identical and lack the northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha. Many texts have a merkha as the accent on the ayin.
BHL has a meteg under the samekh and merkha under the ayin. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this verse.

description: Change dehi under the tsadi to tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: tsadi dehi vav dagesh resh hiriq yod
changeuni: tsadi tipeha vav dagesh resh hiriq yod
notes: The mark under the tsadi is not prepositive; thus it will be transcribed as a tipeha.
BHL has a dehi under the tsadi. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this verse.

description: Consider the vowel under the qof.
refuni: alef segol meteg qof hataf-patah resh qamats munah alef
changeuni: alef segol meteg qof hataf-patah resh qamats munah alef
notes: The UXLC has a hataf-patah under the qof. This was set in Changes file 2023.04.01 - Changes, 2023.02.4-1, by Moshe Greenberg. Thus the transcription note 'c'.
BHL has a hataf-patah under the qof. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from kaf.
refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq zarqa yod
changeuni: kaf hiriq zarqa yod
notes: A faint dot occurs within the kaf. It is probably a blemish.
BHL has a dagesh in the kaf. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the kaf.

description: Add maqaf at end of word.
refuni: yod hiriq meteg he sheva yod merkha vav dagesh
changeuni: yod hiriq meteg he sheva yod merkha vav dagesh maqaf
notes: Vav and yod tops in this region of text slope downward; here the vav has a horizontal component.
BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no entry for this verse.
The exclamation mark ('!') splits the word at a previous 't' transcription note; it does not appear in the new word.

description: Move the holam on the qof to the vav; move segol under the vav to under the yod. Add note 't'.
refuni: qof holam dehi vav segol yod final-kaf qamats
changeuni: qof dehi vav holam yod segol final-kaf qamats
notes: The consonant to which the segol is attached is unclear; the segol is mostly under the yod. The position of the holam is also ambiguous; the holam could belong to the vav.
BHL has a holam on the qof and segol under the vav. BHL Appendix A has a holam on the vav and a segol under the yod. BHL Appendix A also has a '?' in parentheses.

description: Remove sheva from under vav.
refuni: shin shin-dot qamats etnahta vav sheva alef
changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats etnahta vav alef
notes: The mark under the vav is poorly positioned for a sheva and likely an erasure or a smudge. Adjacent marks are clear and dark.
BHL has a sheva under the vav. BHL Appendix A has no sheva under the vav and a question mark.

description: Add dagesh in the first mem.
refuni: mem hiriq ole mem dagesh segol merkha nun dagesh hiriq yod
changeuni: mem dagesh hiriq ole mem dagesh segol merkha nun dagesh hiriq yod
notes: The reddish dot in the first mem is well-sized and well-positioned. This region of text is clean and doesn't show as many dots of this size and color.
BHL has no dagesh in the first mem. BHL Appendix A has no note on this verse.

description: Remove meteg from under dalet. Add note 'c'.
refuni: alef hataf-patah he vav holam dalet segol meteg nun dagesh vav dagesh sof-pasuq
changeuni: alef hataf-patah he vav holam dalet segol nun dagesh vav dagesh sof-pasuq
notes: This final word has no meteg acting as a siluq.
BHL has a meteg under the dalet. BHL Appendix A has no meteg under the dalet or any other consonant.

description: Consider the tipeha under the kaf.
refuni: het hataf-patah nun qubuts kaf dagesh patah tipeha tav
changeuni: het hataf-patah nun qubuts kaf dagesh patah tipeha tav
notes: The UXLC text has a tipeha acting as a tarha under the kaf.
BHL has a tipeha under the kaf. BHL Appendix A has no comment on this verse.

description: Add dagesh to mem.
refuni: mem hiriq final-nun maqaf
changeuni: mem dagesh hiriq final-nun maqaf
notes: The brownish dot in the mem is well-positioned and well-sized. This region of the text is free of such dots.
BHL has no dagesh in the mem. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh and a question mark for the mem.

description: Remove maqaf at end of word.
refuni: alef segol ole lamed maqaf
changeuni: alef segol ole lamed
notes: BHL has no maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no comment on this verse.

description: Remove meteg under zayin.
refuni: mem qamats meteg ayin vav dagesh zayin dagesh hiriq meteg yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: mem qamats meteg ayin vav dagesh zayin dagesh hiriq yod sof-pasuq
notes: BHL has a meteg under both the mem and the zayin. BHL Appendix A has a meteg under the mem and no meteg under the zayin.

description: Remove sheva from under vav.
refuni: shin shin-dot qamats etnahta vav sheva alef
changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats etnahta vav alef
notes: BHL has a sheva under the vav. BHL Appendix A has no sheva under the vav.

description: Remove meteg under the bet. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav qamats bet meteg vav dagesh zayin sof-pasuq
changeuni: vav qamats bet vav dagesh zayin sof-pasuq
notes: The ascender of the lamed on the following line may be obscuring a meteg under the bet. As the last word in a verse this word should have a meteg acting as a siluq. As such, a meteg should probably be under the bet.
BHL has a meteg under the bet. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move the munah from the lamed to the bet.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats lamed munah vav dagesh
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats munah lamed vav dagesh
notes: Because of the ascender of the lamed on the following line, no space was available to write the munah under the lamed. It was probably intended to be under the lamed.
BHL has a munah under the lamed. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Move ole from tav to tsadi. Add note 't'.
refuni: tav dagesh hiriq ole tsadi dagesh sheva resh tsere merkha nun hiriq yod
changeuni: tav dagesh hiriq tsadi dagesh sheva ole resh tsere merkha nun hiriq yod
notes: The ole is very faded, but definitely over the tsadi.
BHL has the ole over the tsadi, not the tav. BHL Appendix A makes no comment on this verse.

description: Remove meteg from under the lamed. Add transcription note 'c'.
refuni: lamed meteg vav holam sof-pasuq
changeuni: lamed vav holam sof-pasuq
notes: The last word in the verse should have a meteg acting as a siluq.
BHL has a meteg under the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no meteg under the lamed.

description: Possible sheva under the dalet. Add note 't'.
refuni: he patah meteg mem dagesh patah gimel sheva dalet dagesh hiriq yod lamed hiriq merkha yod final-mem
changeuni: he patah meteg mem dagesh patah gimel sheva dalet dagesh hiriq yod lamed hiriq merkha yod final-mem
notes: The putative sheva under the dalet has a significantly smaller and fainter lower dot. Note the extraneous, but fainter, dot above the yod.
BHL has a hiriq under the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no comment on this verse.

description: Change sheva under vav to hiriq.
refuni: yod hiriq dehi resh sheva vav sheva yod qubuts final-nun
changeuni: yod hiriq dehi resh sheva vav hiriq yod qubuts final-nun
notes: The lower dot of the sheva under the vav in the UXLC is too faint to be transcribed as a sheva.

BHL has shevas under the resh and the vav; it has no rafe over the yod. BHL Appendix A has a hiriq under the vav; it has a rafe over the yod. BHL Appendix A agrees with the change of the sheva to hiriq under the vav and the UXLC doesn't normally display rafes.

description: Consider vowel under the resh. Add note 'c' for lack of meteg acting as siluq.
refuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot qubuts resh qamats yod vav sof-pasuq
changeuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot qubuts resh qamats yod vav sof-pasuq
notes: The vowel under the resh is likely to be a qamats with a gap in its horizontal component. The word is the last in the verse and lacks a meteg acting as a siluq.
BHL has qamats then meteg under the resh. BHL Appendix A has a qamats but no meteg under the resh.

description: Move ole from pe to lamed.
refuni: vav patah meteg yod sheva pe patah ole lamed dagesh sheva tet tsere merkha final-mem
changeuni: vav patah meteg yod sheva pe patah lamed dagesh sheva ole tet tsere merkha final-mem
notes: A faint dot appears under the patah on the vav. It is not likely to be part of the text.
BHL has the ole over the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no note on this verse.

description: Move the meteg from under the het to under the kaf.
refuni: tav dagesh vav holam kaf qamats het meteg vav holam tav sof-pasuq
changeuni: tav dagesh vav holam kaf qamats meteg het vav holam tav sof-pasuq
notes: BHL has the meteg under the het. BHL Appendix A has the meteg following the qamats under the kaf.

description: Change meteg under the mem to tipeha.
refuni: mem tsere meteg het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav hiriq meteg yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: mem tsere tipeha het patah tet dagesh qamats alef tav hiriq meteg yod sof-pasuq
notes: BHL has a tipeha (acting as a tarha) following the tsere under the mem. BHL Appendix A has no note on this verse.

description: Move etnahta from under the yod to under the mem.
refuni: yod segol he hataf-segol mem qamats yod etnahta vav dagesh final-nun
changeuni: yod segol he hataf-segol mem qamats etnahta yod vav dagesh final-nun
notes: BHL has the etnahta under the yod. BHL Appendix A has the etnahta under the mem.

description: Remove dagesh from qof.
refuni: qof dagesh hiriq vav dagesh hiriq munah yod tav hiriq yod
changeuni: qof hiriq vav dagesh hiriq munah yod tav hiriq yod
notes: The qof has a poorly-positioned, very faint dot in the qof. The four other dots in the image are dark, well-positioned and properly-sized.
BHL has no dagesh in the qof. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Move the ole from over the tav to over the het.
refuni: tav dagesh segol ole het hataf-segol resh patah merkha shin shin-dot
changeuni: tav dagesh segol het hataf-segol ole resh patah merkha shin shin-dot
notes: BHL has the ole over the het. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change dehi on vav to tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: vav dagesh dehi bet patah lamed dagesh patah yod sheva lamed qamats he
changeuni: vav dagesh tipeha bet patah lamed dagesh patah yod sheva lamed qamats he
notes: The dehi/tipeha mark is not prepositive and is transcribed as a tipeha.
BHL has a dehi on the vav. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change yerah-ben-yomo under the lamed to mahapakh.
refuni: lamed holam yerah-ben-yomo alef
changeuni: lamed holam mahapakh alef
notes: BHL has a mahapakh under the lamed. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from he.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva dehi qof hiriq resh sheva bet dagesh qamats he dagesh
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva dehi qof hiriq resh sheva bet dagesh qamats he
notes: The initial dehi in the LC has outstanding prepositivity!
BHL has a dagesh in the he. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the he.

description: Move ole over kaf to bet.
refuni: yod sheva meteg kaf patah ole bet dagesh sheva dalet qamats merkha nun sheva nun hiriq yod
changeuni: yod sheva meteg kaf patah bet dagesh sheva ole dalet qamats merkha nun sheva nun hiriq yod
notes: BHL has an ole over the bet. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change tipeha under second vav to merkha.
refuni: vav patah alef hataf-patah qof patah vav dagesh segol tipeha he
changeuni: vav patah alef hataf-patah qof patah vav dagesh segol merkha he
notes: The mark under the second vav has a slight twist to the left at the lower end making it a merkha. It certainly does not have the southeast-to-northwest inclination to be a tipeha.
The ill-formed reddish dot under the patah under the qof is probably a blemish.
BHL has a merkha under the second vav. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change meteg under pe to merkha; remove maqaf at end of word.
refuni: pe dagesh qamats meteg het hataf-patah dalet vav dagesh maqaf
changeuni: pe dagesh qamats merkha het hataf-patah dalet vav dagesh
notes: The near-vertical line under the pe has a slight twist to the left at the lower end making it a merkha.
The geresh-like, northeast-to-southwest diagonal line after the vav is likely a spacer to maintain line justification.
BHL has a merkha under the pe and no maqaf at the end of the word. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Move ole over second he to yod. Add note 't'.
refuni: he qamats atnah-hafukh yod qamats he ole
changeuni: he qamats atnah-hafukh yod qamats ole he
notes: The ole appears between the yod and the second he. Because space is available to place the ole centered on the second he, the ole will be moved to the yod.
BHL has an ole over the yod. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Replace dehi under vav with tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: vav dagesh dehi mem hiriq resh sheva mem qamats he
changeuni: vav dagesh tipeha mem hiriq resh sheva mem qamats he
notes: The dehi/tipeha mark is not prepositive, even though space is available to write it prepositively.
BHL has a dehi under the vav. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change meteg under resh to merkha.
refuni: ayin dehi vav dagesh resh qamats meteg he
changeuni: ayin dehi vav dagesh resh qamats merkha he
notes: The accent under the resh is a very well inclined merkha. Its smudged background suggests that a meteg had been erased and written over.
BHL has a meteg under the resh. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Add meteg under first mem after the hiriq.
refuni: mem dagesh hiriq mem hiriq tav sheva qof vav holam mem sheva mem patah merkha yod
changeuni: mem dagesh hiriq meteg mem hiriq tav sheva qof vav holam mem sheva mem patah merkha yod
notes: BHL has a meteg under the first mem. In BHL the first mem doesn't have a dagesh; the second mem has a dagesh. BHL Appendix A has a meteg under the first mem. In BHL Appendix A the first mem has a dagesh; the second mem doesn't have a dagesh. That is, BHL and BHL Appendix A agree that the first mem has a meteg; they place the dagesh differently in the two mems.

description: Replace dehi under the ayin with a tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: ayin dehi vav holam lamed qamats final-mem
changeuni: ayin tipeha vav holam lamed qamats final-mem
notes: The dehi/tipeha mark is not sufficiently prepositive to be transcribed as a dehi. Space is available for the writer to have written the mark prepositively.
BHL has a dehi under the ayin. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change meteg under he to merkha.
refuni: tav dagesh sheva he meteg vav holam tav sheva tav munah vav dagesh
changeuni: tav dagesh sheva he merkha vav holam tav sheva tav munah vav dagesh
notes: BHL has a merkha under the he. BHL Appendix A has no note for this word; it has a note for word 11.

description: Move meteg from yod to vav.
refuni: he patah dalet dagesh sheva het vav dagesh yod meteg combining-grapheme-joiner qamats he sof-pasuq
changeuni: he patah dalet dagesh sheva het vav dagesh meteg yod qamats he sof-pasuq
notes: BHL has the meteg following the qamats under the yod. BHL Appendix A has the meteg under the vav; the qamats remains on the yod.

description: Add merkha after qamats on yod.
refuni: yod qamats ayin hataf-patah tsadi munah vav dagesh
changeuni: yod qamats merkha ayin hataf-patah tsadi munah vav dagesh
notes: BHL has a merkha following the qamats under the yod. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Move meteg from the second tav to under the lamed; the meteg follows the qamats on the lamed.
refuni: tav dagesh sheva he hiriq lamed dagesh qamats tav meteg vav holam sof-pasuq
changeuni: tav dagesh sheva he hiriq lamed dagesh qamats meteg tav vav holam sof-pasuq
notes: BHL has the meteg under the second tav. BHL Appendix A has the meteg following the qamats under the lamed.

description: Remove dagesh from samekh.
refuni: he patah samekh dagesh vav holam resh sheva resh hiriq shalshelet yod final-mem space paseq
changeuni: he patah samekh vav holam resh sheva resh hiriq shalshelet yod final-mem space paseq
notes: The slightest trace of a samekh appears at mid height inside the trailing edge of the samekh. The text in this area has additional seemingly-misplaced dots after the patah under the he and inside the resh.
BHL has a dagesh in the samekh. BHL Appendix A has no dagesh in the samekh.

description: Add maqaf between alef and resh. Add note 'c'.
refuni: yod qamats mahapakh alef tsere merkha resh
changeuni: yod qamats mahapakh alef tsere merkha maqaf resh
notes: The word has a masora circle on it. The masora notes may explain this odd marking.
BHL has no maqaf after or in this word. BHL Appendix A has a maqaf between the alef and the resh.

description: Replace dehi under the mem with tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: mem dehi vav dagesh zayin qamats resh
changeuni: mem tipeha vav dagesh zayin qamats resh
notes: The dehi/tipeha under the mem is not very prepositive and will be transcribed as a tipeha.
BHL has a dehi under the mem. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Examine splotch under the kaf after the segol. Add note 't'.
refuni: lamed sheva bet patah bet sheva kaf segol meteg final-mem sof-pasuq
changeuni: lamed sheva bet patah bet sheva kaf segol meteg final-mem sof-pasuq
notes: The text is damaged in this region. The splotch after the segol under the kaf is probably a meteg.
BHL has a meteg under the kaf; the meteg is after the segol. BHL Appendix A has no meteg under the kaf.

description: Add qubuts under shin.
refuni: vav sheva geresh-muqdam tav hiriq pe sheva shin sin-dot revia vav dagesh he vav dagesh
changeuni: vav sheva geresh-muqdam tav hiriq pe sheva shin sin-dot qubuts revia vav dagesh he vav dagesh
notes: The shin has a qubuts and the shin is followed by a vav with a dagesh (shuruq).
BHL has no qubuts under the shin. BHL Appendix A has a qubuts under the shin.

description: Move hiriq then etnachta from vav to he. Add note 'c'.
refuni: yod sheva he vav hiriq etnahta he
changeuni: yod sheva he hiriq etnahta vav he
notes: The Etnahta and Hiriq appear to be under the first he.
BHL has a hiriq and then etnachta under the vav. BHL Appendix A has a hiriq and then etnachta under the he. The BHL Appendix A note has a question mark in parentheses.

description: Change dehi under vav to tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: vav dagesh dehi mem tsere het qamats mem qamats samekh
changeuni: vav dagesh tipeha mem tsere het qamats mem qamats samekh
notes: The dehi/tipeha mark is not prepositive and will be transcribed as a tipeha. Space is available to make this mark prepositive.
BHL has a dehi under the vav. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change dehi under alef to tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: alef dehi vav holam yod tsere bet
changeuni: alef tipeha vav holam yod tsere bet
notes: The dehi/tipeha mark under the alef is not prepositive. On the other hand, very little space was available to write it prepositively due to the previous word's tav and the following line's lamed ascender.
BHL has a dehi under the alef. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Add dagesh to nun.
refuni: he zarqa vav holam dalet hiriq mahapakh yod nun vav dagesh
changeuni: he zarqa vav holam dalet hiriq mahapakh yod nun dagesh vav dagesh
notes: Note: This is the first word in the verse, not the fourth word.
BHL has no dagesh in the nun. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the nun.

description: Add merkha after hiriq-then-meteg under dalet. Add note 'c'.
refuni: tsadi patah dalet dagesh hiriq meteg yod qof sof-pasuq
changeuni: tsadi patah dalet dagesh hiriq meteg merkha yod qof sof-pasuq
notes: The meteg is imperfect, but expected. The merkha is well-positioned, well-sized, and well-shaped; it is clearer than the meteg. This is an unexpected marking.
BHL has a hiriq followed by a meteg under the dalet. BHL Appendix A has a hiriq-then-meteg-then merkha under the dalet.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: lamed sheva alef hiriq mem sheva resh tsere yod maqaf
changeuni: lamed sheva alef hiriq mem sheva resh tsere yod
notes: BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no maqaf at the end of this word.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: mem patah meteg ayin patah lamed sheva lamed tsere yod maqaf
changeuni: mem patah meteg ayin patah lamed sheva lamed tsere yod
notes: No maqaf is present between the yod at the end of this word and the alef at the start of the next word. A smudge between these consonants suggests a possible erasure.
BHL has no maqaf at the end of this word. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Remove meteg from under the nun. Add note 'c'.
refuni: nun tsere meteg dalet sof-pasuq
changeuni: nun tsere dalet sof-pasuq
notes: A meteg (acting as a siluq) should occur at the end of each verse.
BHL has a meteg under the nun. BHL Appendix A has no meteg under the nun.

description: Change dehi to tipeha under the ayin. Add note 'd'.
refuni: ayin dehi vav holam dalet
changeuni: ayin tipeha vav holam dalet
notes: The dehi/tipeha accent under the ayin is not sufficiently prepositive to be transcribed as a dehi.
BHL has dehi under the ayin. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change dehi to merkha under zayin.
refuni: zayin holam dehi alef tav
changeuni: zayin holam merkha alef tav
notes: This merkha is very slightly inclined northeast-to-southwest; however, it will be transcribed as a merkha rather than a meteg.
BHL has a merkha under the zayin. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Move the ole from over the he to over the bet.
refuni: he hataf-segol ole bet hiriq yod alef merkha vav holam
changeuni: he hataf-segol bet hiriq ole yod alef merkha vav holam
notes: BHL has the ole over the bet. BHL Appendix A has no note on this verse.

description: Add dehi to tav. Add note 't'.
refuni: tav dagesh hiriq bet sheva ayin patah merkha resh
changeuni: tav dagesh hiriq dehi bet sheva ayin patah merkha resh
notes: Under the tav a dehi appears followed by a disturbed area. The putative dehi is heavier and longer than expected; its width varies along its length. The disturbed area might contain a hiriq, a sheva, or a broken meteg. The upper diffuse dot following the dehi is probably the right, lower part of the tav; the lower diffuse dot following the dehi is probably a hiriq.

BHL has a meteg after a hiriq under the tav. BHL Appendix A gives two alternatives for the marks under the tav; both alternatives have a '?' in parentheses. One marking has a dehi followed by a hiriq; the other has a meteg before a hiriq.

description: Move meteg under nun to under the dalet. Remove CGJ. Add note 'c'.
refuni: alef hataf-patah dalet holam nun meteg combining-grapheme-joiner qamats yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: alef hataf-patah dalet holam meteg nun qamats yod sof-pasuq
notes: This is an unexpected marking of a common word.
BHL has a qamats followed by a meteg under the nun. BHL Appendix A has a meteg under the dalet and a qamats under the nun.

description: Add dagesh to mem.
refuni: vav patah alef hataf-patah mem patah lamed sheva alef tsere meteg he vav dagesh sof-pasuq
changeuni: vav patah alef hataf-patah mem dagesh patah lamed sheva alef tsere meteg he vav dagesh sof-pasuq
notes: The putative dagesh is brownish but well-positioned and well-sized. Compare with the lower dot on the hataf-patah on the alef.
BHL has no dagesh in the mem. BHL Appendix A has a dagesh in the mem.

description: Add note 't' for unknown markings over yod.
refuni: yod sheva he ole vav qamats merkha he
changeuni: yod sheva he ole vav qamats merkha he
notes: The markings over yod do not appear to be from the previous line of text and are not understood.
BHL has a sheva on the yod, an ole over the first he, and a qamats then merkha under the vav. BHL Appendix A has no note on this verse.

description: Change dehi under qof to tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: qof holam dehi resh patah het
changeuni: qof holam tipeha resh patah het
notes: The dehi/tipeha mark under the qof is not sufficiently prepositive to be transcribed as a dehi. Space is available to position the mark prepositively.
BHL has dehi under the qof. BHL Appendix A has no note on this verse.

description: Add geresh muqdam over vav.
refuni: vav sheva het patah yod dagesh patah revia yod
changeuni: vav sheva geresh-muqdam het patah yod dagesh patah revia yod
notes: BHL has a geresh muqdam over the vav. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Consider possible revia above the qof. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva geresh-muqdam tsadi hiriq dalet sheva qof qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats revia
changeuni: vav sheva geresh-muqdam tsadi hiriq dalet sheva qof qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats revia
notes: The putative revia is brownish and oversized. A similarly-colored, similarly-sized dot occurs in the right margin between lines 22 and 23. It is probably a defect in the paper.
BHL has no revia above the qof. BHL Appendix A has a revia above the qof.

description: Replace meteg under mem with merkha.
refuni: vav segol geresh-muqdam alef hataf-segol mem meteg vav dagesh nun qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats revia
changeuni: vav segol geresh-muqdam alef hataf-segol mem merkha vav dagesh nun qamats tav sheva final-kaf qamats revia
notes: The mark under the mem has sufficient northeast-to-southwest inclination to be transcribed as a merkha.
BHL has a merkha under the mem. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change dehi under the mem to tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: mem dehi vav holam shin shin-dot tsere lamed
changeuni: mem tipeha vav holam shin shin-dot tsere lamed
notes: The dehi/tipeha mark under the mem is not sufficiently prepositive to be transcribed as a dehi. Space is available to position the mark prepositively.
BHL has a dehi under the mem. BHL Appendix A has no note on this verse.

description: Move pazer from het to zayin.
refuni: bet sheva het qamats pazer zayin vav holam final-nun
changeuni: bet sheva het qamats zayin pazer vav holam final-nun
notes: BHL has a pazer over the zayin. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Move meteg from under the nun to under the kaf. The meteg follows the tsere. Remove CGJ.
refuni: lamed hiriq shin shin-dot sheva kaf tsere nun meteg combining-grapheme-joiner qamats yod vav sof-pasuq
changeuni: lamed hiriq shin shin-dot sheva kaf tsere meteg nun qamats yod vav sof-pasuq
notes: BHL has a qamats followed by meteg under the nun. BHL Appendix A has a tsere followed by meteg under the kaf and a qamats under the nun.

description: Change dehi under alef to tipeha.
refuni: alef dehi vav holam resh
changeuni: alef tipeha vav holam resh
notes: The dehi/tipeha mark under the mem is not sufficiently prepositive to be transcribed as a dehi. Space is available to position the mark prepositively.
BHL has a tipeha (acting as a tarha) under the alef. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Consider the accent under the lamed as a possible merkha.
refuni: lamed hiriq meteg pe sheva meteg nun tsere yod maqaf
changeuni: lamed hiriq meteg pe sheva meteg nun tsere yod maqaf
notes: The accents under the lamed and pe are nearly parallel and both have a very small inclination from the vertical. Of the two accents, the accent under the pe possibly has greater northeast-to-southwest inclination. Neither will be transcribed as a merkha.
BHL has a hiriq then meteg under the lamed and sheva then meteg under the pe. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Change dehi under first vav to tipeha. Add note 'd'.
refuni: vav dagesh dehi shin shin-dot sheva mem vav dagesh alef tsere lamed
changeuni: vav dagesh tipeha shin shin-dot sheva mem vav dagesh alef tsere lamed
notes: The dehi/tipeha mark under the vav is not sufficiently prepositive to be transcribed as a dehi. Space is available to position the mark prepositively. This is a difficult transcription because the vav is so narrow.
BHL has a dehi under the vav. BHL Appendix A has no note for this verse.

description: Move meteg from tav to nun. The meteg follows the qamats.
refuni: alef hataf-segol mem vav dagesh nun qamats tav meteg vav holam sof-pasuq
changeuni: alef hataf-segol mem vav dagesh nun qamats meteg tav vav holam sof-pasuq
notes: The nun and tav are intertwined; however, space is available to position the meteg more distinctly under the tav.
BHL has a meteg under the tav. BHL Appendix A has the meteg following the qamats under the nun.
