changeuni: mem hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh segol zaqef-qatan lamed segol gimel
notes: The upper two dots on the vowel are unusually close as compared to those under the lamed and might be taken as a qamats. The segol will be retained and a note 't' added.
BHL has a segol under the shin. BHLA has a qamats under the shin with a '?' in parentheses.

description: Change segol under shin to sheva. Examine possible dagesh in he.
refuni: shin shin-dot segol he merkha vav dagesh alef
changeuni: shin shin-dot sheva he merkha vav dagesh alef
notes: The sheva is clear; the putative dagesh in the he is very light and indistinct compared to other dots in this word.
BHL has a sheva under the shin; it has no dagesh in the he. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Consider merkha under zayin as possible tevir. Add note 't'.
refuni: zayin segol merkha he
changeuni: zayin segol merkha he
notes: The vertical bar of the accent under the zayin has a well-centered defect that appears to be a remnant of a missing dot. Restoring the dot would make the accent a tevir.
BHL has a merkha under the zayin. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: shin shin-dot segol yod dagesh hiriq pe dagesh zaqef-qatan vav holam lamed
changeuni: shin shin-dot segol yod hiriq pe dagesh zaqef-qatan vav holam lamed
notes: No dagesh appears in the yod.
BHL has no dagesh in the yod. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Consider the near-vertical mark below the ayin. Add note 't'.
refuni: ayin patah meteg lamed maqaf
changeuni: ayin patah meteg lamed maqaf
notes: The near-vertical mark is likely to have been intended as a meteg rather than a merkha because the poetic word, עַֽל־כֵּ֛ן , already has a tevir on it. The near-vertical mark is positioned below the patah. The meteg will be positioned after the patah and a note 't' added.

BHL has a meteg after a patah on the ayin; however, the BHL always positions metegs after the vowel as an editorial practice, so the BHL is not determinative of position in this case. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: yod dagesh vav holam tav tsere merkha resh
changeuni: yod vav holam tav tsere merkha resh
notes: The ink is very chipped on this word. No dagesh is apparent in the yod.
BHL has a dagesh in the yod. BHLA has no dagesh in the yod and has a '?' in parentheses.

description: Remove dagesh from first yod.
refuni: he patah het patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg yod final-mem sof-pasuq
changeuni: he patah het patah yod hiriq meteg yod final-mem sof-pasuq
notes: A small bump appears on the leading edge of the second yod that might be taken as a dagesh. It's not enough to transcribe a dagesh on the first yod.
BHL has a dagesh in the first yod. BHLA has no entry for this word in this verse.

description: Change merkha under shin to tevir.
refuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol merkha resh
changeuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol tevir resh
notes: A clear and well-formed tevir follows the segol under the shin.
BHL has a tevir under the shin. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add dagesh to resh.
refuni: resh patah bet dagesh hiriq meteg yod final-mem sof-pasuq
changeuni: resh dagesh patah bet dagesh hiriq meteg yod final-mem sof-pasuq
notes: A well-positioned, reasonably-sized, dark dagesh appears in the resh. A resh does not ordinarily take a dagesh, however.
BHL has no dagesh in the resh. BHLA has a dagesh in the resh and a '?' in parentheses.

description: Remove dagesh from shin.
refuni: shin shin-dot dagesh segol yod dagesh hiriq meteg he sheva yod segol etnachta he
changeuni: shin shin-dot segol yod dagesh hiriq meteg he sheva yod segol etnachta he
notes: No dagesh appears in the shin; however, a smudging possibly due to erasure appears between the first two horns of the shin.
BHL has no dagesh in the shin. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from tsadi.
refuni: he patah tsadi dagesh patah dalet dagesh hiriq yod qof hiriq etnachta yod final-mem
changeuni: he patah tsadi patah dalet dagesh hiriq yod qof hiriq etnachta yod final-mem
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the tsadi.
BHL has a dagesh in the tsadi. BHLA has no dagesh in the tsadi.

description: Examine dagesh on second nun.
refuni: alef tsere yod nun segol merkha nun dagesh vav dagesh
changeuni: alef tsere yod nun segol merkha nun dagesh vav dagesh
notes: A distinctive bump occurs on the leading edge of the vav. It is well-positioned vertically and dark, but is small and in contact with the vav. It will remain a dagesh in the text.
BHL has a dagesh in the second nun. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: shin shin-dot segol yod dagesh hiriq pe dagesh merkha vav holam lamed
changeuni: shin shin-dot segol yod hiriq pe dagesh merkha vav holam lamed
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the yod.
BHL has no dagesh in the yod. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add dagesh to tet. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav hiriq meteg yod tet hiriq meteg yod bet sheva final-kaf qamats mahapakh
changeuni: vav hiriq meteg yod tet dagesh hiriq meteg yod bet sheva final-kaf qamats mahapakh
notes: The text is of poor quality around this word. A well-positioned and well-formed, but light dagesh appears in the tet. Adding a dagesh to the tet and a note 't'.
BHL has no dagesh in the tet. BHLA has a dagesh in the tet.

description: Change mahapakh on kaf to yetiv.
refuni: kaf dagesh hiriq mahapakh yod
changeuni: kaf dagesh hiriq yetiv yod
notes: The accent on the kaf has the prepositive position of yetiv.
BHL has a yetiv on the kaf. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Verify darga is under the dalet.
refuni: lamed sheva mem hiriq gimel dagesh qamats dalet darga vav holam lamed
changeuni: lamed sheva mem hiriq gimel dagesh qamats dalet darga vav holam lamed
notes: A darga is clearly present in both the LC and UXLC.
BHL has a darga under the dalet and agrees with the existing UXLC text. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof dagesh patah mahapakh het
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq qof dagesh patah mahapakh het
notes: No dagesh occurs in the yod.
BHL has a dagesh in the yod. BHLA has no dagesh in the yod.

description: Remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof dagesh qamats resh sheva alef munah vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq qof dagesh qamats resh sheva alef munah vav dagesh
notes: NO dagesh is apparent in the yod.
BHL has a dagesh in the yod. BHLA has no dagesh in the yod.

description: Move mahapakh from under the gimel to under the dalet.
refuni: gimel qamats mahapakh dalet vav holam lamed
changeuni: gimel qamats dalet mahapakh vav holam lamed
notes: The mahapakh is under the dalet, not the gimel. The shape of the mahapakh is more curved on the left side than normal, however.
BHL has the mahapakh under the dalet. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change tsere under alef to segol.
refuni: alef tsere tav maqaf
changeuni: alef segol tav maqaf
notes: The accent under the alef is clearly a segol.
BHL has a segol under the alef. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Note possible dagesh in the first nun and weak dot in tsere under the tav. Add note 't'.
refuni: yod hiriq nun sheva tav dagesh tsere final-nun maqaf
changeuni: yod hiriq nun sheva tav dagesh tsere final-nun maqaf
notes: The text is in good condition near this word. A reddish blob appears in nun; it is poorly formed and ill-positioned, compared to the dagesh in the tav. The blob will not be transcribed as a dagesh. The leading dot in the tsere under the tav is reddish and small but well-formed and well positioned. It will remain a tsere.
BHL has no dagesh in the nun and a tsere under the tav. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove meteg under dalet and remove dagesh from yod.
refuni: dalet dagesh qamats meteg nun hiriq yod dagesh tsere tipeha alef lamed
changeuni: dalet dagesh qamats nun hiriq yod tsere tipeha alef lamed
notes: Neither a meteg under the dalet nor a dagesh in the yod are apparent in the LC. Ben Denckla: "... though the tsere and tipeḥa are displaced very "late," we still transcribe them as belonging to the yod, not the alef. They are "late" probably not only because of the inherent narrowness of the yod, but also because we see the somewhat-common "yod nested in nun" construct here".
BHL has no meteg under the dalet; it does have a dagesh in the yod. BHLA has no meteg under the dalet and no dagesh in the yod.

description: Change merkha to meteg under dalet. Ignore possible dagesh.
refuni: dalet hiriq merkha yod
changeuni: dalet hiriq meteg yod
notes: This is the second of 3 די in this verse, not counting the initial ודי. A reddish, small, but well-positioned dot appears in the dalet. Because the dalet has a clear rafe mark on the dalet no dagesh will be transcribed. No maqaf appears on this word in the LC.

BHL has a meteg after a hiriq on the dalet and the word ends with a maqaf. No dagesh appears in the dalet. BHLA has meteg after a hiriq in the dalet without a dagesh in the dalet and without a final maqaf.

description: Segol under the dalet has a weak lower dot. Add a note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva telisha-gedola he patah dalet dagesh segol qof segol tav
changeuni: vav sheva telisha-gedola he patah dalet dagesh segol qof segol tav
notes: The dot below the tsere is reddish and light; however, it is well-sized and well-positioned. The text does not have many extraneous dots near this word. The vowel will continue as segol.
BHL has a tsere under the dalet. BHLA has a segol under the dalet with a '?' in parentheses.

description: Add dagesh to he.
refuni: alef hataf-segol lamed qamats munah he
changeuni: alef hataf-segol lamed qamats munah he dagesh
notes: The he has a smudge in its trailing leg. In that smudge is a dot in contact with the interior of the leg that is well-sized and distinct. It will be transcribed as a dagesh.
BHL has a dagesh in the he. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add dagesh to tet.
refuni: bet dagesh tsere lamed sheva tet sheva shin shin-dot patah alef tsadi dagesh patah resh pashta
changeuni: bet dagesh tsere lamed sheva tet dagesh sheva shin shin-dot patah alef tsadi dagesh patah resh pashta
notes: A dark, well-formed, slightly off-positioned dagesh is evident in the tet.
BHL has no dagesh in the tet. BHLA has a dagesh in the tet.

description: Add dagesh to tet.
refuni: bet dagesh tsere lamed sheva tet sheva shin shin-dot patah alef tsadi dagesh patah geresh resh
changeuni: bet dagesh tsere lamed sheva tet dagesh sheva shin shin-dot patah alef tsadi dagesh patah geresh resh
notes: A dark and well-positioned dagesh is evident in the tet.
BHL has no dagesh in the tet. BHLA has a dagesh in the tet.

description: Add dagesh to tet.
refuni: bet dagesh tsere lamed sheva tet sheva shin shin-dot patah alef tsadi dagesh patah resh pashta
changeuni: bet dagesh tsere lamed sheva tet dagesh sheva shin shin-dot patah alef tsadi dagesh patah resh pashta
notes: The name בלטשאצר appears 3 times in this verse. Of these 3 instances, word 14 is the second instance and the only one in the LC which has a dagesh in the tet.
BHL has no dagesh in any instance of בלטשאצר in this verse. BHLA has a dagesh in the second (this) instance of the word.

description: Change hiriq to sheva under pe.
refuni: vav dagesh pe hiriq shin shin-dot sheva resh tsere alef pashta
changeuni: vav dagesh pe sheva shin shin-dot sheva resh tsere alef pashta
notes: A clear sheva is present under the pe.
BHL has a hiriq under the pe. BHLA has a sheva under the pe.

description: Remove dagesh from vav.
refuni: yod sheva het patah vav dagesh hiriq nun dagesh patah zaqef-qatan nun hiriq yod
changeuni: yod sheva het patah vav hiriq nun dagesh patah zaqef-qatan nun hiriq yod
notes: No dagesh is evident in the vav.
BHL has a dagesh in the vav. BHLA has no dagesh in the vav.

description: Add dagesh to he.
refuni: dalet dagesh sheva nun qamats meteg he sof-pasuq
changeuni: dalet dagesh sheva nun qamats meteg he dagesh sof-pasuq
notes: Although the dot in the he is slightly reddish, it is well-sized and well-positioned.
BHL has no dagesh in the he. BHLA has a dagesh in the he.

description: Examine vowel under yod as possible tsere, rather than segol.
refuni: dalet dagesh qamats nun hiriq yod dagesh segol zaqef-qatan alef lamed
changeuni: dalet dagesh qamats nun hiriq yod dagesh segol zaqef-qatan alef lamed
notes: Although irregular and smeared, the mark under the two dots of the putative tsere is dark and well-positioned.
BHL has a tsere under the yod. BHLA has a segol under the yod.

description: Examine possible vav following mem.
refuni: alef qubuts mem patah yod dagesh qamats darga alef
changeuni: alef qubuts mem patah yod dagesh qamats darga alef
notes: The trailing lower vertical component of the mem is split. This is likely due to ink fracturing and removal than an intentional added vav.
BHL has no vav after the mem. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Ambiguous vowel under the bet. Add note 't'.
refuni: tav hiriq tav sheva het patah bet dagesh patah zaqef-qatan lamed
changeuni: tav hiriq tav sheva het patah bet dagesh patah zaqef-qatan lamed
notes: The text quality is poor. The vowel under the bet is ambiguous and might be a qamats.
BHL has a patah under the bet. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from he.
refuni: vav sheva lamed tsere qadma he dagesh
changeuni: vav sheva lamed tsere qadma he
notes: The text quality is poor; however, no plausible dagesh is evident in the he.
BHL has a dagesh in the he. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine accent over bet. Add note 't'.
refuni: lamed sheva yod patah tsadi dagesh qamats bet qamats zaqef-qatan alef
changeuni: lamed sheva yod patah tsadi dagesh qamats bet qamats zaqef-qatan alef
notes: The text is of poor quality. The upper dot of the current zaqef-qatan is weak, but well-positioned. The lower dot is low for a revia.
BHL has a zaqef-qatan over the bet. BHLA has no entry for this word in this verse.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: dalet dagesh hiriq meteg yod maqaf
changeuni: dalet dagesh hiriq meteg yod
notes: No maqaf is evident in the LC.
BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHLA has no maqaf at the end of this word.

description: Add dagesh to nun.
refuni: ayin segol lamed sheva yod vav holam nun hiriq tipeha yod final-nun
changeuni: ayin segol lamed sheva yod vav holam nun dagesh hiriq tipeha yod final-nun
notes: The dagesh in the nun is dark, well-sized, and well-positioned.
BHL has no dagesh in the nun. BHLA has a dagesh in the nun.

description: Change hiriq under yod to sheva.
refuni: he qamats alef patah revia yod hiriq lamed
changeuni: he qamats alef patah revia yod sheva lamed
notes: This word is the first of two instances of האיל in the verse. The upper dot of the putative sheva is reddish, but well-sized and well-positioned.
BHL has a hiriq under the yod. BHLA has a sheva under the yod.

description: Change zaqef-qatan to revia over alef.
refuni: he qamats alef patah zaqef-qatan yod hiriq lamed
changeuni: he qamats alef patah revia yod hiriq lamed
notes: This word is the second of two instances of האיל in the verse. Evidence of erasure appears over the revia, suggesting it was originally a zaqef-qatan.
BHL has a revia over the alef. BHLA has an entry for the first instance of האיל in this verse.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: vav sheva ayin patah mahapakh lamed maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva ayin patah mahapakh lamed
notes: No maqaf is evident at the end of this word. An odd circle does appear under/in the lamed, however.
BHL has no maqaf at the end of this word. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine possible dagesh in first yod.
refuni: vav patah meteg yod sheva het patah zayin dagesh sheva qof tsere meteg nun hiriq yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: vav patah meteg yod sheva het patah zayin dagesh sheva qof tsere meteg nun hiriq yod sof-pasuq
notes: The text quality is good. The first yod is fatter in its lower portion than the second yod. Although a slight, blurred protrusion occurs in the first yod in a position appropriate for a dagesh, the overall addition is a blob of ink, not a dagesh.
BHL has no dagesh in the first yod. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine first letter in word.
refuni: vav dagesh meteg bet sheva dalet patah bet dagesh sheva resh mahapakh vav holam
changeuni: vav dagesh meteg bet sheva dalet patah bet dagesh sheva resh mahapakh vav holam
notes: This is likely to be poor penmanship. The author suggests that the scribe mis-drew the second letter as a kaf and crudely corrected it to a bet, resulting in a gimel-like leg at the base of the vav. Note that the top of the vav is smeared onto the top of the bet. A gimel is extremely unlikely here.
BHL has an initial vav with a dagesh (acting as a shureq) and meteg followed by a bet with a sheva. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add dagesh to he.
refuni: vav qamats alef holam meteg mem sheva resh qamats tevir he
changeuni: vav qamats alef holam meteg mem sheva resh qamats tevir he dagesh
notes: A dark, well-positioned dagesh appears in the he. The text is in good condition here.
BHL has no dagesh in the he. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine vowel below the lamed.
refuni: alef qamats he hataf-qamats lamed segol munah yod
changeuni: alef qamats he hataf-qamats lamed segol munah yod
notes: The lower dot of the putative segol below the lamed is reddish, but dark and well-positioned.
BHL has a tsere below the lamed. BHLA has a segol below the lamed.

description: Examine fourth letter, a probable vav. Add note 't'.
refuni: tet patah lamed sheva mem munah vav holam final-nun
changeuni: tet patah lamed sheva mem munah vav holam final-nun
notes: The fourth letter has only its top in ink. A clear shadow of a vav is present, however. This might be an erasure or might be an unintentional loss of ink, e.g., flaking off. The transcription assumes the loss of ink on the vav was unintentional and keeps the vav. This is assumption agrees with Dotan's BHL. A transcription note 't' is added to reflect the uncertainty of the decision, however.
BHL has a vav as the fourth letter. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine vowel below the resh and for possible splitting of word after the yod. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva alef patah het hataf-patah resh tsere yod kaf tsere gereshayim final-nun
changeuni: vav sheva alef patah het hataf-patah resh tsere yod kaf tsere gereshayim final-nun
notes: The text is of good quality. Three dots appear in a horizontal line under the resh; the first two are in contact. This is probably poor penmanship. No maqaf is apparent between the yod and the kaf. Word gaps are hard to judge and no gap is obvious between the yod and the kaf. Splitting the word at the yod without a maqaf leaves the first part of the word without an accent, however. Adding note 't'.
BHL has a tsere below the resh; it has a maqaf after the yod, starting a new word, כן. BHLA has a tsere below the resh; it has a space after the yod, starting a new word, כן.

description: Examine vowel below the he.
refuni: lamed qamats he segol final-mem pashta
changeuni: lamed qamats he segol final-mem pashta
notes: Chipping of the ink has occurred in this word. The lower dot of the vowel beneath the he is light, but well-sized and well-positioned. The other dots of the segol show signs of ink chipping.
BHL has a segol below the he. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine sheva below vav. Add dagesh to vav. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva kaf tsere final-nun maqaf
changeuni: vav dagesh sheva kaf tsere final-nun maqaf
notes: The upper dot of the putative sheva under the vav is very weak, but well-positioned. A very clear dagesh is present in the vav, however.
BHL has a sheva below the vav. BHLA has a sheva below the vav; however, it has a dagesh in the vav.

description: Examine first letter. Change vowel under the pe to patah. Add note 't'.
refuni: yod hiriq pe dagesh segol lamed maqaf
changeuni: yod hiriq pe dagesh patah lamed maqaf
notes: The text is in poor condition, with much chipping of ink. (The image shows the final yod of the previous word.) The outline of a chipped yod at the start of this word is evident. The vowel below the pe could be a patah, a segol, or qamats. The shape of the upper portion of the vowel is more like a broken bar than two dots; this would make the vowel either a patah or qamats. The lower portion of the vowel appears to be an erasure, rather than chipping, as the shape of the area is too large to be a chipped dot. The vowel will be transcribed as a patah and a note 't' added.
BHL has an initial yod and a segol under the pe. BHLA has an initial yod and a qamats under the pe.

description: Remove dagesh from shin.
refuni: vav patah het hataf-patah mem hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
changeuni: vav patah het hataf-patah mem hiriq shin shin-dot hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
notes: No dagesh is evident in the shin.
BHL has a dagesh in the shin. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add dagesh to samekh.
refuni: vav patah meteg nun dagesh hiriq samekh sheva ayin qamats gereshayim he
changeuni: vav patah meteg nun dagesh hiriq samekh dagesh sheva ayin qamats gereshayim he
notes: The quality of the text is good around this word. A dark, but ill-positioned, dagesh is in the samekh.
BHL has no dagesh in the samekh. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change meteg to merkha under the first he.
refuni: he qamats meteg yod sheva tav qamats tevir he
changeuni: he qamats merkha yod sheva tav qamats tevir he
notes: The thin line after the qamats on the first he has the required northeast-to-southwest inclination of a merkha.
BHL has a merkha after the qamats under the first he. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from shin. Add note 't'
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh holam munah ayin hataf-patah resh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot holam munah ayin hataf-patah resh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
notes: The shin has only a very faint hint of a dagesh. (The shin-dot is not clear either.) The shin will be transcribed without the dagesh and a note 't' added.
BHL has a dagesh in the shin. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: vav sheva alef hiriq final-mem maqaf
changeuni: vav sheva alef hiriq final-mem
notes: No maqaf is apparent at the end of this word.
BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHLA has no maqaf at the end of this word.

description: Remove meteg under the mem. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem patah meteg he hataf-patah lamed qamats kaf hataf-patah final-kaf qamats tipeha
changeuni: mem patah he hataf-patah lamed qamats kaf hataf-patah final-kaf qamats tipeha
notes: An erasure appears between the patah under the mem and the sheva under the he. A small lower dot of a possible meteg remains in the region. The current form of the text is transcribed without the meteg and a note 't' added.
BHL has no meteg under the mem. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change merkha to munah under the bet.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats merkha alef
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats munah alef
notes: The sharp bend in the accent is distinct, making it a munah. The line emerging from the top leading arm of the alef is from a tipeha on the preceding word 8 of this verse.
BHL has a munah under the bet. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change zaqef-qatan over the mem to revia. Add note 't'.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qamats mem patah zaqef-qatan yod hiriq final-mem
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh qamats mem patah revia yod hiriq final-mem
notes: An erasure appears above the trailing edge of the mem. In the erasure is a fractured dot that might be considered part of a zaqef-qatan; however, this dot is offset too far to the left for it to be part of a zaqef-qatan. It will be transcribed as a revia.
BHL has a zaqef-qatan over the mem. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Move tipeha from under pe to under het.
refuni: he patah pe dagesh segol tipeha het qamats he
changeuni: he patah pe dagesh segol het qamats tipeha he
notes: The tipeha is clearly under the het.
BHL has the tipeha under the het after the qamats. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change accent from munah to tipeha under the resh.
refuni: kaf dagesh patah dalet dagesh sheva bet qamats resh hiriq munah yod final-mem
changeuni: kaf dagesh patah dalet dagesh sheva bet qamats resh hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
notes: The accent under the resh is clearly a tipeha and not a munah.
BHL has a tipeha under the resh. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine the very ambiguous markings under the yod and resh. Add note 't'.
refuni: lamed sheva yod qamats meteg resh sheva alef tsere meteg nun hiriq yod sof-pasuq
changeuni: lamed sheva yod qamats meteg resh sheva alef tsere meteg nun hiriq yod sof-pasuq
notes: The text is of poor quality with lots of chipped ink in this region. Credible shevas appear under both the lamed and the resh. A very chipped potential qamats then meteg pair might be assumed under the yod. A light, smeared horizontal bar appears under the resh. It is too high to be transcribed as a patah. The current text's qamats then meteg will be retained. A transcription note 't' is added.

BHL has a qamats then meteg under the yod. It has a sheva under both the lamed and the resh. That is, the BHL does not consider the horizontal bar under the resh to be part of the text. BHLA has a qamats, meteg under the yod and a hataf-patah under the resh. That is, BHLA considers the horizontal bar under the resh to be part of the text.

description: Remove patah under the ayin.
refuni: yod tsere shin shin-dot darga vav dagesh ayin patah
changeuni: yod tsere shin shin-dot darga vav dagesh ayin
notes: No patah is evident under the ayin.
BHL has a patah under the ayin. BHLA has no patah under the ayin.

description: Add meteg under yod after the hiriq.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav dagesh qubuts tevir
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav dagesh qubuts tevir
notes: A meteg is evident under the yod.
BHL has no meteg under the yod. BHLA has a meteg after the hiriq under the yod.

description: Examine possible dagesh in tav. Add note 't'.
refuni: he vav holam dalet patah munah ayin patah tav qamats
changeuni: he vav holam dalet patah munah ayin patah tav qamats
notes: The text is chipped in this region. The patah under the ayin is clear. A possible chipped dagesh appears in the tav; however, it is too faint to be transcribed here.
BHL has a sheva under the ayin and dagesh in the tav. BHLA has a patah under the ayin and dagesh in the tav.

description: Change qadma to pashta on kaf.
refuni: vav sheva resh vav dagesh het hataf-patah final-kaf qamats qadma
changeuni: vav sheva resh vav dagesh het hataf-patah final-kaf qamats pashta
notes: The accent above the kaf is on the left side of the consonant.
BHL has a pashta over the kaf. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine accent under first nun. Add note 't'.
refuni: nun holam meteg tav sheva nun hiriq tevir yod final-mem
changeuni: nun holam meteg tav sheva nun hiriq tevir yod final-mem
notes: A light and chipped near-vertical mark is under the nun. It could be either a meteg or a merkha. Add note 't'.
BHL has a merkha under the first nun. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove hiriq from under yod.
refuni: mem hiriq yod dagesh hiriq shin sin-dot sheva resh qamats alef tsere meteg lamed sof-pasuq
changeuni: mem hiriq yod dagesh shin sin-dot sheva resh qamats alef tsere meteg lamed sof-pasuq
notes: No hiriq is apparent under the yod.
BHL has a hiriq under the yod. BHLA has no hiriq under the yod.

description: Remove dagesh from shin.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the shin.
BHL has a dagesh in the shin. BHLA has no dagesh in the shin.

description: Examine dagesh in shin.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
notes: A light dot appears in the appropriate place in the shin.
BHL has a dagesh in the shin. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from shin.
refuni: bet dagesh patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
changeuni: bet dagesh patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
notes: No hint of a dagesh is present in the shin.
BHL has a dagesh in the shin. BHLA has no dagesh in the shin.

description: Remove dagesh from shin.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh patah bet dagesh qamats etnachta tav
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot patah bet dagesh qamats etnachta tav
notes: No hint of a dagesh appears in the shin.
BHL has a dagesh in the shin. BHLA has no dagesh in the shin.

description: Remove patah from he.
refuni: he patah zayin dagesh holam zaqef-qatan alef tav
changeuni: he zayin dagesh holam zaqef-qatan alef tav
notes: No patah is evident under the he.
BHL has a patah under the he. BHLA has no patah under the he.

description: Remove maqaf at end of word.
refuni: lamed sheva bet tsere merkha yod tav maqaf
changeuni: lamed sheva bet tsere merkha yod tav
notes: The Sefaria image is cropped, the line reference above is for the cropped image. This is the second of two לבית in this verse. No maqaf is evident for this, the second לבית in the verse.
BHL has no maqaf on this word. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from first yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah tsadi dagesh hiriq munah yod gimel vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod patah tsadi dagesh hiriq munah yod gimel vav dagesh
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the first yod.
BHL has a dagesh in the first yod. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from first yod.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah mem hiriq yod dalet segol mahapakh he qamats
changeuni: vav patah yod patah ayin hataf-patah mem hiriq yod dalet segol mahapakh he qamats
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the first yod. The upper leg of the lamed on the following line is unlikely to contain a dagesh.
BHL has a dagesh in the first yod. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Move munah from first to second vav.
refuni: ayin hataf-patah vav munah vav holam final-nun
changeuni: ayin hataf-patah vav vav munah holam final-nun
notes: The munah is under the second vav, probably because of the tail in the ayin. With care, the munah could have been placed under the first vav and ayin tail.
BHL has a munah under the first vav. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine possible dagesh in final vav. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav dagesh bet qamats nun qamats yod vav pashta
changeuni: vav dagesh bet qamats nun qamats yod vav pashta
notes: The text is in good condition near this word. A reddish dot appears in the correct vertical position in the final vav. The dot is faint and is positioned too far to the left.
BHL has no dagesh in the final vav. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from nun.
refuni: he patah nun dagesh hiriq bet dagesh qamats tipeha alef
changeuni: he patah nun hiriq bet dagesh qamats tipeha alef
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the nun.
BHL has no dagesh in the nun. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from first shin.
refuni: he patah shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq munah yod
changeuni: he patah shin shin-dot hiriq shin shin-dot dagesh hiriq munah yod
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the first shin.
BHL has a dagesh in both shins. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine possible hataf-patah under het.
refuni: he patah het patah mem hiriq yod shin shin-dot hiriq yod pashta
changeuni: he patah het patah mem hiriq yod shin shin-dot hiriq yod pashta
notes: BHL has a hataf-patah under the het. BHLA has a patah under the het.

description: Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: lamed sheva ayin patah shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh tsere munah yod maqaf
changeuni: lamed sheva ayin patah shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh tsere munah yod
notes: No maqaf is evident at the end of this word. The word is the last on the line; however, a maqaf is usually inserted if the text requires it.
BHL has no maqaf at the end of this word. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change pashta on final kaf to qadma.
refuni: vav sheva ayin hiriq mem dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats pashta
changeuni: vav sheva ayin hiriq mem dagesh sheva final-kaf qamats qadma
notes: The mark above the final kaf is not sufficiently to the left (postfix) to be transcribed as a pashta.
BHL has a clear qadma over the final kaf. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change sheva under first kaf to hataf-patah.
refuni: vav dagesh meteg kaf sheva kaf qamats lamed maqaf
changeuni: vav dagesh meteg kaf hataf-patah kaf qamats lamed maqaf
notes: Under the first kaf the sheva is followed by a bar. This bar is slightly lighter, but appears to be deliberate and unerased. Hence the vowel will be transcribed as a hataf-patah.
BHL has a hataf-patah under the first kaf. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change meteg under bet to merkha. Remove maqaf from end of word.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats meteg resh sheva kaf vav dagesh maqaf
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats merkha resh sheva kaf vav dagesh
notes: The image shows both this word, word 5, and its successor. The vertical accent under the bet has a very slight tail to the left. It also has a very slight northeast-to-southwest inclination. Thus it will be transcribed as a merkha. No maqaf appears at the end of this word, word 5.
BHL has a merkha under the bet and no maqaf at the end of this word. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from qof.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof dagesh qamats he hataf-patah lamed darga vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq qof qamats he hataf-patah lamed darga vav dagesh
notes: A slight bulge appears at the top of the vertical stem of the qof. It is too slight to be transcribed as a dagesh.
BHL has a dagesh in the qof. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add meteg between sheva and patah under the alef. Add ZWJ to force visual ordering to match LC. Add note 't'.
refuni: alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot segol munah resh
changeuni: alef hataf-patah ZWJ meteg shin shin-dot segol munah resh
notes: A slightly curved mark occurs between the sheva and the patah. The comma-like shape of the meteg is a very unusual. The markings below the alef probably mean a hataf-patah vowel with a meteg accent. Other instances of a meteg 'splitting' a hataf vowel occur in the LC.
BHL has sheva, then meteg, then patah under the alef. BHLA has no entry for this verse.
changeuni_gen: alef hataf-patah zero-width-joiner meteg shin shin-dot segol munah resh

description: Remove munah under zayin. Add accent segol to het.
refuni: zayin segol munah bet patah het
changeuni: zayin segol bet patah het segol
notes: The image includes the following word, הבקר, as part of the discussion below. No munah appears under the zayin. The accent segol on the het is clear. The revia over the following word is also evident.
BHL has no munah under the zayin; it has an accent segol on the het. On the next word BHL has a revia over the qof. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

A potentially "consensus" pointing for this word pair is munah then segol with the munah under the zayin of the first word and a segol over the resh of the second word. Of interest are the erasure splotches in the image under the zayin of the first word and over the resh of the second word. This suggests a delibrate correction of the LC by a scribe contrary to the "consensus" pointing. BHL, as expected, reflects the actual LC pointing of both words. BHS has a munah then revia pointing of the two words; agreeing with the "consensus" on the first word and the LC on the second. The pre-change UXLC pointing of the first word with a munah under the zayin and a revia over the resh probably reflects the pointing of the BHS from which the WLC was transcribed.
changeuni_gen: zayin segol bet patah het segol-accent

description: Replace mahapakh under resh with darga.
refuni: shin sin-dot qamats resh tsere mahapakh yod
changeuni: shin sin-dot qamats resh tsere darga yod
notes: The darga shape is distinctive.
BHL has a darga under the resh. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Accents under the bet and alef are uncertain. Add note 't'.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats meteg alef qamats merkha he
changeuni: bet dagesh qamats meteg alef qamats merkha he
notes: Both the bet and alef have vertical bars under them. The bar under the alef is significantly longer. Generally, this would indicate that the bar under the alef is a merkha as in the present text. (This is in contrast to BHL which has a meteg under the alef.)
BHL has a merkha under the bet and a meteg under the alef. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Replace patah under lamed with qamats.
refuni: lamed patah alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot tsere resh qamats tipeha he
changeuni: lamed qamats alef hataf-patah shin shin-dot tsere resh qamats tipeha he
notes: A qamats under the lamed is evident.
BHL has a qamats under the lamed. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Move geresh from ayin to alef.
refuni: yod hiriq shin shin-dot sheva mem qamats ayin tsere geresh alef lamed
changeuni: yod hiriq shin shin-dot sheva mem qamats ayin tsere alef geresh lamed
notes: The geresh is evident on the alef.
BHL has a geresh over the ayin. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change merkha to tipeha under the nun.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva nun tsere merkha yod
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva nun tsere tipeha yod
notes: The mark under the nun is a tipeha. This is the first of three consecutive words being changed. Taken together, they change the accent pattern on the words from merkha-tipeha-merkha to tipeha-merkha-meteg.
BHL has a tipeha under the nun. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change tipeha to merkha under the pe.
refuni: yod sheva he vav holam shin shin-dot qamats pe qamats tipeha tet
changeuni: yod sheva he vav holam shin shin-dot qamats pe qamats merkha tet
notes: The near-vertical line under the pe has a slight curvature to the left at its lower end; hence a merkha will be transcribed. This is the second of three consecutive words being changed. Taken together, they change the accent pattern on the words from merkha-tipeha-merkha to tipeha-merkha-meteg.
BHL has a tipeha under the pe. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change merkha to meteg under mem.
refuni: mem segol merkha lamed segol final-kaf sheva maqaf
changeuni: mem segol meteg lamed segol final-kaf sheva maqaf
notes: The near-vertical lacks the northeast-to-southwest inclination of a merkha; it is transcribed as a meteg. This is the third of three consecutive words being changed. Taken together, they change the accent pattern on the words from merkha-tipeha-merkha to tipeha-merkha-meteg.
BHL has a meteg under the mem. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine etnachta position under second bet.
refuni: lamed sheva bet qamats bet etnachta vav holam
changeuni: lamed sheva bet qamats bet etnachta vav holam
notes: The etnachta is midway between the first and second bets.
BHL has the etnachta under the second bet. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Changes tipeha to etnachta under the nun.
refuni: shin shin-dot qamats nun hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
changeuni: shin shin-dot qamats nun hiriq etnachta yod final-mem
notes: The accent under the nun is clearly an etnachta.
BHL has hiriq then tipeha under the nun. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Move and change munah under the resh to a mahapakh under the yod.
refuni: vav sheva ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq munah yod final-mem
changeuni: vav sheva ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq yod mahapakh final-mem
notes: The accent under the resh is open to the right as expected of a mahapakh. A munah (the current text) would be open to the left.
BHL has a hiriq then munah under the resh. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change tevir under kaf to merkha.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah shin shin-dot sheva lamed hiriq yod kaf tevir vav dagesh final-mem
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh patah shin shin-dot sheva lamed hiriq yod kaf merkha vav dagesh final-mem
notes: The near-vertical bar under the kaf has a very slight northeast-to-southwest inclination and is longer than a typical meteg. The interior of the lamed has an erasure that touches small portions of the lamed and yod.
BHL has a merkha under the kaf. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add pashta to yod.
refuni: vav sheva yod segol tav segol resh pashta
changeuni: vav sheva yod segol pashta tav segol resh pashta
notes: A pashta is evident above the yod.
BHL has a pashta above the yod. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Move meteg below the qof to below the zayin. Add note 't'.
refuni: het hataf-patah zayin qamats qof meteg vav holam sof-pasuq
changeuni: het hataf-patah zayin qamats meteg qof vav holam sof-pasuq
notes: The meteg is between the zayin and the qof. Space is available to write the meteg below the qof.
BHL has the meteg below the qof. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove qadma over tav; add pashta to he.
refuni: ayin patah tav dagesh qamats qadma he
changeuni: ayin patah tav dagesh qamats he pashta
notes: The accent is clearly above the he; it is distinctly postfix and is therefore a pashta.
BHL has a qadma over the tav. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change patah under first he to hataf-patah.
refuni: mem tsere meteg he patah kaf dagesh holam he hataf-patah nun hiriq meteg yod final-mem sof-pasuq
changeuni: mem tsere meteg he hataf-patah kaf dagesh holam he hataf-patah nun hiriq meteg yod final-mem sof-pasuq
notes: The sheva component of the hataf-patah is clear.
BHL has a patah under the first he. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change darga to tevir under pe.
refuni: tet patah pe dagesh qamats darga final-mem
changeuni: tet patah pe dagesh qamats tevir final-mem
notes: The tevir is evident.
BHL has a tevir under the pe. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add telisha-qetana over resh.
refuni: mem patah ayin sheva resh qamats bet qamats he telisha-qetana
changeuni: mem patah ayin sheva resh qamats telisha-qetana bet qamats he telisha-qetana
notes: The telisha-qetana over the resh is evident. A slightly lighter and higher circle appears over the mem-ayin pair. This is a masorah circle and isn't transcribed here.
BHL has a telisha-qetana only over the he. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change darga to meteg under the resh.
refuni: ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq darga yod final-mem
changeuni: ayin segol shin sin-dot sheva resh hiriq meteg yod final-mem
notes: The accent under the mark is not squiggly like a darga. It might be a merkha, but it has no northeast-to-southwest inclination and is short. It will be transcribed as a meteg.
BHL has a darga under the resh. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Change zaqef-qatan to revia over he.
refuni: lamed sheva tet patah he tsere zaqef-qatan resh
changeuni: lamed sheva tet patah he tsere revia resh
notes: A smudge appears above the clear dot above the he. The smudge is very diffuse and too far to the right to be associated with the dot as a part of a zaqef-qatan.
BHL has a revia over the he. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from tsadi. Add note 't'.
refuni: nun sheva bet meteg vav dagesh kaf patah dalet sheva nun segol alef tsadi dagesh patah zaqef-qatan resh
changeuni: nun sheva bet meteg vav dagesh kaf patah dalet sheva nun segol alef tsadi patah zaqef-qatan resh
notes: The word נבוכדנאצר normally has a dagesh in the tsadi. The dagesh is usually placed below the upper arms of the tsadi as displayed in the modern font. Here the tsadi has a reddish blob in between its upper arms. The blob is larger than expected and positioned too far to the left. A dagesh will not be transcribed in the tsadi; however, a note 't' will be added.
BHL has a dagesh in the tsadi. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from shin.
refuni: he qamats shin shin-dot dagesh patah mem dagesh qamats he pashta
changeuni: he qamats shin shin-dot patah mem dagesh qamats he pashta
notes: No dagesh is apparent in the shin.
BHL has no dagesh in the shin. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add meteg under vav.
refuni: vav dagesh lamed sheva zayin patah resh sheva ayin hataf-patah final-kaf qamats merkha
changeuni: vav dagesh meteg lamed sheva zayin patah resh sheva ayin hataf-patah final-kaf qamats merkha
notes: The text is of good quality and clearly shows a meteg under the vav.
BHL has a meteg under the vav. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove first pashta from tav.
refuni: alef hataf-patah bet holam tav segol pashta yod final-kaf qamats pashta
changeuni: alef hataf-patah bet holam tav segol yod final-kaf qamats pashta
notes: The mark over the bet might be taken as either a holam or pashta; it can't be both. The connection between the black (presumably holam) dot and the bet is faint, making a pashta unlikely. No pashta is over the tav. It will be removed.
BHL has a holam on the bet and a first pashta over the tav. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine trace vertical line under the dalet.
refuni: vav sheva he hiriq gimel dagesh hiriq munah yod dalet vav dagesh
changeuni: vav sheva he hiriq gimel dagesh hiriq munah yod dalet vav dagesh
notes: A faint vertical line appears under the dalet. It is much lighter than any other parts of this word and appears to be an erasure. The 6-th word of following verse, Deut 17:10.6, יגידו, has a clear meteg under the dalet. The scribe may have mistaken which word he was accenting, written a meteg on this word, discovered his error, and erased the erroneous meteg.
BHL has no meteg under the dalet; Deut 17:10.6 has a meteg under the dalet. BHLA has no entry for this verse or for Deut 17:10.

description: Remove sheva from under first nun. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh hiriq nun sheva yod qamats mem hiriq revia yod final-nun
changeuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh hiriq nun yod qamats mem hiriq revia yod final-nun
notes: The image is the LC body text which consists of the ketiv consonants, מבן־ימין (2 words), with the qere pointing. The qere consonants, מבנימין, appear to the right of the column and have no space or maqaf. The first nun is in the qere is a nun (נ); a not a final nun (ן). Words 3, 4, 5 of the UXLC represent both the LC body text and the qere consonants; words 3, 4 contain the ketiv variants for this image; UXLC word 5 is the qere variant, shown in the Reference/Change above. No sheva is present under the first nun in the image; hence, the qere has no sheva under the nun. The usual spelling of Benjamin, בִנְיָמִן, is with a sheva under the first nun. A transcription note 't' will be added.

BHL has a maqaf after the first nun (ן) in the ketiv; it has no maqaf and sheva on the first nun (נ) in the qere. BHLA has a maqaf after the first nun (ן) in the ketiv; it has no maqaf and no sheva on the first nun (נ) in the qere. Both BHL and BHLA effectively consider the final nun (ן) and maqaf in the LC body text to be part of the ketiv.

description: Examine weak maqaf following the final nun, the second consonant, in the LC word. Add note 't'.
refuni: mem final-nun maqaf
changeuni: mem final-nun maqaf
notes: The image is the LC body text which consists of the ketiv consonants, מן המערה (2 words), with the qere pointing. The qere consonants, מהמערה, appear to the left of the column. Words 6, 7, 8 of the UXLC represent both the LC body text and the qere consonants; words 6, 7 contain the ketiv variants for this image; UXLC word 6 is the first ketiv variant, shown in the Reference above. This change is to the UXLC word 6, מן־, the first ketiv word. The maqaf between the final nun following the first mem is very faint in the image. A note 't' will be added following the maqaf in ketiv word 6.
BHL agrees with the UXLC text in both the qere and ketiv variants. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove meteg under he. Add note 't'.
refuni: he hiriq meteg yod alef maqaf
changeuni: he hiriq yod alef maqaf
notes: The image is the LC body text which consists of the ketiv consonants, הוא־והיא (2 words), with the qere pointing. The first qere consonants, היא appear the right of the column, the second qere consonants, והוא , appear to the left of the column. Words 6, 7, 8, 9 of the UXLC represent both the LC body text and the qere consonants; words 6, 7 contain the ketiv variants for this image; UXLC word 8 is the first qere word, shown in the Reference/Change above. This change is to the UXLC word 8, a qere word. No meteg is apparent under the he, only a hiriq. The evidence for a maqaf between the alef and the second vav is weak. A note 't' will be added to this first qere word; this note about the maqaf also applies to the UXLC ketiv word 6.
BHL agrees with this change in both the qere and ketiv. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

notes: This word is the first qere component of a two word qere, עַל־כֵּ֥ן. The two qere words are part of qere-without-ketiv variant, where the second qere word, כֵּ֥ן, has no matching ketiv word. The tsere, merkha pointings under the lamed belong to the second qere whose letters, כן, are shown in the left margin along with the Masoretic note: qere and no ketiv.

description: Positioning of etnachta under nun is uncertain. Add note 't' after nun.
refuni: he patah meteg het hataf-patah nun qubuts etnachta yod vav holam tav
changeuni: he patah meteg het hataf-patah nun qubuts etnachta yod vav holam tav
notes: The positioning of the etnachta under the nun is uncertain; it might belong to the yod because the etnachta is shadowed by the foot of the nun. Add note 't'. The uncertainty was noted by Daniel Holman and Avi Kadish as well as the author.
BHL has the etnachta under the nun. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Move meteg from nun to qere yod.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva nun qamats meteg yod vav holam tav sof-pasuq
changeuni: bet dagesh sheva nun qamats yod meteg vav holam tav sof-pasuq
notes: The letters in the LC body text shown in the image are for the ketiv; they have the vav preceding the yod. The word in question is the qere variant and its letters are shown in the margin of the LC; they're in the expected yod then vav order. In the body text image above the meteg (acting as a siluq) is clearly under the ketiv vav (the qere yod) and not the nun. Hence, in the qere the meteg belongs under the yod. Here the writer has carefully displaced the meteg away from the foot of the nun to avoid confusion.
BHL has the meteg under the yod. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Move meteg from yod to first vav.

changeuni: vav patah meteg yod dagesh patah ayin hataf-patah lamed tipeha vav dagesh
notes: The meteg is under the patah on the first vav. The mark is not from the line below. Thus, the meteg belongs to the vav, not the yod. The CGJ under the yod is no longer necessary and has been removed.
BHL has the meteg after the first patah under the first vav. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: * Remove dagesh from last vav; place a qubuts under next-to-last vav in qere word. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav sheva yod hiriq meteg shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav mahapakh vav dagesh
changeuni: vav sheva yod hiriq meteg shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav qubuts mahapakh vav
notes: The qere letters in the right margin, וישתחוו, end in two vavs, whereas the (ketiv) body text shown in the image ends in a single vav. A problem arises as to how to distribute the 2 vowel/accent markings (qubuts, mahapakh) shown on the (ketiv) body text vav among the two vavs of the qere. The conventional assignment is to place the mahapakh on the next-to-last vav and place a dagesh (acting as a shuruq dot) on the final vav. (וְיִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֤וּ as in the reference text and the BHL body text). This replaces the qubuts with a dagesh acting as a shuruq dot on the final vav. The UXLC retains the qubuts on the next-to-last vav to be true to the LC image. A transcription note 't' is added to emphasize this decision.
BHL has qere has a mahapakh on the next-to-last vav and a dagesh on the last vav. BHLA has no entry for this word but has an entry for word 10; the entry for word 10 agrees with the UXLC text.

description: * Remove dagesh in last vav; place a qubuts on next-to-last vav in qere word. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav dagesh meteg vav dagesh sof-pasuq
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq meteg shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav dagesh qubuts meteg vav sof-pasuq
notes: The qere letters in the left margin, וישתחוו, end in two vavs, whereas the (ketiv) body text shown in the image ends in a single vav. A problem arises as to how to distribute the 3 vowel/accent markings (dagesh, qubuts, meteg) shown on the (ketiv) body text vav among the two vavs of the qere. The conventional assignment is to place a dagesh on each of the last two vavs, leaving the meteg on the next-to-last vav (וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוּֽוּ׃ as in the reference text and the BHLA qere). This replaces the qubuts with a dagesh acting as a shuruq dot. The same word appears as an ordinary word with a merkha accent in Gen 27:29.10. The UXLC places the qubuts on the next-to-last vav to be true to the LC image. A transcription note 't' is added to emphasize this decision.

BHL has qere has no dagesh on the next-to-last vav and a dagesh in the last vav; the meteg is on the next-to-last vav. BHLA agrees with the markings on the marked ketiv above, but has a dagesh on the last two vavs with the meteg on the next-to-last vav.

description: Remove unsupported maqaf at end of word.
refuni: mem patah he maqaf
changeuni: mem patah he
notes: The image shows words 5 and 6 of this verse. The qere letters for this word (מה) and its successor (זה) appear on separate lines in the left margin; no maqaf appears these letters. No maqaf is apparent in the ketiv letters (מזה) of the body text shown in the image. The letter he of this word is not in the ketiv letters but is taken from the qere letters for this word.
BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove dagesh from qere bet.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva ayin tsere merkha bet segol resh
changeuni: bet sheva ayin tsere merkha bet segol resh
notes: The qere letters in the right margin (בעבר) replace the mem of the ketiv body text with a bet. The mem does not contain a dagesh in the body text; thus, the bet should not contain a dagesh. This action is the reverse of that on the following Josh 24:15.21.
BHL has a dagesh in the bet. BHLA has no dagesh in the bet of this word.

description: Add dagesh to qere mem.
refuni: mem tsere ayin tsere munah bet segol resh
changeuni: mem dagesh tsere ayin tsere munah bet segol resh
notes: The bet of the ketiv body text contain a clear dagesh. Therefore the mem, which replaces the bet in the qere, must have a dagesh. This action is the reverse of that of the preceding Josh 22:7.13.
BHL has no dagesh in the qere. BHLA has a dagesh in the mem.

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from bet in qere-without-ketiv word.
refuni: bet dagesh sheva nun tsere munah yod
changeuni: bet sheva nun tsere munah yod
notes: The image shows UXLC words 14 and 16; the word in question is a qere without ketiv word that has no letters in the ketiv body text. The bet with a dagesh in the image belongs to the following word, not the word in question. The qere letters, בני, are visible in the right margin along with a clear "qere without ketiv" Masoretic note. Three markings for this word (sheva, tsere, munah) are evident under the vav of the previous word, אָבוּ֙. A problem arises with the dagesh in the vav of the previous word: could it belong to the bet of this word instead? The transcription leaves the dagesh in the preceding word and transcribes the bet in this word without a dagesh.

BHL has a dagesh in the qere bet, the other markings (sheva, tsere, munah) agree with the reference text. BHLA has no entry for this word; it has an entry for the following word, בִּנְיָמִ֔ן for this verse.

description: * Replace dagesh in next-to-last vav with qubuts. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod sheva tsadi patah vav dagesh zaqef-gadol vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod sheva tsadi patah vav qubuts zaqef-gadol vav dagesh
notes: The qere letters in the right margin have two vavs at the end of this word. Ketiv body text in the image has a dagesh (acting as a shuruq dot) and a qubuts on its single vav. The transcription places the qubuts marking under the next-to-last vav and retains the dagesh in the last vav. A transcription note 't' is added.
BHL has qere has a dash in the next-to-last and final vavs. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from tet in qere.
refuni: bet dagesh patah tet dagesh sheva het holam resh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh patah tet sheva het holam resh hiriq zaqef-qatan yod final-mem
notes: The ketiv word is בעפלים (hemorrhoids), whereas the qere word is בַּטְּחֹרִ֔ים (tumors). They have the same number of letters; thus the markings on the ketiv letters are directly transposable to the qere letters. The ketiv letter ayin in the body text ketiv tet has no dagesh. This is similar to the following change, 1 Sam 5:12.7, except for the accent on the qere resh. This action is explained in Dotan's BHL page xx for Deut 28:27.6: The ketiv ayin can not take a dagesh, thus the writer didn't place a dagesh there. Nevertheless, no dagesh appears in the LC to justify a dagesh in the tet.
BHL has a dagesh in the tet for the qere. BHLA has an entry only for word 6 of this verse (the reference text for word 6 agrees with BHLA).

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from tet in qere.
refuni: bet dagesh patah tet dagesh sheva het holam resh hiriq etnachta yod final-mem
changeuni: bet dagesh patah tet sheva het holam resh hiriq etnachta yod final-mem
notes: The ketiv word is בעפלים (hemorrhoids), whereas the qere word is בַּטְּחֹרִ֔ים (tumors). They have the same number of letters; thus the markings on the ketiv letters are directly transposable to the qere letters. The ketiv letter ayin in the body text ketiv tet has no dagesh. This is similar to the preceding change, 1 Sam 5:6.10, except for the accent on the qere resh. This action is explained in Dotan's BHL page xx for Deut 28:27.6: The ketiv ayin can not take a dagesh, thus the writer didn't place a dagesh there. Nevertheless, no dagesh appears in the LC to justify a dagesh in the tet.
BHL has a dagesh in the tet for the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove sheva from under first nun. Add note 't'. [Repeat]
refuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh hiriq nun sheva yod qamats mem hiriq revia yod final-nun
changeuni: mem hiriq bet dagesh hiriq nun sheva yod qamats mem hiriq revia yod final-nun
notes: This word was studied in Change file 2024.04.01; Change 2024.01.14 - 1; it is repeated here for completeness. The image is the LC body text which consists of the ketiv consonants, מבן־ימין (2 words), with the qere pointing. The qere consonants, מבנימין, appear to the right of the column and have no space or maqaf. The first nun is in the qere is a nun (נ); a not a final nun (ן). Words 3, 4, 5 of the UXLC represent both the LC body text and the qere consonants; words 3, 4 contain the ketiv variants for this image; UXLC word 5 is the qere variant, shown in the Reference/Change above. No sheva is present under the first nun in the image; hence, the qere has no sheva under the nun. The usual spelling of Benjamin, בִנְיָמִן, is with a sheva under the first nun. A transcription note 't' will be added.

BHL has a maqaf after the first nun (ן) in the ketiv; it has no maqaf and sheva on the first nun (נ) in the qere. BHLA has a maqaf after the first nun (ן) in the ketiv; it has no maqaf and no sheva on the first nun (נ) in the qere. Both BHL and BHLA effectively consider the final nun (ן) and maqaf in the LC body text to be part of the ketiv. (The UXLC agrees with BHLA.) Not re-entered in BHL statistics.

description: * Replace dagesh in final vav with qubuts under resh in qere word. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam alef mem sheva resh munah vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh holam alef mem sheva resh qubuts munah vav
notes: The qere letters in the right margin have a terminal vav that is not present in the ketiv letters of the body text. A qubuts vowel occurs before the munah under the resh. The conventional assignment is to place the munah on the resh and to place a dagesh (acting as a shuruq dot) on the final vav. (וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ as in the reference text and the BHL body text). This replaces the qubuts with a dagesh acting as a shuruq dot on the final vav. The UXLC retains the qubuts on the next-to-last vav to be true to the LC image. A transcription note 't' is added to emphasize this decision. This change is similar to that of 1 Sam 13:19.9.
BHL has a dagesh in the final vav of the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: * Replace dagesh in final vav with qubuts under resh in qere word. Add note 't'.
refuni: alef qamats mem sheva resh munah vav dagesh
changeuni: alef qamats mem sheva resh qubuts munah vav
notes: The qere letters in the right margin have a terminal vav that is not present in the ketiv letters of the body text. A qubuts vowel occurs before the munah under the resh. The conventional assignment is to place the munah on the resh and to place a dagesh (acting as a shuruq dot) on the final vav. (וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ as in the reference text and the BHL body text). This replaces the qubuts with a dagesh acting as a shuruq dot on the final vav. The UXLC retains the qubuts on the next-to-last vav to be true to the LC image. A transcription note 't' is added to emphasize this decision. This change is similar to that of 1 Sam 12.10.5.
BHL has a dagesh in the final vav of the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine qere word.
refuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh patah ayin patah resh sheva kaf munah vav holam tav
changeuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh patah ayin patah resh sheva kaf munah vav holam tav
notes: The qere letters shown in the left margin, ממערכות, contain a kaf between the resh and the vav that is not present in the ketiv letters of the body text, ממערות. The ketiv letter resh has both a sheva then munah. The usual transcription is to place the sheva on the resh and the munah on the kaf. A transcription note 't' is added.

BHL has the munah on the vav in the ketiv and a sheva on the resh the munah on the kaf in the qere. BHLA has a sheva then munah on the ketiv resh and transcribes the sheva to the resh and the munah to the kaf in the qere. The difference between BHL and BHLA is on the ketiv words, not the qere words. Thus, the UXLC reference text agrees with both the BHL and BHLA; this changed is marked as agreeing with the BHL.

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from second vav in qere word.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq vav dagesh qamats lamed sheva dalet darga vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq vav qamats lamed sheva dalet darga vav dagesh
notes: The qetiv letters in the left margin, ויולדו, have a vav after the yod; this vav is not on the ketiv letters, וילדו, of the body text. The body text shown in the image has a dagesh and a hiriq on the yod with a qamats between the yod and the lamed's sheva. Transcription of the qamats to below the second vav is reasonable; however, no support is evident for a dagesh in the second vav. (The writer could have added a qubuts near the qamats if a dagesh been intended on the second vav.)
BHL has a dagesh and qamats in the yod. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from pe in qere without ketiv word.
refuni: pe dagesh sheva resh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
changeuni: pe sheva resh qamats meteg tav sof-pasuq
notes: The image above shows the preceding ordinary word; the word in question is a qere without ketiv word whose letters do not appear in the LC body text. The marginal note has the 3 letters, פרת, and says that this is a qere without ketiv word. The body text has the markings sheva, qamats, meteg that must be applied to the 3 letters. Nothing in the image suggests a dagesh in the pe.
BHL has a dagesh and sheva on the pe and a qamats then meteg on the resh in the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove maqaf from qere word. [Repeat]
refuni: ayin patah lamed maqaf
changeuni: ayin patah lamed maqaf
notes: This change was considered in changes file 2024.04.01:2024.01.18 - 2; it is repeated here for completeness. This word is the first qere component of a two word qere, עַל־כֵּ֥ן. The two qere words are part of qere-without-ketiv variant, where the second qere word, כֵּ֥ן, has no matching ketiv word. The tsere, merkha pointings under the lamed belong to the second qere whose letters, כן, are shown in the left margin along with the Masoretic note: qere and no ketiv.
BHL has a maqaf at the end of this word. BHLA has no maqaf at the end of this word. (The UXLC agrees with BHLA.) Not re-entered in BHL statistics.

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from bet in qere word.
refuni: bet dagesh hiriq tav sheva het hiriq lamed dagesh patah tipeha tav
changeuni: bet hiriq tav sheva het hiriq lamed dagesh patah tipeha tav
notes: The qere ltters for this word, בתחלת, are given in the right margin. The ketiv body text letters lack the initial bet. The ketev body text has a hiriq preceding the ketiv initial tav. This hiriq clearly belongs to the qere bet. The body text does not support the transcription of a dagesh for the bet, however. A transcription note 't' will be added.
BHL has a dagesh in the bet of the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from yod in qere word.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq tav sheva gimel dagesh qamats ayin patah mahapakh shin shin-dot
changeuni: vav patah yod hiriq tav sheva gimel dagesh qamats ayin patah mahapakh shin shin-dot
notes: The qere letters, ויתגעש, are given in the right margin and have a yod between the vav and the tav. The hiriq appearing after the patah in the ketiv body text is clearly intended for the qere yod. No support for a dagesh on the yod is apparent.
BHL has a dagesh in the yod of the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from lamed in qere word.
refuni: he qamats alef tsere zaqef-qatan lamed dagesh segol he
changeuni: he qamats alef tsere zaqef-qatan lamed segol he
notes: The qere letters, האלה, in the right margin have the order of the lamed and final he reversed relative to those, האהל, of the ketiv body text. Most of the markings on the ketiv body text are easily applied to the qere letters. The body text does not support a dagesh in the lamed, however. This action may be explained in Dotan's BHL page xx for Deut 28:27.6: The ketiv he can not take a dagesh, thus the writer didn't place a dagesh there. Nevertheless, no dagesh appears in the LC to justify a dagesh in the lamed.
BHL has a dagesh in the lamed of the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine qere word.
refuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav merkha vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod dagesh hiriq shin shin-dot sheva tav dagesh patah het hataf-patah vav merkha vav dagesh
notes: The qere letters, וישתחוו, are shown in the left margin and end in 2 vavs, whereas the ketiv body text ends in a single vav, וישתחו. The merkha in the ketiv body text is between the het and the vav and can be attributed to the next-to-last vav.
BHL has a merkha under the next-to-last vav and a dagesh (acting as a shuruq dot) on the final vav in the qere. BHLA has an entry for this verse for word 20, but not for this word..

description: * Replace dagesh on final vav with qubuts under resh in qere word. Add note 't'.
refuni: vav patah yod sheva dalet patah bet dagesh sheva resh qadma vav dagesh
changeuni: vav patah yod sheva dalet patah bet dagesh sheva resh qubuts qadma vav
notes: The qere letters, וידברו, in the right margin end in a vav, the final vav is not present in the ketiv body text letters. A qubuts mark is shown under the resh in the image. It will replace the dagesh (acting as a shuruq dot) on the final vav.
BHL has a dagesh (acting as a shuruq dot) on the final vav in the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove unsupported sheva from final kaf. Add note 't'.
refuni: shin shin-dot sheva kaf tsere nun qamats etnachta yod hiriq final-kaf sheva
changeuni: shin shin-dot sheva kaf tsere nun qamats etnachta yod hiriq final-kaf
notes: The qere in the left margin is שכניך; the ketiv body text, שכנכי. That is, the two qere/ketiv letters yod and kaf are interchanged. Thus the marking under the ketiv kaf is intended for the qere yod; no marking is present under the ketiv yod; thus a sheva should not be added to the qere final kaf.
BHL has a hiriq on the yod and a sheva on the final kaf in the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from dalet. Add note 't'.
refuni: dalet dagesh hiriq bet sheva yod vav holam nun hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
changeuni: dalet hiriq bet sheva yod vav holam nun hiriq tipeha yod final-mem
notes: The qere in the right margin, דביונים, differs in two letters from the ketiv body text, חרייונים. The initial letter is a het and the yod is doubled in the ketiv. The qere has a dalet as the initial letter and a single yod. The het in the ketiv body text lacks a dagesh but has a hiriq. Thus, a dagesh on the qere dalet is unsupported. Dotan's assertion (pg. xx) that the writer will not place a dagesh in a letter not taking a dagesh, even in the ketiv form, may be in action here. The holam is over the 4-th letter in the ketiv body text; thus it belongs to the 4-th letter of the qere, a vav.
BHL has a dagesh in the dalet and a holam on the vav in the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Examine qere without ketiv word.
refuni: tsadi sheva bet qamats alef tipeha vav holam tav
changeuni: tsadi sheva bet qamats alef tipeha vav holam tav
notes: The image shows words 9 and 11 of the UXLC text. Word 10 is marked as a qere without ketiv in the right margin and given as צבאות. The markings sheva, qamats, tipeha, are clearly seen between the two words in the image. These markings are intended for the qere.
BHL agrees with the reference text in the qere. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Remove unsupported dagesh from bet in qere without ketiv word. Add note 't'.
refuni: bet dagesh qamats nun qamats yod vav pashta
changeuni: bet qamats nun qamats yod vav pashta
notes: The image shows words 8 and 10 of the UXLC text. Word 9 is marked as a qere without ketiv in the right margin and given as בניו. The markings qamats, qamats, pashta, are seen between the two words in the image. These markings are intended for the qere. No dagesh is indicated for the bet. It will be removed and a transcription note added,
BHL has a dagesh in the bet in the qere word. BHL doesn't show a dagesh in its ketive body text markings. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: * Replace dagesh in vav with a qubuts under het in qere word. Add note't'.
refuni: yod hiriq qof dagesh qamats etnachta het vav dagesh
changeuni: yod hiriq qof dagesh qamats etnachta het qubuts vav
notes: The qere word, יקחו, in the right margin, ends in a vav. This vav is not present in the ketiv body text, יקח. A qubuts vowel is present under the he. A small dagesh for the qof is in the upper part of the qof loop.
BHL has a dagesh in the qof and has a dagesh (acting as a shuruq dot) in the vav. BHLA has no entry for this verse.

description: Add dagesh to first mem.
refuni: mem hiriq mem dagesh sheva lamed holam tipeha final-kaf sheva
changeuni: mem dagesh hiriq mem dagesh sheva lamed holam tipeha final-kaf sheva
notes: The qere text, ממלך, in left margin, has an initial mem; the ketiv body text, במלך, has an initial bet. The image has a dagesh in both the initial bet and the following mem. A dagesh will be added to the initial mem .
BHL has no dagesh in the initial mem in the qere; otherwise, it agrees with the reference text. BHLA has no entry for this verse.
